column0: If Transformation Works Why do the Rakyat Suffer?
column3: {Lee Watt} "Rakyat suffer"...? Which rakyat are you talking about? Mahathir's cronies who now can't get handouts and concessions to Ali Baba anymore?Or is this the bums with low qualifications, no skills but want starting salary of RM3.5k?For me, things have become better and better since Pak Lah's time. Went up much more when Najib became PM. Various business opportunities around for those willing to work hard. Not those who depend on handouts and comcessions.You want me to change this good life so that Mukhriz can become PM? NO WAY!!
column4: {rahman jpc} this is what happens when u leave 'power point' experts 2 prepare n u just read it out wthout proper understanding.I still remember during d last days of saddam hussien. his information minister Muhammad saeed al- sahhaf told d press that Iraq is still winning d war despite d fact that d American soldiers were a step away from his ministry.he was captured but later released n now reportedly living in d UAE. saddam was later captured while living in n undergroung bunker n later hanged.d similitude is there. one can tell d world untruths but it wil come 2 bite n haunt u when d chips r down n yr trusted lieutenants abandon u.the pt that I m also trying 2 make here is that figures can b manipulated. if this happens, one is liable 2 b shredded 2 pieces by unbiased n honest experts.
column5: {Zalman A} Datuk,How an Islamic country SHOULD deal with wrongdoing...."Pakistan's top court on Friday disqualified Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif from office after a damning corruption probe into his family wealth, cutting short his third stint in power and ordering a criminal investigation of his family.In a surprise move, the court also dismissed Finance Minister Ishaq Dar, one of Sharif's closest allies who has been credited with steering the economy to its fastest pace of growth in a decade.But Sharif's ruling Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) party, which has a majority in parliament, is expected to name a new prime minister to hold office until elections due next year.The Supreme Court ruled unanimously that Sharif was not fit to hold office after an investigative panel alleged his family could not account for its vast wealth."He is no more eligible to be an honest member of the Parliament, and he ceases to be holding the office of prime minister," Judge Ejaz Afzal Khan said in court."But in Malaysia, MO1 is still in power - and still stealing our money.What went wrong with Malaysia?
column6: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"If Transformation Works Why do the Rakyat Suffer?"1. Now, I recalled, sometime ago, I was asking this street boy what's on his hand...it was a "Transformer" toy!...if I am not mistaken, he said something about "robots changing shapes...good robots fighting evil robots to secure resources on earth"...something like that.2. Based on that simple boy's logics, the so-called Transformation things by (Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil) Mohd Najib Abdul Razak, really sucks.3. Let me explain.Tunku transformed the three distinct geographical regions into one region called "Malaysia"...that a deep transformation.4. Tun transformed Malaysia from agrarian economy to industrial one...that's very deep too as it involved fundamental structural changes in our education system as well as the land usage to built factories.5. Najib did not change the "rough diamond" into a "Pink Diamond"...no...no...no...he didn't do it....the works have been done for him by the previous PMs, with the exception of the sleeping one.6. So, I don't know what is this so called Transformation stuffs Datuk is talking about?...seriously!...that's something new to me!...Damn, did I miss the boat or something? Again, all these bloody East Malaysians people is just a useless bunch of idiots!7. Please don't expect a noodle seller like me to understand ok, knowing Najib's character, he is a guy who loves to simply "bury his head in the sand" as he speaks.8. Just look at the number..."Inflation is going up. Last year (2016) it was 2.1%. This year’s 1st quarter was already 4.3%."...Datuk makan hempas padi ke atau makan rumput?..atau jilat "Pink Diamnond"?When GST is 6%, how come inflation was at 2.1%, or even 4.3%?Something is wrong la Datuk...the baskets of goods and services to calculate the inflation rate, simply sucks!..can BNM re-work this out-dated numbers, for heaven's sake?Jangan cakap la...biar la anakharamzadah tu cakap apa yang dia suka.9. Can someone enlighten us, what has been transformed?..economy?...education?...investment?...Police?..AG?..what?10. Najib cannot "bury his head all the time"...so, as a simple yardsticks to measure his successes, tell us in plain language, did he managed to transform the Malay Institutions like Felda, FGV, Tabung Haji, LTAT, PNB, KWP, into successful corporate giants-Transformers to secure more resources for the Malays, orOooooopssss...sorry!
column7: {Shane Zane} Its the capitalist world anyway, created for the bankers elit, what is there left for the common.
column8: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"...high income target"1. Why Najib is so obsessed with this "high income target"? 2. He is chasing a ghost. The goalpost keep on changing...the World Bank’s latest high income threshold of US$12,235 is changing all the time.3. Perhaps, he has a  Bugis-mentality about money. People like him, has this "cari duit" mentality to hit the target...like most Malays are.4. You don't "cari duit" unless it litters the street like pebbles and rubbish and you just need a vacuum cleaner to pick it up.5. Well, we all know by now, his way of "cari duit" can also be translated literally as..."curi duit"...or, "kalau tak cukup duit, tambah cukai dan tambah hutang".6. "Curi duit RM2.6 bil" yang masuk akaun peribadi MO1 senang saja kasi selesai, mana itu surat menyurat?...itu saja.7. GST and Tourism Tax...new taxes...for what?...the excuse that other countries have similar taxes won't sell...neither, the argument that UK etc has higher GST (VAT) than Malaysia is of any significance.Look at the quality our services (schools, education, border security, Internet access, roads etc) and the fundamentals of our democratic system (the AG, the Police, BNM, MACC etc)...are they similar to UK, US, Norway, Finland, Japan?...if they are, than our GST is bloody cheap indead...I think we deserve to pay a minimum of 15-20%.Even, the Most Senior "Pondan of Rengas"  got f****d up with the basic Tourism Tax!...so desperate to "cari duit"...macam mana mau jadi "Chief" kalau begini...pergi la lawat Sabah dan Sarawak, kasi explain sama durang...takut ke?8. Collecting new taxes without improving services is very wrong...zalim nama nya!9. So, what is this "high income target" that he is so proud of?...when the number of BR1M recipients keep on increasing?...when the value of our RM keep on falling?...when the cost of living spiraling upwards?10. Seriously, pensioners like me...perhaps 18-20% of us, excluding Datuk and Tun...we suffer the most...in silence...malu ba mau bising2...nanti kena marah bini pula...hari hari isap jari tengok itu harga barang naik...kalau itu "barang" yang naik, siok huga.
column9: {Aku} Kadiag, ?????? ?????Ini pandangan lain sikit :"Semalam, ketika berucap di sebuah program pelaburan antarabangsa, Invest Malaysia,  Najib seolah-olah berdiri dalam program politik tempatan dengan tampil menyerang dan memperlekehkan Pakatan Harapan serta Tun Mahathir Mohamad.Apa perlunya menyerang Pakatan Harapan dan Tun Mahathir di depan mereka, selain menunjukkan kelemahan dan jiwa kacau yang sedang melanda dirinya?Dengan berbuat demikian, beliau secara tidak langsung telah mempamerkan wajah ketakutannya kepada golongan pelabur terhadap goyangnya kedudukan kuasa yang sedang dipegangnya.Berbanding keutamaan menarik pelabur dan meyakinkan mereka mengenai prospek ekonomi negara, Najib terlihat sangat bimbang untuk menghadapi pilihanraya umum akan datang dan ini sesuatu yang tidak pernah dilakukan oleh mana-mana Perdana Menteri sebelum ini."(dari Gajahmenta.blogspot,  July 2017).Dan "... in politics. Rosmah is widely known in Malaysia as the one who wields the real power"  dari South China Morning Post (HK) (July 2017)..Dan ini semua berlatagbelakang PM Pakistan Nawab Sharif terpaksa letak jawatan, anak pompuan Islam Karimov (Uzbekistan) masok penjara, Inada, menteri pertahanan Jepun pon letak jawatan...Munkin Mad bin Saleh kata MO1 Malaya ni "making a spectacle of himself".Maghap no.Aku

column14: {Penyamun Malaya} Pendek saja soalan saya.What does a penyamun know other than menyamun?What does a liar know other than lying?Manusia yang bijak dan cerdik akan jadikan prestasi kerjanya sebagai bukti kebijaksanaannya.Tapi orang yang lemah dan bodoh akan bercakap dan memuji prestasinya untuk dibuktikan kepada orang lain.A smart person doesn't need to prove himself, he will let his performance talk by itself.But a stupid person will talk about his performance just to prove himself.
column15: {How Ironic} Regardless all the facts churned out to show how brilliant he has managing the economy,  the fact is our foreign reserves stand less than 100 billion and national debts now at 907 billion, that is his glaring performance as finance minister actually. Gross mismanagement of country's finance.When a crisis hits the economy, such as all of a sudden there's unexpected sanctions, an economic embargo or the currency nosedives into the abyss, it is our reserves which can save us from any kind of economic shock and calamities. If our foreign reserves stand at 97 billions, weak currency against the green back, how on earth can we weather the storm?By churning out stuff like GNI, trade surplus, exports, capital market, praises from IMF and World Bank, is that the way you're measuring real economic performance? Like Kadir Jasin said, if Transformation did work, why there's massive numbers of graduates waiting table at restaurants for the past several years? Why not enough high skill jobs created for the past year? Why prices skyrocketing out of control? Why massive budget cuts across the board each and every year? All of these signal that the economy is doing well and government struggle to meet its obligations. We barely enough to get by year to year. Thanks to wasteful and imprudent spendings over the years.
column16: {Sir Arthony} "He asked his listeners to look past 1MDB but he is afraid to debate the 1MDB’s so-called lapses even in Parliament where he has more members than the Opposition.."- I can't recall back in the early 90's, MPs with the likes of Lim Kit Siang or Tengku Razaleigh being prevented by the Speaker in august house from asking about Bank Negara forex loses. column19: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,- Transformation plan by Najib is designed to confuse people...very much like the concept of 1Malaysia.- There are many off-shots to this Transformation plan with various abbreviations that no one seems to have any clue...as any man on the street, no one knows.- He wants to outdo Vision 2020 with his touch of Transformation plans and the latest of which is TN50...in fact, you can't get the grip of what he says and what he does.- But, one thing is for sure...a credit must go to him....him alone...no one else, but him...he managed to transform Malaysia into a Kleptocracy...a nation of thieves and plunderers...and he is sitting on top of that piles of shit...and, that is quite an outstanding achievement!- More so, he is supported by the most extreme religious political group in the country...PAS.- Kleptocracy is neither a political nor a moral term as such that one can brush it aside, perhaps due to differences in ideology and opinions, but a very serious term with legal implications to MO1 and the nation.- KARI has no intention to embarrass Malaysia. - It has no intention to play politic either.- It means business. It means MO1 has messed up with the legal justice system in the US, that is something he must not do...like we don't want others to mess up ours. - Put the legal implication aside for a while, it creates distrust and uncertainties...and, lots of embarrassments to us ordinary Malaysians in the eyes of the world.= For the first time in 54 years, in the history of this nation...slightly after 500 years of being colonized...Najib has successfully transformed Malaysia into a Kleptocracy!Congratulation Najib!A nation of Malay Kleptocracy!A nation of Islamic Kleptocracy!Let's Celebrate the American style...https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3GwjfUFyY6MHave a good time everybody!
column20: {Suria Suraya} Point 38 of his speech:The OECD’s most recent economic assessment of Malaysia stated, and I quote: “Malaysia is one of the most successful Southeast Asian economies… thanks to sound macroeconomic fundamentals and its success in transforming its economy into a well-diversified and inclusive one.”- He's trying to take credit from someone else efforts here. Pretty much like the overhype MRT without giving due credit to the real guy who had laid the foundation of light rail system project in the country. Actually who is the REAL guy who turned Malaysia into one of the most successful Southeast Asian economies? Whose the real guy who turned Malaysia from mere importer of commodities and raw materials in the 70's into manufacturing based economy? Who is the real guy who successfully diversifying the economy? In the 70's more the 50 percent of workforce employed by the state. By the mid 1990's it went down to mere 30 percent as a result of massive growth in the private sectors of the economy. A decade after privatization policy put in place. Who's the real guy who laid this massive fundamentals in our country's economy and made it resilient to withstand any challenge such as the volatility of comodity prices in the 80's? I guess everyone knows who he is. Please give the credit where it's due. I rest my case..

column23: {Hassan} Transformasi atau Kleptokrasi?Timbalan Ketua Pemuda Amanah Faiz Fadzil berkata yang memenangkan BN dalam pilihan raya akan datang akan membuatkan Perdana Menteri Najib Razak fikir rakyat tidak peduli apa yang akan terjadi kepada negara dan kos akan terus meningkat.“Isu di sini bukan hanya rompak, tetapi kesan buruk kepada rakyat,” katanya.Faiz juga berkata yang orang Melayu patut sedar yang duit 1MDB ialah duit mereka, begitu juga duit Tabung Haji.Pada 2015 ketika syarikat sarat hutang 1MDB mempunyai masalah membayar faedah, dana haji itu membeli tanah daripada 1MDB dengan harga RM188.5 juta yang 43 kali ganda lebih mahal berbanding jumlah yang dibayar 1MDB, katanya.“Jika kerajaan nak bantu orang Islam, mengapa mereka jual tanah itu dengan harga yang sangat tinggi dan memaksa Tabung Haji membelinya. Jika orang Melayu tak marah lagi, saya pun tak tahu nak kata apa.“Jika mereka (BN) menang lagi dalam pilihan raya, mereka akan ambil banyak lagi. Akan ada 2 atau 3MDB. Kita dah tahu skandal lain melibatkan Felda, Mara dan Yapeim (Yayasan Pembangunan Ekonomi Malaysia)…kerana itu kita panggil benda ni kleptokrasi,” katanya.

column25: {Hassan} Ramai bertanya kepada saya adakah Tun Mahathir Mohamad boleh dipercayai untuk memimpin Pakatan Harapan (PH)? Bukankah beliau memiliki rekod berdekad-dekad terhadap musuh politik beliau sepanjang 22 tahun di singgahsana kuasa?Beginilah, Parti Amanah Negara (Amanah) bukan sebuah mahkamah yang akan berperanan menghukum segala kesalahan dan jenayah perilaku manusia. Amanah adalah sebuah parti politik bernuansa Islam yang menawarkan sentuhan rahmat dan kasih sayang kepada sesiapa jua yang bersedia menyantuni setiap manusia dengan dakapan lembahyung "rahmatan lil 'alamin."Menghukum manusia sekali gus berhias diri dengan dendam kesumat, biarlah menjadi ajaran terlarang dalam Amanah khususnya di kalangan pimpinan utamanya. Amanah sentiasa mendepakan tangan untuk menyuburkan kebersamaan demi memperjuangan kepentingan rakyat seterusnya negara.Tun Mahathir adalah manusia biasa yang juga ahli politik seperti mana yang lain. Beliau ada sejarah masa silam yang panjang yang sebahagian menyebutnya sebagai "baggage." Di antara kita bebas membaca masa lampau beliau dan membuat keputusan sama ada bersetuju atau tidak dengan sikap serta pendirian politik terkini beliau khususnya terhadap urus tadbir negara. Tiada sesiapapun yang boleh merampas hak dan kebebasan ini daripada sesiapa. Kita bersama menentang Datuk Seri Najib Razak kerana kesalahan beliau lakukan sekarang kepada rakyat dan negara. Permusuhan di kalangan rakyat termasuk dengan Tun Mahathir hanya akan menjadikan Najib semakin bermaharajalela di tampuk kuasa.

Kami berusaha memudahkan rakyat untuk membuat pilihan sama ada memilih Pakatan Harapan atau Barisan Nasional.Pemimpin agung dalam peradaban manusia bersifat jiwa besar, pemaaf dan tidak berdendam. column27: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"He was given a good rating by these agencies..."1. Datuk raised a very important point.2. Rating agencies, as the name implies, do rating of institutions and countries by making comparisons.3. Some rating agencies like Bloomberg use actual quantitative numerical data which is hard to dispute because numbers don't lie.Others use qualitative database like interviews to formulate its ranking. This type of rating opens to many interpretations and disputes.4. Having say that, policy and decision makers do depend on rating agencies to make well-informed decision...these are actually clients ("these people") to the rating agencies.5. The most important thing about the rating is not the final result, but the "live components"...a sets of complex mathematical equations.6. Under Najib, rating is abused to the extreme.A good example of that was..."PM Argument 4: Our currency, the ringgit, has been described by Bloomberg..."This kind of statement is not only misleading, but downright stupid.Misleading in the sense that no one of the right mind, will quote currency trend in "a snapshot" manner because currency fluctuates by the seconds, very much like the shape of Mount Kinabalu.Mr.PM, you are that stupid...people look at the trend...not, "a snapshot" of Ringgit.The trend of RM sucks like you, Mr.PM!This Chinese mama selling oranges in Pasar Malam, is far better than you are Mr.PM about the state of our Ringgit...no way, you can fool her!7. We can excuse our PM as he failed in his academic...what about our future PM with a "Ph.D"?"Zahid says Malaysian police rated best in Asean...July 27, 2017.KUALA LUMPUR: The Malaysian Police Department has been rated the best in Asean by an international body, according to Home Minister Ahmad Zahid Hamidi.Zahid, who is also deputy prime minister, DID NOT NAME the international body which had given the rating, or furnish any other details, The Star reported." (1)- Now, that was the most stupid statement from the 2nd highest-ranking officer with a "Dr." to his name.- Now, you put the two together...bingo!- Believe you me, one of their wives, has an "Honorary Doctorate" from some Maningkabau whatever! - By the way, Tun and his wife are real qualified doctors from a very reputable university...and, Azizah too.8. The best way "to sell" Malaysia and what she has to offer is by adopting these ranking agencies...especially, our education system..."it will kill many birds with one stone"..better than what we can collect from the Tourism Tax, unless you are the "Pondan Padang Rengas" who miss the forest for the trees.9. As it was not reported by mass media, for reasons known to them, our PM's good friend, China had in fact downgrading Malaysia...4 months before PM launched Invest Malaysia 2017."China rating agency downgrades M’sian outlook...April 3rd, 2017...China’s Dagong Global Credit Rating Co has downgraded Malaysia’s sovereign credit outlook to negative...(2)10. Treat rating agencies with respect as they got work to do...failing, which we just simplly off-tangent with the rest of the world. column28: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"PM Argument 2: Some 2.26 million jobs have been created..."1. Thanks for your lie, Mr.PM...refer to my posting 6:11 AM.2. 44,343 lost their jobs in 2015...financial and insurance sectors (39.8%), manufacturing (20.8%) and transportation and storage sectors (14.7%)...(1)3. 37,699 workers lost their jobs in 2016... manufacturing sector (45.9%), the wholesale and retail sectors (20.7%), finance and insurance (12.1%) and mining and quarrying (6.6%) (1)4. 6,000 public university lecturers lost their jobs in 2016...due to budget cuts...by at least 30% to 40%.  (2)5. According to the ministry, normally workers were terminated due to closure, excess workers due to restructuring, reduction in output, merger of companies, technological changes and takeovers.- the key to our industrial strength is manufacturing...manufacturing sectors suffered the most...cost of imported raw materials went up as RM plunged, squeezing the profit.- weak RM is believed to increase export...that's a lie too. Overseas buyers pay factory price in RM using USD. If manufactures increase factory price, overseas buyers simple source the same materials somewhere else, thus reduction in factory output and hence excess workers.6. Changing our economic fundamentals from manufacturing to services like massive constructions at Forest City, Bandar Malaysia, East Coast Railway Link, Pan Borneo etc...has a price tag that we all have to pay as it will create sudden socioeconomic and political imbalances.- Datuk comment is relevant..."Comment: (A) Most of the job created were low-income jobs..The creation of mostly labour-intensive and low-productivity employment in the country pushed up the share of low-skilled worker to total employment from 9.5% to 15% during the same period. We create low-income jobs more than high-income jobs."- SURVEYING THEIR NEW ‘COLONY’? CHINA’S ENVOY VISITS FOREST CITY PROJECT IN JOHOR AMID WORRIES OF A NAJIB ‘SELLOUT’ TO RAISE MONEY FOR 1MDB BAILOUT...700,000 Chinese nationals would occupy Forest City...(3)7. JackMa of AliBaba is more interested to help Chinese manufacturers selling cheap stuffs and keeping jobs in China...to him, MO1 has nothing to offer him, but he did not mind giving cheap publicity stunt to a guy like MO1!8. JackMa is not part of the equation to create new jobs in services...well, I may be wrong...so prove me wrong...why not EPU come up with some numbers to enlighten us?9. Najib's Economic Transformation Plan (ETP) sucks!...as its core fundamentals lie in - selling cheap state lands at exorbitant price for personal profiteering,- bloating prices for multi billion Mega projects without international tenders.- dubious IPOs to enrich cronies. Example, FGV, where Felda settlers were cheated to pay a premium IPO price of RM4.55 during listing ahead of PRU13, only to see its value tumbled to as low as RM1.63...wiping off some RM15 billion in value!...leaving thousands of settlers still in debt!10. column29: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,1. Since Datuk brought up this subject of Najib's Economic Transformation Plan (ETP), I did some background check to familiarize myself on certain issues.2. Launched on 25 September 2010, an initiative to turn Malaysia into a high income economy by the year of 2020...a 9-years economic plan so to speak.3. PRU13 was held on the 5th May 2013. So, he was selling this ETP idea to win the election...not bad actually.4. ETP original aim is to raise per capita income from US$6,700 (year 2010) to at least US$15,000 (by year 2020), meeting the World Bank's threshold for high income nation.5. PM Argument 1: Malaysia is getting richer. Between 2009 and 2016, Gross National Income has increased by nearly 50 percent, and GNI per capita using the Atlas method increased to US$9,850, and based on the World Bank’s latest high income threshold of US$12,235 (during the planning stage, it was USD 15,000).- With the current GNI of US$9,850 (2017) as opposed to  US$6,700 (in 2010), an increase of about 50% was correct. Mr.PM did not lie.- World Bank’s latest high income threshold of US$12,235 (previously, US$ 15,000 in 2010). Luckily, the goalpost seemed to come down rather substantially. - So, if in the last 7 years, Najib had achieved only 50% of his target...it is highly unlikely, in the next 3 years, if he is still around, he will come any closer to his target.- In plain language, Najib's ETP has failed!6. Let's go back to where it all began in 2010. ETP had stated "60% of the blueprint's investment would derived from private sector, 32% from government linked companies and the remaining 8% from the government.- only this year, we see sudden activities involving huge "investments" from China...which comes to nothing because China's OBOR is not about supporting "investments" in Malaysia's infrastructures...Wanda Group is a good example.- the 32% from GLICs?...Tabung Haji buying small parcel of TRX land?....FGV IPO was a scam!...and, many more...with 1MDB as the biggest international scam ever!7. Najib's ETP is in a real mess. He got "F"****d.8. The biggest mess is created when our ringgit plunged 42% against the US dollar between 2011 and 2016...so, everything goes with it.9. Some countries well above our ranking deserve admiration...Norway, Switzerland, US , Denmark, Sweden, but "some" are not it...Saudi Arabia, Greece, Israel, Croatia...10. But, we are on top of the world...unchallenged...as the World's Largest Kleptocracy on Earth!
column30: {RD.} "For me, things have become better and better since Pak Lah's time. Went up much more when Najib became PM."That statement must be true if Lee Watt was working in 4th. floor during the reign of Pak Lah's SIL. After Najib took over, there was no major cabinet reshuffle and its business as usual for them. Coupled with Najib's Cash is King policy, therefore, "Various business opportunities around for those willing to work hard", leewatting Rakyat's fortunes.People like Lee Watt will support UMNO-Najib because these people had no qualms, soliciting dubious middlemen such as Razak Baginda, Deepak Carpet and Jho Low, in government dealings. That's why, everything the government or GLCs buys are way above market price. More astonishingly, they even sold Rakyat's assets for a song.A case in mind was Pak Lah selling MV Agusta for 1 Euro in 2005, when they bought it at 70 Million Euro in 2004.Another example is when 1MDB bought Rakyats primeland for RM60 psf when its market value was approximately, RM3600 psf.
column31: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,Zed-85 11.38AM said..."Kalau orang Asli yang tinggal di Cameron Highland. Tangkap makanan guna sumpit, tak payah beli barang boleh jadi percaya yang ekonomi sekarang bagus."- Wow!...aku belum pernah pula ke Cameron Highland, tak sangka pula, rupa2nya masih ada orang Asli disitu yang pakai sumpit.- belakang kampung saya, ada hutan belantara Borneo, kira2 kalau masuk hutan, 4 km begitu, ada perkampungan orang asli juga...30-35 buah rumah kayu, dari bambu, atap nipah, ada juga yang pakai zink berkarat dan kepingan plywood buangan...sebiji macam apa yang kau cakap tu Zed-85.- tapi durang ni bukan pakai cawat daun kayu sudah...yang aku nampak durang masih beli pakaian terpakai dipasar tamu...beli beras, garam, gula, parang, cangkul, sabit, tukul, bateri, selipar jepun, kasut hitam plastik atau disini kami bilang "adidas kampung", topi, kapur untuk makan sireh, tembakau gulung, "suntil" (daun tembakau yang digigit dimulut), rokok seludup, kopi kisar, permainan untuk anak2, ikan kering, belacan, ajinomoto, beg sekolah, baju sekolah, kasut sekolah, pensil, pemadam, buku, susu budak, maggi mee...bukan pakai barter trading tetapi pakai duit.- durang pula cari duit berjual buah2an hutan, daging babi hutan, kadang2 madu ikut musim, sayur2 hutan, orkid hutan liar, rabung, papaya, limau asam, ubat akar2 kayu.- durang bilang dulu barang2 murah, tetapi sekarang sudah mahal...orang Malaya pernah cakap sama orang kampung, janji konon harga tidak naik bila ada GST...nasib juga ada gereja bantu mereka sikit2...nasib juga tiada letrik, tiada air, tiada telefon, kurang sikit itu belanja.- aku rasa2 la, orang yang beli "Pink Diamond" itu  lagi terasa bila harga kasut plastik sekolah naik  daripada keluarga orang asli yang masih tanggung 6 anak2 skolah?...is that a fair statement?

column0: Insentif Felda Duit Siapa?
column3: {Seri Nara al-Diraja} Tapi saya respect hutang zaman Anwar Ibrahim sebab hutang Negara terkawal. hehe
column4: {Ismail Muda} Salam Datuk, umum sudah pun mengetahui Felda hampir kekeringan dana utk membiayai operasi hariannya. Pendaparan tahunan dari pajakan tanah kpd FGV & pelaburan pasif & pelaburan baru yg belum matang hanya cukup membayai sebahagian emolumen staff. Sedih betul tengok nasib Felda sebuah agensi besar yg dulunya memiliki rezab tunai yg banyak & simpanan pelaburan serta aset yg kukuh...tiba2 jatuh menjunam di bawah seliaan Menterinya Najib.Sudah tentu insentif2 yg diumumkan ini dibayai melalui pinjaman atau penjualan aset Felda yg masih ada. Saham2 dlm Maybank & MISC yg setatutnya digunakan utk tujuan jangkapanjang spt prog replanting, atasi kejatuhan harga, mungkin akan dilupuskan semuanya utk dapatkan tunai. Tiada ape yg tinggal kecuali Menara Felda di sebelah KLCC yg dimegah2kan oleh Najib.Ketika PRU 13 lalu, Najib menabur janji menyiapkan 20 ribu unit rumah utk 2 gen Felda. Project ini gagal & sebahagian besar terbengkalai akibat kekurangan dana & masalah tanah. Kemudian Najib berjanji menjadikan penroka sebagai middle income group dgn pengapungan FGV. Kepimpinan Felda di bawah Isa Samad telah menyebakan hala tuju Felda semakin terpesong menyebabkan tugas2 hakiki menjaga kebun peneroka semakin  terabai. Isa lebih utamakan membeli hartanah hotel & dll. Kebun2 penroka tidak diurus dgn baik & hutang penroka semakin bertambah. Ramai Peneroka mengadu pokok 5-6 tahun ditanam masih bual kerja2 sulam. Sepatutnya tempoh ini sudah break even & peneroka memperolehi hasil yg baik. Akibat krisis pengurusan & kepimpinan Felda, peneroka telah dibebani hutang2 yg tinggi. Ada Peneroka mengadu kos tanam semula 10 ekar melebihi rm140 ribu & terbeban dengan bayaran loan repayment yg tinggi. Kesimpulan yg dpat dirumuskan ialah semua insentif2 yg diumumkan oleh Najib ini adalah berpunca & bertitiktolak dari kelemahan & kegagalan Menteri yg menjaga Felda. Ini juga mengesahkan dakwaan penroka sejak sekian lama spt hutang tinggi, hasil rendah & kebun semak samun yg tak diselia dgn baik. Pengumuman Najib hanya mahu menutup kegagalannya menjaga Felda & meredakan keresahan Peneroka. Pembangkang ada ruang yg banyak eksploit isu Felda...
column5: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,- Latest BNM Report 2016, hutang kerajaan sudah naik keparas  RM908.7bil (bukan RM833.75 bilion - 2015)...(1)- Hutang masa Tun = RM188.79 bil +  Hutang Badawi = RM RM317.44 bil +  Hutang Najib hingga 2016 = RM402.47 bil (bukan, RMRM376.39 bil)Jumlah hutang = RM908.7bil- Pada dasarnya, hutang itu penting untuk menjana ekonomi dan membuka peluang pekerjaan.- Walaupun, BNM kata "The Malaysian economy registered a commendable growth of 4.2% in 2016. (1)", macam ada yang tidak kenanya dengan angka 4.2% tersebut, sebab pertumbuhan ini tidak nampak dan mungkin jadi disebabkan olih harga kos sara hidup yang naik mendadak, bukan "real internal growth by volume consumption yang stagnant".- Kadar penganguran 2017 tinggi pada 507,500 orang (2)...ini tidak sihat sama sekali sebab hutang terlalu banyak masa Najib tetapi duit tidak di gunakan untuk membuka peluang pekerjaan baru.- Dengan kadar yang kasar, kalau setiap RM1 bil hutang seharusnya menjana sekurang2nya 1,500 pekerjaan baru...maka RM402.47 bil  dapat menjana 603,000...tetapi, ini tidak berlaku sebab hutang bukan untuk bikin pelaburan tetapi digunakan untuk "expenses" seperti bayar gaji untuk 1.5 kakitangan kerajaan dsbnya.- Kerajaan dapat kutip balik "expenses" semacam ini melalui GST...GST bukan cukai menjana ekonomi.- Kemana sudah itu hutang RM42 bil 1MDB?...ada ke ia sebahagian dari hutang Najib yang RM402.47 bil itu?Ba kamu orang Islam Malaya dan PAS, kasi la naik Haji itu 5,000 orang lagi, walaupun bukan dari hasil keuntungan dari 1MDB, tetapi "hutang atas hutang"...yang bayar itu hutang nanti dari corporate tax juga macam Carlsberg, Genting HIghland, Sport Toto dsbnya juga.- Hutang najib belum masuk lagi itu....RM50 bil ECRL + RM200 bil Carey Island Port + RMXX bil Bandar Malaysia + RMXXX bil Forest City + RM17 bil Pan Borneo Highway...itu semua kena bayar bos ku...bukan "investment" dari China bikin kilang2 manufacturing untuk AliBaba.- Dengan AliBaba, kita jadi pembeli saja, barang2 murah dari China, bukan tukang buat barang untuk kita eksport...betul ke itu, bos ku?Berapa AliBaba mau invest di Malaysia?...sudah masuk ke itu duit ke?Jangan fikir Najib + JackMa sama dengan macam si Trump + JackMa...tidak sama itu bos ku.si Trump is a billionare businessman-turn-President...Najib is a billionare-Kleptrocrat PM...macam tidak sama saja itu, betul ke?- Nampak2nya, hutang kerajaan akan melebihi RM1 Trillion = RM1,000,000,000,000.00...macam jadi 12  kosong tau, bukan sembilan kosong.- mau cakap apa lagi Datuk?- Selamatkan la anak2 Malaysia dari si haramzadah yang sial ini!...ini bukan main2...bukan politik ok!(1) http://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2017/03/23/highlights-of-bank-negara-malaysia-2016-annual-report/(2) https://tradingeconomics.com/malaysia/unemployment-rate
column6: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"Sogokan ini adalah pengakuan mutakhir Najib dan konco-konco beliau bahawa Umno/BN bukan lagi pilihan eksklusif di rancangan-rancangan Felda, khususnya dan di kawasan luar bandar, amnya."- bagi 25,000+ warga Felda yang datang ke Putrajaya untuk menghadiri jamuan dan perayaan Felda Settlers Day 2017, mereka nampak happy saja dapat durian runtuh nie.- mereka tak kisah duit datang dari mana Datuk, janji kata mereka dapat itu duit.- datang ke pesta itu lagi la  seronok...semua kena tanggung...itu duit juga...juta2 ringgit juga tu...bila lagi, bukan senang jumpa PM.- Najib baik...dia "giving a 2nd chance” to 17,679 peneroka yang keras kepala tak mau jual hasil pada Felda...kesian melepas sikawan2 nie tak dapat duit...sabar bos ku, kalau bekerjasama dapat juga tu, tapi next year, Feb 2018...ini signal PRU14 bukan tahun ini...atau pun satu muslihat?- Arwah kedua orang tua kami, moga2an roh mereka mendengar...selalu kasi nasihat masa kami kecik2 dulu..."jangan makan titik peluh orang, berdosa besar kalau dia tak halalkan".-  Kepada semua 94,956 peneroka Felda, tanpa kamu sedari kamu makan titik peluh orang lain...dosanya besar...tidak senang seumur hidup!- Ini nasihat karut, jangan pakai.
column7: {sukasamasuka} Datuk," Baguslah peneroka Felda mendapat durian runtuh. Tetapi siapa yang membiayainya? Silap-silap peneroka sendiri yang berhutang untuk membiayai insentif itu."- bagi Datuk, mungkin bagus...tapi, aku rasa, bukan itu yang tersirat dalam hati Datuk.- sebenarnya aku jealous.- 94,956 peneroka Felda yang setia tetap dapat duit undi awal, sedangkan aku habuk pun tarak.- mana tidaknya, peruntukan lebih dari RM1.5 bil (6 incentives Felda) ini tadi, kita tidak tau dari mana sumbernya memandangkan Felda mengalami RM1 bil deficit.- ini sikit kalau dibanding dengan reserve RM40 bil PNB...kalau bolih beli 25 nombor plat kereta, what is RM1.5 billion?...peanut!- dari mana pun sumber duit itu tadi, macam  juga duit 1MDB yang dipakai untuk naik Haji...itu bukan duit titik peluh sendiri.- begini la bagaimana, (Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil) Mohd Najib Abdul Razak, membangsatkan bangsanya sendiri...kerana mau kuasa.- aku undi UMNO pada PRU13 dengan harapan kita dapat pemimpin yang baik...itu hak aku.- aku bukan undi UMNO supaya pemimpin haramzadah UMNO itu, suka suka pakai duit titik peluh rakyat dengan sewenang2nya...itu pecah amanah nama nya.- pada saat ini, semalam ada seorang muda, seorang cikgu yang mengajar ditempat jin bertandang...7 jam kereta masuk, jalan lumpur, minum/mandi air hujan, tiada elektik, tiada telefon...dia cerita, bahawa elaun kesusahan mereka sudah dipotong dari RM1,500 kepada RM1,000...peruntukan kertas A4 pun sudah tidak ada...nasib kamu baik ba di Malaya, semua mewah...INI LA SABAH, TANAH AIR KU!- tidak apa, kamu makan la itu titik peluh orang...kamu akan ditimpah balaNya!...itu kan janjiNya!Kami orang2 tua yang sudah pencen ini...bagi pihak cikgu2 yang mengajar di pedalaman Sabah...mana mana saja ba kalau kamu orang Malaya!Ini masa kamu....
column8: {Mali Muyung} Salam Datuk,Najib sdah gagal sbg MK. Dia seharusnya menyerahkan portfolio itu pada org lain.Mungkin Datuk boleh cdgkan bila PH memetentah kelak, PM dan MK harus dipisahkan.Nampaknya kedudukan kewangan negara amat parah.
column9: {anak peneroka} Teringat cerita arwah Tun Razak dulu. Anak dia mintak buat swimming pool kat rumah pun dia tak berani nak bina demi menjaga amanah rakyat.Wallahualam.
column10: {A KADIR JASIN} 1. Oleh sebab cek olok-olok RM1 juta yang dipaparkan mengandungi lambang Maybank, saya bertanya PNB apakah iannya ditaja oleh Maybank.2. Pegawai PNB yang menjadi konteks saya, Encik Aziz Anuar (Senior Vice President Corporate Affairs & Communications)memaklumkan "Hadiah ditaja sepenuhnya oleh Felda. Logo Maybank hanyalah sebahagian daripada rekabentuk cek olok-olok."3. Saya mendapat maklum daripada sumber-sumber Felda yang mereka mengambil kira kedudukan dan kemampuan kewangan agensi apabila membuat peruntukan luar jangkaan kepada peneroka tetapi orang atasan dari luar Felda mengarahkan bayaran yang lebih tinggi.4. Sumber-sumber itu mengakui yang mereka terpaksa mencari sumber kewangan tambahan termasuk berhutang.Wallahuaklam.
column11: {awang marang} Salam Dato,Jangan dirisaukan sangat kalau kerajaan Najib tak cukup duit, Tuang Punasihat Lebai boleh bantu lancarkan tabung derma jihad dimasjid dan surau diseluruh negara untuk bantu kerajaan Najib.... akan ada dalil nanti rakyat wajib bantu kerajaan Najib/Rohmoh!
column12: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,Terasa sayu aku dengar cerita anak peneroka 7.31PM. Melayu dulu2, pemimpin kita, mempunyai sifat yang baik baik hingga negara senang, maju dan dihormati.Itu hanya tinggal kenangan saja. Sayang Melayu tidak pandai jaga harta sendiri...yang sikit kita ada pun sudah dirosakkan.Orang2 Cina datang sehelai sepinggang...macam datuk nenek aku...tidak ada apa2...malahan buat kerja yang Melayu tidak mau buat...angkat taik orang Melayu...buat jalan raya...buat jambatan...tanam sayur...jual sayur...kuli kuli angkat guni beras dan gula turun dari kapal2 di pelabuhan...hisap candu kasi hilang penat dan stress...sakit TB...mati awal...tetapi, dengan usaha tulang empat kerat, mereka bikin kedai kecil2...lama2 ekonomy mereka punya, bukan kerana datuk nenek moyang aku tipu timbangan atau curi tulang atau makan titik peluh orang lain...tetapi, mereka buat sikit2...dapat satu ringgit, simpan 30 sen...lama2 mereka kaya...Allah itu adil dan saksama.Sayang jadi Melayu...kasi malu saja...tidak pandai bikin harta, tidak pandai jaga harta...boros giler...dapat satu ringgit, belanja satu ringgit tiga puluh sen...tiga puluh sen hutang sama Cina...lama lama habis tanah dijual sama Cina.Dulu sama sekarang, Melayu sama saja...suka berhutang...keliling pinggang...buat kerja sikit, tapi hutang banyak, macam orang2 Melayu Felda.Kasi itu tanah 600,000 acres sama orang Cina ba...tengok macam mana...silap2 haribulan, Malaysia akan jadi pengeksport daging babi yang paling terbesar didunia!Kasi sama Melayu, apa yang ada?Kasi beban sama orang lain saja...minyak kelapa sawit pun mahal sudah.Melayu tidak pandai bersyukur, sudah dapat tanah dan kemudahan asas percuma pun masih tidak pandai berdikari...asyik berhutang saja...banyak lagak.Melayu Felda tidak tau malu punya Melayu...selepas 50 tahun pun masih terminta2.Disini la kuasa politik UMNO.
column13: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,Catitan Datuk 9.26PM..."4. Sumber-sumber itu mengakui yang mereka terpaksa mencari sumber kewangan tambahan termasuk berhutang."- Felda dan FGV tidak ada maruah...tidak ada pride.- Dapat RM1.00, belanja RM1.30...tidak tau malu.- Cagar saja itu tanah Felda, supaya dapat hutang lagi banyak2.- Kalau ikut cakap "orang atasan dari luar Felda (yang) mengarahkan bayaran yang lebih tinggi"...itu kita memang tidak hairan, sebab anakharamzadah sial itu bukan pakai duit bapa dia.- Felda is a a typical Malay at its best!- Kerja sikit, hutang banyak.- Suka pinjam duit, macam la itu duit titik peluh sendiri, lepas itu enjoy sana sini, kasi habis duit beli barang yang tidak ada hasil.- Sudah habis duit, bikin muka macam beruk keluar dari hutan...terminta2 sama orang.- Nasib juga Felda dapat Pengerusi, muka macam dari Planet of the Apes...kaki rasuah.- Itu la Melayu2 Felda dan FGV, suka makan rasuah!
column14: {Aku} Kadiag,  ?????????? ???????????? Terima kasih banyak kerana 'coret' pasai "Insentif FELDA duit siapa ?".Benda ni nak habag mai dah lama depa dok buat terutama bila dekad pilihan raya. Tapi dolu bawah Raja Liyeh, FELDA duit banyak.. laa ni lain sekali, hutang pulak yg banyak. Tapi usaha nak beli undi macam "mesti" di teruihkan, macam satu yg 'wajib', dan pihak yg berwenang macam SPRM (biro banteraih risyuah) dan 'pengelola' pilihan raya (SPR) macam buat tak tau saja, basa almarhum Tok Guru munkin 'jeling pon dak'. Parti agama yg selayaknya bediri ataih perinsip "amar makruf nahi munkag" pon macam bisu, subhanallah.Pasai unjuran hang duit munkin depa ambik dari Maybank yg banyak risab, bulih jadi jugak. Tapi lagi satu "prime candidate" aku rasa munkin PETRONAS, yg baru saja tarik diri dari projek di Kanada :    " Pacific NorthWest LNG megaproject cancelled. Malaysian national energy giant Petronas and its partners pull the plug on the $36 billion project... Dari Toronto Star, July 25, 2017. " Satu sebab aku rasa lagu tu kerana banyak kali depa buat sesuatu yg 'luag jankaan'. Apa2 pon bulih jadi dgn puak2 ni. Orang dolu munkin kata 'bujog lalu, melintang patah'....Munkin ini isyarat kita kena pantau semua 'kemungkinan' atau "cover all bases", kalu tak bulih pon, kena tengok pd 'cash cow'2 yg masih ujud.Lagi satu benda yg munkin depa kena kaba ("cover") jugak ialah Prasarana, yg hutang pon dilapog dah cecah bilion2, (dan jugak dilapog tak siyag kedudukkan akauns untung rugi pd orang ramai) dan yg dijadual untuk ambik alih projek MRT (jugak dilapog sarat hutang).Mintak maghap ataih apa2 yg silap, dan sekali lagi, terima kasih Kadiag.Aku
column15: {RD.} Taja jemaah Haji, guna duit hutang 1MDB. Bagi insentif atau pengalak pada peneroka, guna duit hutang juga. Kalau berhutang untuk berniaga dan menjana pendapatan, kira OK la juga. Sekurang-kurangnya, hasil keuntungan boleh digunakan untuk membayar hutang dan faedah keatas baki-hutang.Kalau berhutang untuk meraih sokongan dan popularity... alamatnya nanti, jadi seperti kebanyakan mereka yang bankrupt dengan hutang keliling-pinggang, kerana amalkan cara hidup... biar papa, asal bergaya.
column16: {panglimo potaseh} Pak Kadir.Aku harap peneroka felda ni jangan jadi ikan dalam sangkar, sampai masa kena jual. Dan memang dah terjual pun .. peraih nye Isa Pendek.PM kita Sang Mappadulung dengan mulut berbuih nya kata,kompom nak bagi RM5,000 pada Pak Peneroka .. dan hari tu janji nak ulur lagi RM25,000, jadi tak. Ari tu keluar tv, betapa "hepi jomblo" nye Mak Cik Felda dapat RM5,000, katanye "Sapa nak bagi ooii, kalau tak Sang Mappadulung?". Dan janji nak bagi RM25,000 tu, Pak Peneroka kena kejar. Takut yang RM5k sebagai ganti RM25k .. apa-apa boleh jadi di zaman Mappadulung ni, jika ia ada kaitan dengan duit.Pak Peneroka pun kena mintak lagi duit daripada Sang Mappadulung .. ini lah masa paling baik untuk mintak. Ayok.
column17: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"2. Pegawai PNB yang menjadi konteks saya, Encik Aziz Anuar (Senior Vice President Corporate Affairs & Communications)memaklumkan "Hadiah ditaja sepenuhnya oleh Felda. Logo Maybank hanyalah sebahagian daripada rekabentuk cek olok-olok."- PNB bukan bank...jadi tidak bolih issue cek, walaupun olok-olok.- cek olok-olok yang ada jenama bank bermakna, PNB ada akaun di bank itu untuk membuat pembayaran pada peneroka, bukan pakai cek, tetapi masuk terus akaun masing2.- jadi itu tidak ada masaalah.- masaalahnya dari mana Felda dapat duit bayar RM1.5 bil insentif peneroka?- kalau "pinjam" dari dana PNB RM40 billion itu, mampus la 13 juta pelabur PNB termasuk 100,000+ peneroka Felda yang melabur diPNB...kalau ambil dari dana pelabur RM260 bil PNB itu, kita Melayu gulung tikar!- Datuk gigit jari, balik kampung tanam jagung!...Tan Sri Wahid masih muda, bolih jadi driver Uber?...aku masuk hutan, tinggal atas pokok, buru pelanduk.- puas2 la ketawa, sebelum menangis bila yang ditangisi sudah dimiliki orang lain!- bukan Tanah Melayu pernah dimiliki olih bangsa lain?- yang kita tau, "Malaysia" bukan milik UMNO...itu saja.
column18: {Lee Watt} I sense a lot of jealousy here. With the writers trying to masked this. While pretending to be "concerned about the country".Here are the basic facts:1) Najib is the country's PM. His party and coalition has the numbers in parliament. THEY call all the shots. Including what to give to Felda settlers and so on.2) You Bersatu and Pakatan people don't have any real power. You can shout and scream all you like. But most people don't really care. column19: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,Coretan saya 2:33 PM pasal elaun cikgi pendalaman Sabah dipotong, mungkin ada sikit2 kena mengena dengan  apa yang dikatakan olih Zairil Khir Johari...(1)Kita harap Kerajaan Harapan mengambil kira:1. Tambah guru2 budak Sabah untuk ganti 14,000 guru dari Semenanjung dalam 5 tahun selepas memerintah kecuali guru2 musik, English, Sains dan Matematik.2. Hantar balik guru2 agama dari Semenanjung.3. Latih guru2 muda dalam bidang musik, English, Sains dan Matematik.4. Ambil budak2 SPM yang pandai2 jadi guru untuk pendalaman Sabah.5. Jadikan English sebagai Official Language untuk Sabah.6. Elaun2 guru Sabah mesti lagi bagus sebab keadaan pendalaman Sabah sangat teruk.Terima kasih saudara Zairil Khir Johari...you are doing the right thing...you have my 101% support..............................."Allowances for trainee teachers should not be abolished...July 27, 2017 By Zairil Khir JohariYesterday, a coalition of 14 varsity organisations visited Parliament to submit a memorandum protesting the government’s proposal to abolish living and travelling allowances currently provided to trainee teachers undergoing the Bachelor of Education undergraduate programme (Program Ijazah Sarjana Muda Pendidikan, PISMP) at teacher training institutes (Institut Pendidikan Guru, IPG).As of now, trainee teachers enrolled in the PISMP programme receive a monthly living allowance of RM430 and a maximum travel allowance of RM500. In fact, RM430 is already a reduced amount, as it used to range from RM500 to RM800 a month depending on location.In lieu of the allowances, National Higher Education Fund Corporation (Perbadanan Tabung Pendidikan Tinggi Negara, PTPTN) facilities will be made available for students at teacher training institutes in order for them to finance their cost of living throughout their four years of study.Misplaced prioritiesOnce again, the government appears prepared to sacrifice the future of our country in its attempt to cover its own wrongdoings. Instead of addressing the rampant wastages, corruption and financial scandals that continue to drain the resources of our nation, the government prefers to punish critical sectors such as education.While education expenditure continues to command the bulk share of the government’s annual budget, its actual spending priorities are highly questionable. Billions of ringgit have been exhausted on white elephant projects such as YTL’s 1BestariNet, while key items such as teacher development has seen its budget continuously slashed, dropping by half from RM1.5 billion in 2015 to RM763 million in 2017. Even the allocation for English enhancement programmes have been reduced by two-thirds.Unfortunately, while the much-vaunted Malaysia Education Blueprint 2013-2025 pays lip service to the need to improve the quality of teachers, the government appears to be doing the exact opposite.Scrap the proposalsThe government should immediately review its flawed proposal and scrap plans to abolish the living and travelling allowances of trainee teachers. If anything, the teaching profession should be further incentivised in order to attract better talents. If the quality of education in our schools is to be improved, then the quality of teachers has to be given the utmost priority.Furthermore, it is even more outrageous to replace the allowances with PTPTN loans in order for the trainees to support themselves. Not only would this make the option of becoming a teacher less attractive, it would also add to the burdens of fresh graduate teachers who have already sacrificed much in taking up the mantle of their noble profession.Zairil Khir Johari is Bukit Bendara MP, DAP Parliamentary Spokesperson for Education, Science and Technology.(1) http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/opinion/2017/07/27/allowances-for-trainee-teachers-should-not-be-abolished/

column21: {RD.} Salam Dato AKJ.Bukan setakat dividen ASB saja yang terendah dalam sejarah, Dato. Dividen ASG (Amanah Saham Gemilang) juga yang terendah dalam sejarah. Berikut saya ambil dari 'Laporan Tahunan Bagi Tahun Kewangan Bertarikh 31 Mac 2017' yang dihantar kepada saya, setiap tahun.(Bermula tahun 2018, ia akan dihantar melalui elektronik, jika saya bersetuju).ASG-Pendidikan2015 = 7.102016 = 6.002017 = 4.50ASG-Kesihatan2015 = 7.202016 = 7.002017 = 4.25ASG-Persaraan2015 = 7.152016 = 6.802017 = 5.15Baru-baru ini, kerana ada urusan lain berhampiran, saya telah pergi ke Menara PNB Jalan Tun Razak untuk melabur duit-raya anak-anak. Sejak dari kecil lagi saya sudah membuka akaun ASD (Amanah Saham Didik) untuk anak-anak dan menjadi kelaziman setiap tahun saya akan 'merampas' sebahagian besar duit-raya mereka untuk dimasukkan dalam ASD. Saya isi borang dan beri passbook anak-anak di kaunter. Juruwang terus memulangkan balik semua passbook kepada saya sambil berkata, 'buku tidak lagi diperlukan'. Saya balas; 'kalau hilang pun tak apa la, ya?' dan Juruwang jawab; 'Ya, hilang pun tak apa'.Saya bertanya lagi; 'kalau macam tu, bagaimana saya nak buktikan kepada anak-anak, bahawa semua duit-raya mereka telah saya masukan dalam ASD?'Juruwang jawab; 'Nanti saya printkan transaksi pelaburan ini, sebagai bukti kepada mereka.'Namun, saya tidak lagi boleh mengetahui jumlah baki dalam akaun tiga orang anak saya yang sudah mencapai umur 18 tahun. Mereka mesti berdaftar sendiri dalam talian untuk mengetahui baki wang yang saya sendiri berikan pada mereka, sebagai duit-raya.Ini bermakna, setelah mereka mencapai umur 18, saya tidak lagi dapat memantau samada mereka berbelanja boros untuk membeli barangan mewah yang tidak bermanafaat kepada kehidupan mereka sebagai pelajar di IPTA/S.Yang jelas, pada saya, PNB banyak dapat berjimat dengan 'langkah' elektronik ini. Mungkin dengan jumlah yang dapat dijimatkan ini mereka rasa berhak membazir hampir setengah juta Ringgit untuk nombor-palat kereta dan juga membeli kereta-baru. Alangkah baik jika WANG itu dikembalikankan kepada pelabur dalam bentuk dividen.Terima Kasih Dato, kerana menceritakan mengenai "Maybank IB mengakui yang ia telah membeli 17.1 juta saham Lotte pada harga RM6.4718 sesaham dengan membayar RM110.67 juta. Maybank IB adalah penasihat dan penjamin (underwriter) IPO Lotte itu."Kita juga kena 'berjaga-jaga' pada bulan November ini bila EDRA milik China, buat IPO.

Saya rasa saya tahu siapa pengkhianat ini."- Ceritakan Datuk...ceritakan siapa pengkhianat bangsa ini?- Pada dasarnya, saya sendiri tidak berapa suka pasal skim2 pinjaman ASB ini yang dipopularkan olih bank2 di Malaysia sebab orang macam saya bukan besar pendapatan...kasi pagi makan pagi...jadi besar kemungkinan juga yang sebenarnya, bank yang tak mau layan saya...biasanya saya banyak soal, tapi duit tarak.- Pada suatu ketika dulu, bini ada bawa leaflet bank tentang skim ini...kalau zaman Tun, bonus dan dividen sampai 10-12% memang cantik...tolak bunga pinjaman skim asb, lebih bolih pakai.- Kalau zaman..apa nama?...mana nama dia nie?...tak ada pula diblog?...oh ya...(Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil) Mohd Najib Abdul Razak...mampus la bayar skim ini sebab pulangan asb tak cukup bayar hutang pinjaman.- saya masih ingat lagi dalam sekitar 1998 begitu, bila matawang kita jatuh masa "Asian Financial Crisis", bunga naik 15%...banyak pelabur yang buat pinjaman bungkus...jadi bank punya non-performing loan...ratusan juta kena write-off...pinjaman habis begitu saja kena ambil bank sebagai cagaran untuk bayar principal.- sebaik2nya, melabur dalam skim ASB ini berpandukan pada asas simpanan bulanan...atau kalau ada lebih wang...sikit sikit lama lama jadi bukit...ini la asas pelaburan yang baik.- PNB mesti hentikan pinjaman skim ASB ini dengan serta merta sebab pinjaman ini tidak menguntungkan orang Melayu...yang untung adalah bank2, bukan pelabur.

column38: {Alias Dasuki} Datuk, saya kira kita dilandasan yang betul dalam mengawasi perjalanan PNB dan membangkitkan kritikan terhadap tindak tanduknya yang bercanggah dengan kepentingan kita sebagai pendeposit atau pelabur. Saya persoalkan ini secara serious kerana polisi-nya sejak menerajui PNB bercanggah sekali dengan keperluan orang Melayu secara amnya, dan orang-orang kampung dan bawahan secara  khasnya. Kalau benar-benar orang kampung, beliau sepatutnya faham bahawa Melayu generasi sekarang pun masih terkial-kial membantu meringankan beban saudara-maranya  dikampung. Kalau pun mereka mampu beli komputer, mampukah mereka membeli printernya, dan kalau tak ada printer bagaimana mereka nak simpan maklumat simpanannya ? Persoalan juga timbul dengan polisi AWO sebelum ini. Melarang wakil dari boleh membuat deposit bagi pihak pemegang akaun saya kira sebagai satu peraturan yang benar-benar bodoh. Tidakkah beliau sedar kabanyakan pemegang akaun kesuntukan masa untuk berkejar ke bank untuk mematuhi arahannya kerana bukan semua mereka bekerja sebagai boss yang boleh melewang sesuka hati. column49: {samad} Bagi saya, dua isu berkaitan PNB yang Datuk utarakan ini adalah berbeza. Pembelian no plat kereta adalah satu keborosan dan kesalahan pelaburan. Benar, namun isu paperless polisi ini adalah berbeza.Tan Sri Wahid menggunakan kaedah yg digunapakai oleh dia semasa di Maybank dulu. Dengan menggunakan paperless polisi, penjimatan kos boleh mencapai 90% berbanding dengan kaedah konvensional. Bagi saya, paperless adalah satu cara yg dpt menjimatkan kos pengurusan. Juga untuk berlaku adil, mohon pihak pengurusan membenarkan kedua kaedah berjalan dalam tempoh 2 tahun transaksi. Ini membolehkan warga emas menyesuaikan diri dgn kaedah paperless tersebut.Saya percaya kebolehan TS Wahid untuk menangani pengurusan PNB. column12: {hud hud} This indeed is a very significant progress.  Many were skeptical before this if Pakatan can really work together. This development is significant enough to remove all doubts.  It can provide the great push to really get everybody on board.  Single party, single logo, single manifesto.  That’s the way to go.  It takes a great personality like Tun to be able to do it.  At his age!  There is no one else like him in the world.   To reconcile with Anwar is already hard enough.  To be able to get the 2 factions in PKR to finally agree is a great achievement indeed.BN will spare no effort to place road blocks.  Already ROS is targeting DAP by recycling the old issue of party elections.  The real work of course is to get those on the ground to really work together and not to sabotage for self interest.  That is the real difficult part.  But I have full faith in Tun’s ability to lead in this.  He has enough clout and experience to know how to do it properly.  I am sure there are trojan horses within Bersatu.  And the 2 factions in PKR.PAS must now be shivering as to what is going to happen to them now.  They had found themselves trapped by the curse of the Sang Kelembai.  They have no way to go but to continue to support UMNO, openly or behind the scene.  Them backstabbing Najib at the last moment is still a possibility though. Maybe as a last resort when they see that there is really no chance for UMNO.  But my real hope is for both to be trashed in the coming elections.  They are becoming more and more irrelevant to the country and of late only bring more and more disasters.  Let them be buried in the dustbins of history.  Our country will be much better without them around.

column32: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"...usaha meringankan beban rakyat"1. Peluang pekerjaan untuk anak2 muda dan orang2 pencen.2. Bila, YB Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin jadi TPM dan Menteri Pelajaran pada suatu ketika, beliau telah melancarkan konsep Kolej Vokasional...satu konsep yang paling terbaik...tetapi, pada saat ini diabaikan tanpa arahtuju sebab Kerajaan BN tidak cukup duit.Aku pasti, dalam Budget Oct 2017 ini, perkara ini akan dibentengkan juga, tetapi sekadar melepaskan batuk ditangga sebab "tidak banyak duit" bolih disapu olih MO1 kalau banding dengan budget untuk BTN, East Coast Railway, TRX, Jakim, Permata, PanBorneo dsbnya.Buat la target untuk 1 juta anak2 kita masuk program Vokasional...insyallah dengan skills yang mereka pelajari nanti, senang mereka dapat kerja atau buat kerja sendiri.3. Kerajaan Harapan kalau bolih janji lah pada orang Sabah/Sarawak untuk memulihkan pembelajaraan Bahasa English...sebagai bahasa rasmi Sabah/Sarawak mengikut Perjanjian Malaysia 1963 dengan mengadakan cukup guru2 Bahasa English untuk sekolah2 terpencil diluar2 bandar...ini bolih dilakukan kalau ada pengurangan guru2 dari Semenanjung (14,000 orang) yang makan belanja begitu besar sekali sebab kos2 alaun (50%-75% dari gaji). column34: {acda.sulaiman@gmail.com} As Salam Datuk,Baru baru ini Dr M telah pun menyenarai kan (mungkin) sebahagian daripada manifesto Pakatan Harapan dan saya tertarik dengan manifesto tersebut. Sebagai seorang pengundi saya bersedia memangkah Pakatan Harapan dalam PRU 14 nanti sekiranya pakar pakar ekonomi Pakatan Harapan dapat memberi huraian secara lengkap keatas perkara perkara berikut yang kemungkinan Pakatan Harapan akan laksanakan sekiranya Pakatan Harapan menang dlm PRU 14 nanti.Huraian huraian nya mestilah di siarkan SEBELUM PRU 14, bukan selepas nya. Kenyataan saperti "huraian lengkap pelaksanaan akan di beri selepas PRU 14" BUKANLAH jawapan yang dinanti nantikan.1. Penghapusan GST.   Sekiranya rejim pencukaian GST dihapuskan, apakah rejim pencukaian gantian yang akan dilaksanakan? Adakah rejim pencukaian ini lebih rendah dari 6%. Kalau lebih rendah dari 6%, adakah kerajaan PH akan mampu mengumpul pendapatan lebih tinggi berbanding dg GST bagi menampung perbelanjaan kerajaan termasuk pembangunan. Bagaimana nak melaksanakan nya. 2. Menstabilkan harga runcit minyak petrol.    Harap huraikan bagaimana hendak melaksanakan nya kerana kita sedia maklum Malaysia bukanlah negara pengeluar minyak utama dunia. Harga minyak di pasaran Malaysia terlalu bergantung kepada harga pasaran minyak dunia. Penstabilan tersebut pula pada kadar berapa ringgit bagi setiap liter dan berapa lama pula boleh dikekalkan. 3. BRIM   Adakan kerajaan PH akan mengekalkan skim ini atau akan dihapuskan. Jika dikekalkan, mengapa? Kalau hendak di hapuskan, akan adakah skim gantian dan bagaimana cara pelaksanaan nya. 4. PTPTN   Adakan skim ini akan dikekalkan, kalau dikekalkan, mengapa?Jika dihapuskan, akan ada kah skim gantian? Bagaimana hendak melaksanakan nya. Sekiranya seluruh sistem pembelajaran pendidikan tinggi hendak dibiayai secara percuma pula, daripada sumber mana akan datang nya sumber kewangan yang besar untuk subjek ini.5. Bagaimana hendak menstabilkan harga harga barangan keperluan harian saperti gula, tepong, minyak masak, gandum, susu, bawang dan beras. Kita sedia maklum sebahagian daripada barangan ini di import sepenuhnya. Pada harga harga berapa kah barangan ini hendak distabilkan. Diharap dapat memberi jawapan yang ikhlas,jelas dan munasabah kerana isu isu diatas memberi impak secara terus keatas rakyat. Sekian, terima kasih.

As teachers, you have to be committed.”Manyin said the state has 1,454 schools, of which 1,020 are dilapidated and 415 in critical condition."....(1)- Bukan ke Sarawak dibawah PBB/BN sejak 1963...tidak pernah putus2...hingga masih banyak sekolah2 dalam keadaan teruk????- Lain pula ceritanya, bila ada orang2 Penan yang tinggal dalam hutan meminta duit untuk sekolah anak2 mereka dari ex-CM..sekarang sudah jadi TYT Sarawak, Tun Taib Mahmud..."Return Taib's RM1.2m donation to S'wak, Penan leaders tell Aussie varsity...30 Dec 2015... Eleven Penan leaders have demanded that Adelaide University in Australia return A$400,000 (about RM1.2 million) in donation received from former Sarawak chief minister Taib Mahmud.The letter, sent to Adelaide University vice-chancellor Warren Bebbington and signed by the Penan leaders with their thumbprints, said the donation should be returned to Sarawak as they claimed the money was illegally acquired by Taib.  "We need this money urgently to develop the Penan Peace Park and send our children to school and higher education."For you, A$400,000 is not much, but for the Penan this is a lot of money which can help change our young generation's lives," the letter said.The Penan were nomadic hunter-gatherers until their rainforests were mostly destroyed by logging and plantation during Taib's tenure as Sarawak's chief minister beginning mid-1980s.The indigenous people have been struggling to protect their rainforests for almost 30 years, with the Penan Peace Park being their latest attempt for a community-administered forest reserve.The donations from Taib to Adelaide University had been disclosed under a Freedom of Information request by South Australian Greens MP Mark Parnell...(2)- Orang bilang, Tuah ayam nampak dikaki, tuah manusia siapa yang tahu."Wife presents 'birthday boy' Taib with RM1.5m Bentley...24 May 2016...Sarawak governor Abdul Taib Mahmud received a surprise birthday present from his wife - an RM1.5 million car.Ragad Taib presented the 80-year-old former chief minister with the white Bentley Continental GT V8 S convertible, affixed with gold ribbons, during a celebration in Kuching last Saturday....(3)-  Ketua Lanun Bugis dari Malaya menjadi-jadi mengganas di bumi Kenyalang... column26: {Alias Dasuki}  Satu tamparan yang tepat, Dato. I'm pleased to note that U've even started unleashing the punches right from the start. I fully agree with U that PNB or its CEO has no right to gallivant with PNB's money. Like what U say, I'm one of those whose lives gravely depend on PNB doing well. Am stuck with having to repay a sizeable loan with a Chinese Bank, with a major part of the repayment fund being invested in PNB. Should PNB fail, I'll not omly lose my money there, but also lose the property securing the loan and my rental income thereon. I stand to become an immediate bankrupt. I cannot choose to use the repayment fund (now in PNB) to partial-pay the loan as doing so would put me in a much tighter predicament. Consequent to recent lending rules, partial repayments no longer confer the borrower the privilege to reduce his instalment payments and that option, if I were to take, would leave me with no buffer should I, for some reasons, cease to earn any rental from the house. You may next ask as to why I sought a Chinese bank to resolve a Muslim Bumiputra's financial predicaments. My answer is...my request for a smaller loan from Affin Islamic Bank met with rejection after a two-year haggling. UOB, instead, took only about 3 months to finalise the deal. Would you laugh, or cry with me ? Salam.
column27: {A KADIR JASIN} Berikut adalah jawapan (Tan Sri Datuk Seri) Abdul Wahid Omar kepada tulisan saya. Saya siarkan penuh dan tanpa suntingan.BHG1â€œAssalamualaikum wbt & salam sejahtera,Saya dengan segala hormatnya merujuk kepada tampalan blog YBhg Datuk A Kadir Jasin 8 Julai 2017 berkenaan pembidaan nombor pendaftaran kenderaan siri PNB. Izinkan saya memberikan pencerahan berkenaan isu yang disebutkan.1. Sebagai seorang ahli korporat, saya percaya bahawa penjenamaan korporat itu adalah penting untuk memperkukuhkan penambahbaikan secara fundamental sesebuah organisasi. Ini berdasarkan prinsip atau falsafah "Form without substance will not get you anywhere. But when you combine form with substance, you will go a long way". Falsafah korporat ini telah saya laksanakan dengan jayanya semasa menerajui Kumpulan UEM-Renong (2001-2004), Telekom Malaysia (2004-2008) dan Maybank (2008-2013).2. Saya berbesar hati kerana telah diberi kepercayaan untuk menerajui Kumpulan PNB sebagai Pengerusi Kumpulan pada 1 Ogos 2016. Saya dan Dato' Abdul Rahman Ahmad yang telah dilantik sebagai Presiden & Ketua Eksekutif Kumpulan telah membentangkan Pelan Strategik PNB 2017-2022 pada 26 November 2016. Pelan ini mensasarkan PNB menjadi sebuah firma pelaburan distinktif bertaraf dunia dengan 3 teras strategi utama iaitu i. Meningkatkan Pulangan Secara Mapan; ii. Memacu Kecemerlangan Operasi dan iii. Pengurusan Pelaburan Berkesan . Pasukan PNB sedang giat melaksanakan Pelan Strategik ini dan Alhamdulillah, reaksi awal pasaran amat memberangsangkan dimana nilai pasaran 6 syarikat-syarikat strategik PNB telah meningkat sebanyak RM31 bilion untuk 6 bulan pertama 2017. Pasukan PNB juga telah berjaya melaksanakan migrasi sistem teknologi maklumat (IT) semasa cuti Hari Raya Aidilfitri baru-baru ini yang membolehkan transaksi unit saham amanah ASB/ASN, dll dilakukan tanpa menggunakan buku simpanan lagi. Ini telah memudahkan lagi pelabur untuk berurusan dengan ASNB.3. PNB telah ditubuhkan pada tahun 1978 dan bakal menyambut ulangtahun ke 40 pada tahun hadapan 2018. Kami sedang dalam perancangan untuk memperkukuhkan jenama PNB. Kebetulan siri nombor kenderaan "PNB" ditawarkan oleh JPJ untuk bidaan pada bulan April 2017. Kami telah memohon daripada Menteri Pengangkutan supaya 25 siri nombor PNB (1,2,3,8,10,11,18,20,30,50,60,70,80,90,100,111,118,200,300,400,500,600,700, 800 & 900) dikhususkan kepada PNB tanpa pembidaan. Walaubagaimanapun kami telah diminta oleh JPJ untuk membida nombor-nombor tersebut seperti umum. Jumlah bidaan adalah RM336,059 berdasarkan purata bidaan nombor siri PMY,PMX dan PMW. Ia telah ditingkatkan kepada RM419,006 untuk memastikan PNB mendapat kesemua 25 siri nombor tersebut (purata RM16,760 untuk satu nombor). Nombor-nombor tersebut adalah untuk kegunaan kenderaan-kenderaan rasmi Kumpulan PNB termasuk cawangan ASNB bergerak, kenderaan Hotel-hotel PNB Perdana, PNB Merdeka 118, dll. [Bersambung]
column28: {A KADIR JASIN} BHG2â€œ4. Kami membuat keputusan berdasarkan apa yang kami fikir terbaik untuk PNB dalam jangkamasa panjang. Nombor-nombor tersebut bakal menjadi aset jenama PNB dan pembayarannya dibuat secara langsung kepada JPJ tanpa melalui mana-mana agen atau pihak ketiga. Untuk makluman, dana RM419,006 datangnya dari dana milik PNB yang berjumlah RM40 bilion bukan dari dana milik pelabur-pelabur ASNB yang berjumlah RM226 bilion. Jadi, pembelian nombor-nombor tersebut tidak akan menjejaskan pulangan kepada pelabur-pelabur sama sekali.5. Untuk pengetahuan, Alhamdulillah saya selesa menggunakan kereta nasional Proton Perdana sebagai kereta rasmi dengan nombor pendaftaran W8D. Nombor tersebut adalah satu manfaat yang saya perolehi semasa berkhidmat sebagai Menteri di Jabatan Perdana Menteri (2013-2016). Sebagai seorang daripada keluarga miskin yang telah diberikan pendidikan dan biasiswa di bawah Dasar Ekonomi Baru, saya amat terhutang budi kepada Kerajaan dan Negara Malaysia. Sebab itulah saya bersedia berkhidmat selama satu penggal dan membuat yang terbaik mengikut kemampuan saya.6. Saya bersama-sama Ahli-ahli Lembaga Pengarah PNB, Dato' Rahman dan barisan pengurusan PNB akan terus menjalankan amanah yang telah diberikan kepada kami demi kepentingan PNB, 13 juta pelabur-pelabur ASNB dan negara kita Malaysia. Sokongan berterusan rakan-rakan semua amat kami hargai.Terima kasih & salam hormat.AWO. 08.07.17.â€?
column29: {A KADIR JASIN} 1. Saya ambil maklum jawapan (Tan Sri Datuk Seri) Abdul Wahid Omar. Maaf saya terlupa yang dia sudah bergelar Tan Sri.2. Saya mohon maaf kepada pembaca kerana memberi maklumat kurang lengkap. Rupanya lagi banyak nombor istimewa "PNB" yang dilanggan oleh PNB. Ada dalam surat Abdul Wahid dan ada pembahas yang memberi pautan berkaitannya.3. Saya amat sentimental mengenai PNB. Saya kenal baik dengan dua Pengerusinya yang terdahulu - Almarhum Tun Ismail Ali dan Tun Ahmad Sarji Abdul Hamid.4.Tun Ismail pernah halau saya keluar daripada bangunan PNB lama kerana "ambush" beliau dan tanya soalan yang dia susah nak jawab. Tapi akhirnya kami menjadi kawan baik.5. Dari awal lagi saya melabur dalam tabung ASN. Hampir semua dikeluarkan untuk membiayai pengajian anak-anak di universiti. Semua anak saya belajar universiti atas pembiayaan sendiri. Alhamdulillah saya mampu dan saya tidak mahu terhutang budi kepada sesiapa. Saya bina balik tabung ASB dan kini menjadi antara sumber pendapatan zaman persaraan.6. Ramai Bumiputera pun macam itu. Pelaburan melalui sekim unit PNB masih yang terbaik. Sebab itulah kita tidak mahu PNB rosak kerana pemborosan, pembaziran dan pelaburan yang tidak profesional.Wallahuaklam.

column42: {Ex-AA & Co.} Dato,1. The number plates are now property of PNB. They are assets.2. As assets, the number played could be resolusi. It is very sad for a former GEIC and business magazine owner, you manipulated the story and portraying it as something controversial, contentious and even trying to stir up as being scandalous.6. Imam al-Ghazali menyebutkan bahawa perasaan â€˜ujub' adalah kecintaan seseorang akan suatu kurnia yang ada pada dirinya dan berasa memilikinya sendiri serta tidak menyedari bahawa kurnia tersebut adalah pemberian Allah SWT) dan takbur. PNB ditubuhkan oleh Kerajaan yang pemegang sahamnya ialah rakyat jelata (rakyat yang mulia-mulia dan rakyat yang hina-dina), khususnya rakyat Bumiputera yang menunjangi Kerajaan yang ada pada hari ini.3) Daripada apa-apa sudut hujahan sekalipun, - sama ada berdasarkan sudut sains empirikal mahupun daripada sudut sains sosial - matahari, bulan, bintang, binatang, tumbuhan, simbol-simbol, huruf-huruf dan nombor-nombor tidak sekali-kali berupaya mendatangkan apa-apa manfaat/mudarat serta kemuliaan/kehinaan kepada manusia/organisasi manusia. column58: {shah} Johor Crown Prince Tunku Ismail Sultan Ibrahimâ€¦â€¦What's happening to a country I used to respect? A Balance Sheet which depicts a FOREX LOSS is not a Balance Sheet where its FOREX ASSETS AND LIABILITIES are shown at their original book value. The FICTITIOUS status of Kanda's Balance Sheet was obvious to everyone worth his salt in accounting.

column94: {Lee Watt} Datuk, interesting article from The Malaysian Insight today:PRIME Minister Najib Razak has attacked Dr Mahathir Mohamad for Bank Negara Malaysia's forex losses, Malaysia Airlines' perennial woes and all the other ills visited upon Malaysia during the latter's years in power.But where was Najib during this period? He was a senior member of the cabinet, happily and merrily endorsing and supporting all the plans of Dr Mahathir.                        Did he voice out his concerns all those times when the Cabinet made or endorsed the decisions on Bank Negara's losses or Malaysia Airlines' privatisation, subsequent bailout, getting new management and schemes to keep the flag carrier in the sky?Did he oppose anything at all during the Mahathir administration? Doesn't Najib also have some culpability for the decimation of our institutions, the decades of corruption and thievery and the scandals galore that he now points at Dr Mahathir?  Lest we forget, Najib was the Umno politician who chose Dr Mahathir over Tengku Razaleigh Hamzah, and helped change the party history, and by extension the Barisan Nasional (BN) government and the country.There is little doubt that Dr Mahathir has much to answer for, from Ops Lalang to the hollowing of the Malaysian judiciary, privatisation failures, etc.                        But he was ably assisted by his ministers and political warlords from July 1981 to October 31, 2003. Of this group, Najib was a major player through the years, be it in Umno and in government.So, he can't feign ignorance and put the blame squarely on Dr Mahathir for all the decisions that has cost Malaysia so much, from the economy to our rights and personal liberty.He can't point the finger at Dr Mahathir without pointing at himself. He was part and parcel of the government and the system that led to Bank Negara's losses, Malaysia Airlines' red ink then and now, and other scandals.After all, Najib has his own issues now, such as the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) debts, losses and scandal which surely he cannot blame Dr Mahathir even if he tried.That is the elephant in the room that he and Malaysia has to deal with now, not the saga of Malaysia Airlines' fortunes. Lest we forget. â€“ July 10, 2017.

column97: {Nizambakar} In Malaysia, the ground is so very fertile. People are angry. Rural or urban. It is now the oppositionâ€™s task to accentuate the anger to action by strategic narratives through strategic mediums that will inspire the voters to vote BN out.It is clear that Abdullah Badawi and Najib Razakâ€™s joint mismanagement over the last fourteen years and counting has led to what economists like Professor KS Jomo have called â€œpiratisationâ€?.How long can Malaysians tolerate the extent to which this country has been ransacked and pillaged? The financial bleeding has been non-stop since October 2002 when Dr Mahathir Mohamad left the government with a surplus budget.Of the 119 rural constituencies in Malaysia, almost all are semi-rural too. They are within two hours away from a boat, bus or train ride to a major city or centre. Indeed, 75% of the Malaysian economy is driven by the economies of Kuala Lumpur, Selangor and Penang alone.The workers in Kuala Lumpur, Selangor and Penang may not have come across a party candidate from PPBM. They may not even have heard of Syed Saddiq Syed Abdul Rahman, a top passionate debater, let alone myself.But they have heard of the power of the three Ms in the form of Mahathir, Muhyiddin and Mukhriz! And all three of them have trudged through all 119 constituencies in Malaysia at one stage or another.And all three Ms have never dragged the name of Malaysia through the mud, as Najib and his cabinet did. Indeed, of the whole cabinet, only Ahmad Husni, the second finance minister, has had the conviction to resign.If the global electoral patterns are telling Malaysia anything, it is that those who have the courage â€“ despite no party structures â€“ will win.Indeed, of the three million members that are ostensibly in Umno, throughout the general election in 2008, and again in 2013, hardly more than 1.1 million Umno members cared to vote at all. That leaves 1.9 million Umno members free to vote for PPBM too.With at least 1.9 million disgruntled Umno members, plus another 30% from the 1.1 million members in Umno, PPBM has the ability to cross the two million threshold of the rural village votes in Peninsular Malaysia, with the hope that Sabah will likewise do the same through Parti Warisan Sabah, led by former Umno stalwart Shafie Apdal charging from the rural heartland.- Rais HusinDatuk,The logic is correct.But where is the action?And where is the youth energy?PRU14 will be about the younger voters.

column105: {shahril} Dato, while awaiting nervously for the outcome of our concerns, I would just like to add my views on sukasamasuka's and Nizambakar's latest comments. On the " online and without passbook " system being introduced, I share the worries being expressed. This is because the Post Office, the Tabung Haji and the Amanah Saham Nasional savings systems were manipulated to the loss of the depositors, more so at the initial stages. Of course the depositors' plights never reached the public's ears.... all because complaints were individually made and the depositors lacked clear proof or were at a loss on how to pursue the matter. Deposits in cash were acknowledged in the passbooks, but the cash and related official copy of deposit slips did not at times reach the final destinations. Deposits received thru cheques were not meant to be credited until collected, but sometimes totally lost their ways somewhere else. I am not sure how the weaknesses were overcome in POSB and TH. But, as regards ASN accounts, complaints of  losses were a concern in the 80's in the bank I worked and certain officers were put on the alert lists in connection therewith. All this happened despite the use of passbooks. The problem only found some solace when the system was subsequently improved with the dual use of " on-line update " in addition to the traditional use of passbook. I admit that I'v not familiarize myself with the new " on-line without passbook " system. Be that as it may, I am gravely nervous about it, if the passbook is done away with. As regards PNB's extravagance as raise by Nizambakar, I too have suspected something odd. Tun Ismail was frugal with staff expenses when he was BNM Chief, although glimpses did indicate he cultivated a class of his own living complete with fine sets of cutlery and cigars. My suspicion in fact started with the golden handshake he extended to Khalid. Question did linger in my mind as to what he would get for himself. Since there was no way for me to check on that, I had contented myself to leave it at that. But, now with Nizambakar's revelations, things ought to be given a second look. As suggested, PNB are in position to give much higher returns. The special allocations they get in IPO's itself should have been able to make every Malay family a millionaire by now. Salam.
column106: {tic tac toe} saya masih ingat pd satu ketika dahulu no plate 'istemewa' d khas kan kpd pembesar negeri n orang tertentu secara 'percuma'.d masa era tun m system tender d perkenalkan n kerajaan berjaya memungut hasil yg lumayan.ini bukan lah ganjil atau aneh. d Negara barat 'personalized no plate' adalah perkara biasa.pd pendapat saya selagi PNB ujud maka 'no plate' yg d beli mempunyai nilai tersendiri. ianya bolih d pakai utk selama lama nya. persoalan nya ia lah mengapa badan itu perlu bersaing utk mendapatkan angka2 itu. tidak kah ia nya bolih d rundingkan kerana ia nya hanya 'bermakna' kpd PNB.dlm keadaan kewangan Negara yg menguncup, saya tidak heran jika kem kewangan sedang memeras otak bagaimana pendapatan Negara (revenue) bolih d tingkat kan. pemerintahan yg bijak harus cekap dlm memperkenalkan 'fiscal n monetary policy' nya yg seimbang. jika perbelanjaan operasi sukar d tampong drpd pendapatan n harus terpaksa berhutang, maka semua harus berwaspada kerana kita mungkin akan melepasi 'treshold' yg selamat.
