Catatan pembahas Hamka juga menarik. Antara lain, katanya: “Begitu juga bila selesai kes DSAI ada orang secara sukarela pusing satu Malaya menceritakan wayang yang ditayangkan dalam mahkamah, kita juga keliru. Tapi kini cerita itu seolah olah memang satu obligation. Kalau upah sudah dibayar, maka tugas harus dilaksanakan Datuk walaupun ianya cerita wayang.”5. Nick Fury, menyuntik keyakinan dan harapan apabila beliau berkata: “Kita rakyat biasa buat apa yg termampu melawan kejahatan dahsyat ini. Percayalah orang paling jahat sebenarnya paling bodoh menipu diri sendiri dengan egonya. Segala perbuatan pasti ada balasan. Seperti Newton's Third Law, semua jirim termasuk manusia takkan terlepas dari balasan perbuatannya.” Saya pun yakin bahawa para penjenayah dan penyangak politik sudah mula nampak bahawa hari pembalasan sudah dekat. Sebab itulah mereka tidak berkempen dan berhujah lagi. Mereka hanya menyuap dan merasuah rakyat miskin yang mereka sendiri secara sistematik miskinkan.6. Pembahas Aku, antara lain, berkata: “Macam mana pon, aku terima kasih banyak kad hang pasai bawak maklumat ni pada rakyat ramai. Jasa hang sangat besag. Semoga Allah taa'la gandakan balaihsan baik kad hang pasai kita dibulan posa ni. Aamiiin. Dan Allah taa'la ampunkan dosa aku...aamiiin. Ya Arhama Rohimin, sola'llahu a'la Muhammad wa a'la aali Muhammad.” Terima kasih. Doa saudara bukan untuk saya sahaja tetapi buat kita semua.7. Saya rasa ramai akan setuju dengan cadangan Pencari Kebenaran apabila beliau berkata: “Apakata peguam ni bersihkan namanya dan mintak LHDN buat auditannya semula untuk sahihkan memang yuran guaman sebenarnya ciput tu saja. Dan cuma kalaulah tetiba terbukti pulak yuran extra tu tidak direkodkan, apakah kesalahan lari cukai atau lebih teruk tindakan di bawah Undang2 AMLA boleh dikenakan...?”8. Pembahas sukasamasuka buat saya tersenyum sendiri dan terfikir apabila beliau berkata: “Hati Datuk cair tengok si Nancy cantik...anggun dan pakai tudung...lalu tak terlintas dihati yang dia nie kaki bohong. Cowgirl pun cantik juga...pakai tudung...celek mata...kulit mamak la bukan putih macam si Nancy...tetapi, pembohong besar.” Saya sikit pun tak kenal “si Nancy cantik” itu. Tak pernah jumpa pun. Tapi saya setujalah kalau orang kata, dalam zaman Najib ini perempuan sangat berkuasa dan menggoda.Wallahuaklam.
column18: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"3. Dalam era Najib ini tidak ada apa yang mustahil. Benda yang dulu tidak pernah terfikir oleh kita kini berlaku sebagai kebiasaan...Bala, benca dan kecelakaan menjadi perkara harian seolah-olah negara kita Malaysia sedang dilaknati."Salah satu Bala yang paling sial yang dibawa olih pemerintahan (Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil) Mohd Najib Abdul Razak ialah apabila terjadi pencerobohan di Lahad Datu pada 11hb Feb 2013...dimana, 3 bulan selepas itu diadakan PRU13 (pada 5hb Mei 2013)...UMNO/BN sapu habis kerusi di Sabah.Kesialan bala ini menyebabkan berbillion2 duit rakyat digunakan untuk buka ESSZONE dan operasi ESSCOM tanpa sesiapa bolih mempersoalkannya, sedangkan wang itu seharusnya dibelanjakan untuk persekolahan, perubatan, peluang pekerjaan baru dan pembangunan infrastruktur.Ini adalah kesialan besar kemimpinan Najib dan UMNO yang tidak tau berpolitik dengan cubaan nya dengan sengaja mau campur tangan dalam pergolakan politik Bangsamoro di Selatan Phillipine. Tetapi, jangan hairan juga "kesialan" atau "bala" ini sengaja diada2kan sebab selepas itu berbillion2 wang dibelanjakan tanpa tender untuk beli senjata...fulus ya habibi...fulus!Wang yang berbillion2 ini digunakan untuk bunuh nyamuk...ini la Perang Guerilla...pengacau pakai duit siiiiiikit saja, kita pakai berbilliiiiiiiion2.Kerja seorang anakharamzadah orang Malaya di bumi Sabah!Anak2 muda Sabah mau cari kerja....tetapi yang banyak buat kerja disini adalah orang2 Malaya pakai uniform Polis, Navy dan Tentera...ini kerja gila!Last, but not least, we don't want stupid religious teachers from West Malaysia to waste their time in Sabah and Sarawak...what we want are teachers who can teach English, Science and Mathematics, not religion...it's as clear as the sky...why not spend that billions to create more East Malaysian teachers?Who benefits from ESSCOM?Ini la bala kesialaan pemimpin UMNO!
column19: {Aku} Kadiag, Salaam.Izin aku komen sikit ataih komen En Sukasamasuka bila dia nulih:"... Salah satu Bala yang paling sial yang dibawa olih pemerintahan (Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil) **********  ialah apabila terjadi pencerobohan di Lahad Datu pada 11hb Feb 2013...dimana, 3 bulan selepas itu diadakan PRU13 (pada 5hb Mei 2013)...UMNO/BN sapu habis kerusi di Sabah." Pembahas hang tu sambong... natijah dari 'krisis' tu jugak diwujudkan ESSCOM atau program keselamatan timog Sabah yg melibatkan belanja berbilion lagi beli alatan perang, depa kata 'eset' yg kemungkinan besag, tanpa tender terbukak, maksudnya UMNO/BN kekaikan kuasa politik samping deraih buat duit. Natijah dia jugak, pembangunan yg lebih lestari kebajikan rakyat disampingkan dan ramai anak muda menganggog....Untuk makluman En Sukasamasuka, fomula yg lebih korang sama digunapakai diMalaya. Di sini, depa kata China jahat, DAP jahat,  tapi depa sekongkoi dgn China Pineng dan China Singapo, depa kata yahudi jahat, paih tu pi kad bank Rothschild dan Goldman Sachs..... dan natijahnya, GST kena, duit semakin tak dak nilai, hospital2 nampak kena bagi obat yg morah atau disuroh mai kumudian... penganggoran lagi dahsyat, yg kerja2 rendah kemahiran dapat kad Bangla atau Myanmar (yg setengah tu mengaku Rohingya) atau Indon atau Nepal (katanya kalu nak kerja sekuriti, kena tunjuk sorat bekaih tentera ~ 'fotostat' pon takpa) atau Vietnam atau..... yg pangkat tinggi sikit yg mesti ada diploma atau ijazah, dianggag lebih setengah juta menganggog....Lantaran kebejatan yg berlaku, kesannya bukan saja kena pd rakyat Sabah, tapi merangkumi....Dlm memahami perkara ini, sifat apa yg disebut dlm basa 'Arab 'ghurur' munkin bulih bagi sikit pencerahan. Kadang2 ia disebut sebagai satu penyakit hati, sejenih 'virus'.Dlm kamus bahasa Arab-Indonesia dijelaskan kata ghurur (??????) berarti kebatilan, kebohongan, kebanggaan atas diri, penipuan dan tipuan.Pengidapnya antara lain besifat otokratik namun ketagih sanjongan dan kepujian. Kadang2 macam kebudak budakkan, tak dapat sanjongan kerana kurang kekuatan jati diri, 'charisma', kefakihan atau intelek, dia selamba membelinya dgn duit atau kebendaan. Dlm kata yg hang selalu pakai iaitu 'dedak'.Lantaran, bala bala yg dahsyat2 yg hang senaraikan dok mai betali aruih munkin hang kena tambah lagi satu :Pembiakkan dan pecambahan pemakan dedak, korupsi, kronisme sekala industri dan kleptokrasi bertunjangkan sesorang yg bersifat dgn sifat ghurur.Wallahua'lam.Aku
column20: {RAWA LANUN- BAHASA} Read it and do whatever pleases you, ScribeZarkashi tak fikir panjang.Zack anak FeldaNajib mahu 132MP seatsPelan AJatuh Felda lagi 10 seat pun BN dah tumbangMahathir pandai cakapNajib jatuh di PAUAtau ada yang lari dari UMNOMahathir masuk balik UMNOUlar lidi makan ular sawaZack jadi Chairman?
column21: {john doe} Terima kasih DAKJ kerana respon kpd komen saya. Saya mohon izin untuk membuat sedikit penambahan dan pecerahan. Apabila saya sebut kena siasat tentang kemanakah wang sebesar itu pergi dari akaun Shafie saya tidak meletakkan apa-apa sempadan 'kes tertentu yang diwakili' oleh Shafie. 'Wang berkuasa menentukan keputusan' tidak hanya merujuk kepada keputusan hakim di mahkamah selepas berlaku pendakwaan, tetapi merangkumi semua keputusan yang lain daripada polis, koroner, agensi penyiasatan yang lain seperti SPRM dan agensi dalam negeri yang lain seperti Imigresen, Kastam dsbgnya. Sebab itu komen awal saya dibuat secara terbuka dan tidak menjurus semata-mata kepada keputusan penghakiman. Dari sudut ilmu psikologi, manusia akan lebih 'bermurah hati' apabila 'melarikan diri' berbanding apabila 'berburu'. RM9.5j adalah 'luar biasa murah hati'. Saya lebih cenderung untuk mempercayai ia adalah fee dan 'kos-kos' lain bagi seseorang yang sedang melarikan diri berbanding seseorang yang sedang berburu. Bandingkan jumlah ini dengan pengakuan Salehudin Saidin yg yuran guamannya hanya ratusan ribu ringgit. Apakah Shafie ini luar biasa hebat berbanding Salehudin? Kenapa jauh sangat beza yuran guaman keduanya? Takkanlah nak sabitkan Anwar sehingga perlukan RM9.5j. Sejujurnya saya percaya ramai lagi mampu buat kerja itu dgn baik untuk fee ratusan ribu seperti yang diterima Salehudin.Malah mengambil kira pengalaman 'mensabitkan' seseorang tertuduh, Salehudin jauh lebih berpengalaman daripada Shafie. Maka yuran luar biasa hebat ini sudah tentu bukan sekdar bayaran untuk 'kemampuan' (ability) dan pengalaman (experience) tetapi juga bayaran untuk 'kesanggupan'. Di dalam kes Shafie vs Anwar, ia adalah kes berburu bagi Najib. Apa kata kita buang segala sempadan dan berfikir seperti seorang yang sedang terdesak  untuk melarikan diri. Mari kita lihat pula kes-kes di mana kelibat Shafie kelihatan muncul sama ada di mahkamah, tempat kejadian, hospital dll. Contohnya kes Altantuya dan Najdi. Malahan kalau boleh korek, korek juga kes Morais sama ada kelibat Shafie telah muncul di mana-mana tempat sepanjang kronologi kes berlaku. Adalah amat tidak mustahil dan amatlah berkemungkinan benar bagi mereka yang meminati siri 'Criminal Minds' bahawasanya RM9.5j ini bukan untuk 'memburu Anwar' tapi untuk membantu sesorang 'melarikan diri daripada diburu'. Ada pula road show yang mana Shafie terlibat di dalam sesi penerangan tentang kes Anwar hanyalah bernilai 'servis tambahan' di dalam pakej melarikan diri yang disediakan. Ini bukan menuduh tetapi hanyalah 'follow the leads' daripada kaedah 'analyzing human behaviour'. Siasat, siasat dan siasat. Kelak jawapan akan ditemui, in shaa Allah. Wallahu a'lam.
column22: {shah} Musa Hassan deflection fails:"Imagine holding a press conference to make a loud statement to the media about something that is not directly related to yourself, when you haven’t even thoroughly checked the facts.This is what Musa Hassan, a former IGP has done.  What a nightmare it must have been to work for someone that careless in a top position.If Musa had properly examined the facts (read Sarawak Report for example) he would have noted that from day one we made clear that one of Najib’s personal accounts (no 2112022009694), the one which received $681 million in March 2013, was closed the following August:However, our article about Shafee’s payments quite clearly cites a later account Najib opened, into which money from SRC International was paid (a subsidiary of 1MDB).This was account number 2112022011906, which remained open until we broke the scandal in 2015.  Getting these sorts of details right are the bread and butter of investigative work and something this senior officer ought to have been taught in police college.It is lucky he is now retired and perhaps he should keep it that way, instead of digging his friends into deeper holes, when they themselves are plainly deciding that silence is the better option."
column23: {Taosuo} Datuk Kadir,Musa Hassan's sudden contribution to the 'conversation' is like the metaphorical 'bolt out of the blue'.His clumsiness as pointed out by Shah 11.41 a.m. rekindles thoughts of his own alleged 'involvement'  with the release of three gambling syndicate members, when it was reported that investigations by the then anti corruption agency was 'capped' by ex attorney general, Ghani Patail back in 2007.One wonders whether the present attorney gen perhaps used that precedent in stopping investigation on the current MO1.
column24: {Zalman A} Datuk,More foolishness:"A NOTE from prison yesterday scuttled Pakatan Harapan’s presidential council meeting where the leaders were finalising its list of office bearers to be submitted to the Registrar of Societies. It was not an ordinary note. It came from the Sungai Buloh Prison.The Malaysian Insight learnt that former Anwar Ibrahim, who is serving a five-year jail term for sodomy at Sungai Buloh prison, wanted to keep the original PH lineup, and this scuppered the Opposition coalition’s plan to unveil its lineup yesterday.Sources said while the majority of PH leaders had agreed to a new lineup which would see Dr Mahathir Mohamad as chairman and Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail as president, Anwar in his note, insisted on the original lineup.In the original lineup, Dr Mahathir would be the advisor, while Dr Wan Azizah would be the chairman. The three vice-chairman seats would be filled by Muhyiddin Yassin (Bersatu), Mohamad Sabu (Amanah) and Lim Guan Eng (DAP).Bersatu had complained that this structure would mean that Dr Mahathir did not have any executive powers as the coalition’s advisor.“The meeting today was to discuss the proposal to appoint Dr Mahathir as the chairman and Wan Azizah as the president of PH.“But because of the note, the decision had to be postponed again,” the source told The Malaysian Insight."As I say, this drama pulls the teeth from the PH tiger even before it can bite.There is no sane person who regards Wan Azizah as a competent leader.Anwar seems to want to ensure a MO! victory.The only faint hope that PH has is either Dr M or perhaps Azmin as PM-designate.Any games by Anwar are not helping now.
column25: {MS S} Ayat yg paling atas tu takut saya nak baca. Wlu nak gambarkan teruknya si penyembah duit guna la ayat yg lain selain dari perumpaan di atas. My 10 cents

column0: Negara Kafir Lebih Peduli Penipuan 1MDB
column3: {Aduka Teruna} Awat Tok terpaksa recycle 1MDB?Masih teringat Dato kata Malaysia akan gagal dan bankrupt. Kini petanda ekonomi menunjukkan turnaround and Datok sudah mula perakui kenyataan.Sudahlah dengan silap mata ini, Tok. Jika ada bukti, keluarkan once and for all.  1MDB issue has lost its momentum and solution is already in sight. The Singapore court cases only proves bankers were not following regulations. Masih lagi tiada nama Najib sebagai pencuri. Of all person, you should know better that Najib is not as hands on and do not interfere PM as Mahathir is. He give trust to his people and some do failed him. Fitnah itu dosa. Make sure you have something of substance. Your PPBM is left with 1MDB and barang naik to play on. It is a losing concern.  Muhyiddin is not trusted even by former Mahathir's lietenents. The Mahathir's name and legacy is getting from bad to worse.
column4: {RD.} Salam Dato AKJ.Kebetulan, dalam gambar muka depan Utusan yang Dato lampirkan, ada muka Sirul, Si-pembunuh Altantuya yang telah dijatuhi hukuman mati oleh Mahkamah Tertinggi di Malaysia. Dia sempat lari ke Australia dan sekarang menetap di Pusat Tahanan Immigration di sana. Di Australia, tiada hukuman-mati.Makanya undang-undang Australia tidak membenarkan, dihantar-pulang sesaorang pelarian keNegara asal untuk menjalani hukuman-bunuh.Namun, selepas lebih 15 tahun... setelah pembicaraan panjang... kontrak pembelian kapalselam guna orang-tengah Razak Baginda yang membawa kepada pembunuhan Altantuya, masih lagi menghantui Kerajaan BN/UMNO dibawah Najib, dan kali ini dalam bentuk persoalan... Siapa yang beri arahan membunuh Altantuya? Hakikatnya, Kerajaan Malaysia dan Rakyat sudah banyak membazir WANG untuk menutup pekong-Najib. Dari scandal pembelian Kapalselam, Deepak Carpet, Jho Low & 1MDB. Selain membazir, emej dan martabat Negara sudah banyak terjejas. Undang-undang Negara kita manjadi caca-merba, tidak lagi dihormati dan diperlekehkan oleh Rakyat, dalam dan luar Negara. Rakyat yang berada di Luar Negara juga sudah menjadi malu untuk mengakui sebagai Rakyat Malaysia.Najib-Najib, hebat sunggoh legasi kamu.
column5: {Zalman A} Datuk,Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil just needs to steal more public money and buy votes.The trick he will play soon is to try and push through the EC's gerrymandering exercise.Without Selangor, this exercise is illegal.Prepare your lawyers and your injunctions in advance.MO1 and BN have become quite cunning in sneaking in things late at night.The kurang Mulia fella will know his script and follow orders from above.Beware.
column6: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"Negara Kafir Lebih Peduli Penipuan 1MDB"1. Bagi mereka2 yang di labelkan sebagai negara, media atau individu2 yang "kafir" itu sebenarnaya tidak membawa erti apa2 langsung kepada mereka.2. Begitu juga negara2, media atau individu2 yang kita panggil sebagai Islam atau Muslim pun tidak ada membawa erti apa2 kepada sesiapa.3. Itu cuma label saja...label politik.4. Walaupun seseorang itu dipanggil Muslim, ulama, ustaz, haji sekali pun bukan bermakna ibadahnya diterima Allah Taala.5. Yang mana satu ibadah yang diterima Allah Taala, dia tidak akan tau sebab itu antara dia dengan Tuhannya...walaupun dahinya ada bertanda hitam kerana sujud 24 jam atas tikar sembahyang!6. Yang penting antara kita sebagai manusia dengan manusia yang lain adalah perbuatan kita, bukan iman kita atau niat kita...tetapi perbuatan kita sebab manusia itu bukannya tuhan.7. Maka itu nya perbuatan negara2 "kafir" seperti Singapura, Switzerland dan Amerika dalam konteks 1MDB adalah dilihat lebih mencerminkan jiwa "keIslaman" itu sendiri sebab mereka mengutamakan penguatkuasaan undang2 untuk keadilaan.8. Buat apa dipanggil Islam kalau "rumah tangga dan negeri" kotor....sangat kotor...banyak lalat dan bau busuk...kafir pun tidak, Islam pun tidak.9. Islam tidak perlukan penganut2 yang kotor...dimana kandang2 babi di Amerika lagi bersih kalau dibandingkan dengan kandang2 UMNO dan PAS!10. Biar la kalau masih ada orang2 Melayu yang mau bergelumang dengan najis2 dalam kandang UMNO dan PAS...itu pilihan mereka...tetapi, itu bukan pilihan aku lagi...perjalanan aku sudah jauh, Datuk...terlalu jauh untuk pulang kembali.Selamat tinggal UMNO.Tetapi jasa2 baik yang dulu2 itu tetap dalam kenangan ku jua.
column7: {Aku} Kadiag, salaam.Terima kasih pasai coret "Negara Kafir Lebih Peduli Penipuan 1MDB".Tajok hang kali ni belantagkan banyak andaian. Tapi secara ringkaihnya aku rasa, hang nak bandingkan Malaya dgn negara2 lain dlm mendepani masaalah 1MDB, dimana negara2 bukan Islam lebih kedepan menrungkainya. Magnanya Malaya sebagai satu negara 'Islam' tercorot bebanding dgn negara2 kapiag.Kalau lagu tu, izin aku bawak satu takrif negara Islam ~ " ....Imam Ibnu Muflih Rahimahullah berkata,“Setiap tempat di mana hukum Islam berkuasa di dalamnya adalah Darul Islam. Sebaliknya, setiap tempat di mana hukum selain Islam berkuasa di dalamnya, maka tempat tersebut adalah Darul Kufur, dan tidak ada jenis negara ketiga,” (Al-Aadaab Asy-Syar’iyah: 1/313). dari Mukminun.com.Hakikat Malaya bukan negara Islam ikut takrifan ni kekai sungguhpon dlm perlembagaan Malaya disebut Islam adalah agama resmi persekutuan. Ini jugak jelaih dari segi 'amalinya, jenuh tindak tanduk kebanyakkan penduduknya mempelekehkan dan menghinakan Islam. Aku ingat hang cukup 'arif bab ni...Satu contoh, bila Rafizi kata duit songlap di salog untok majlih 'mega' selawat, setakat aku tengok tak dak sapa pon nafi...  jadi, nak habag mai, antara banyak2 negara, Singapo, Suis, Luxembourg (?) jauh ke depan bebanding dgn Malaya (yg paling banyak atau paling parah tebeban/tejejaih) tak payahlah nak sebut bab kapiag ke dak...Sekali lagi, Kadiag, mintak maghap no, kalu ada salah silap pd sapa2, dan bukan niat aku nak gurukan sorang tokoh dan beteran sorat habag Malaya, hanyasanya ayag mata terngenang teruih mengaliag dlm hati.... dan selamat sempornakan posa.Aku
column8: {MrTipu123} Our economy is in havoc. Our poor country is on autopilot. Just look at the mushrooming roadside gerai...it is a good indicator how our economy is performing...no need rocket science or big data to figure it out...
column9: {Tanduk Dua} Assalam DatoMasalahnya orang2 melayu sendiri tak sokong proton...sokong bermaksud membeli kereta proton. Ramai org komen ttg penjualan saham proton ttp mereka sendiri tidak membeli kereta proton. Mereka sebaliknya lebih bangga memandu kereta jepun, korea & eropah.Org melayu tak seperti org korea...org korea sangat menyokong kereta buatan mereka walaupun pada mulanya kualitinya juga tidak baik berbanding kereta jepun/eropah. Kalau berjalan di Seoul...80% kereta dijalanraya adalah kereta jenama korea.Bukan saja orang melayu tak sokong industri yg dikuasai melayu...bahkan pemimmpin melayu sendiri (selepas DrM) dilihat membawa polisi yg hanya membawa kejatuhan proton.Kalau org melayu & pemimpin melayu sendiri tidak sokong proton, adalah lebih baik DRB jual sebahagian saham kpd Geely...bahkan DRB masih lagi menguasai proton walaupun dgn hanya 0.1% majoriti.Pendapat saya, sekiranya majoriti orang melayu termasuk pemimpin melayu tak malu memandu kereta proton di jalanraya, saya rasa saham proton masih tak perlu dijual..proton masih berdaya maju. Silap2 dato sendiri pun tidak memandu proton, kenapa? maaf dato sekiranya saya silap. Saya menulis komen ini kerana sejak mula kerja 1993 hingga sekarang saya tak pernah beli kereta yang lain dari proton..saya bangga membawa kereta proton saya kemana saja..kereta buatan orang melayu islam negara kita..saya melaksanakan tanggungjawab saya kpd bangsa/negara & fardhu kifayahWallahualam
column10: {Tebing Tinggi XVII} Salaam, Dato Obviously 'Aduka Teruna' has not read the reports in the Singapore (oops "negeri kafir") newspapers. Nothing surprising there.Let's see now. The S'pore Straits Times carried the reports under the headlines " 1MDB scandal:MAS fines UOB and "Credit Suisse" and "1MDB probe: Two banks penalised over breaches". Note the use of the words "scandal" and "probe" in relation to 1MDB. In the S'pore Business Times: "MAS caps 2-year extensive probe into 1MDB fund flows". It was also reported that "Singapore's probe into 1MDB monies which is still ongoing began in 2015"Still think that everything is A-OK?
column11: {MrTipu123} Sokong 100%. Kepimpinan kita bukan saja langsung tak menanamkan sifat rakyat cintakan produk malaysia malah tak ambil apa2 langkah membantu supaya industri negara ini terus berkembang. Bukan saja Proton, Petronas juga menempuh nasib yg sama.Kita bangga dengan produk luar seperti Shell,Petron dll.Stesen pesaing ini bercambah dengan banyaknya di tempat2 stratejik.Kalau di luar negara seperti Indonesia,pesaing luar seperti Petronas di tekan sehingga gulung tikar.Di Malaysia sendiri syarikat kita dianaktirikan.Pada hal ia menjadi 'Peggy bank' kerajaan. column16: {shah} "According to the documents obtained by Sarawak Report, the controversial lawyer Muhammed Shafee Abdullah was one of the biggest individual recipients of money from Najib’s 1MDB slush fund accounts.Shaffee, who is known to be an extremely close confidante of Najib and who was controversially appointed as the public prosecutor during the appeal against the acquittal of opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim on sodomy charges in 2014, received two payments.11th September 2013 Najib paid him RM4,300,000 from his AmBank account no 2112022011906 and again on 17th February 2014 he received RM5,200,000 from the same account.  This account has been identified as having been funded by money stolen by the Prime Minister from the 1MDB subsidiary SRC, which had borrowed some RM4 billion from the civil service pension fund KWAP.AG Apandi inadvertently confirmed that finding by waving MACC investigation papers showing the money trail into Account no 2112022011906 in January 2016, at the very press conference during which he announced that no wrong-doings had been committed and he was closing down investigations into 1MDB."Lets see shafee berani nak saman SR?If not MO! should be investigated.....

column18: {Zalman A} Datuk,Lying to Parliament is a serious matter.It was said there that Shafee was paid only RM1,000 for his services:"It raises some extraordinary issues, because back in 2014 the public was told to believe that this high-powered barrister, a known favourite of the Najib administration, had conducted the entire Appeal prosecution against Anwar for a paltry sum of just RM1,000 (US$230 at present rates).This was the sum that Nancy Shukri, a minister in the Prime Minister’s Office, provided to Parliament when questioned on this very matter, owing to the unusual nature of Shafee’s appointment to a job that would normally have been done by members of the Public Prosecution Service.The opposition parties had suspected that Shafee must have been paid far above the normal rates at public expense to conduct the Appeal and then to further take the case through the Federal Court.  However, Shukri stunned them with the opposite information.In an extraordinary statement she said that the government had made an exception to normal rules of privacy in this case, in order to disclose the miscroscopic fee.  In fact, the minster added, Shafee had wanted to do the job for nothing at all, hence the token payment. “We wanted to be transparent” she said."This matter cannot be allowed to rest.Why was Shafee given so many millions?Where did the money go?Who was it given to?

column5: {Kamil Tajuddin} *Dr M kata Najib mesti bertanggungjawab kerana Ringgit menurun?*Dr M jadi Perdana Menteri pada 10 Julai 1981. Masa itu, USD1 bersamaan dengan RM2.30.Selama 22 tahun Dr M menjadi PM, _tak pernah sekalipun Ringgit mengukuh_ berbanding US Dollar.Lalu jatuh ke tahap RM4.86 sebelum Dr M tambat kat tahap RM3.80 sehingga dia bersara pada 30 Okt 2003 - maksud merosot 65% berbanding RM2.30 bila dia mula menjawat.Najib pula jadi Perdana Menteri pada bulan April 2003 semasa USD1 = RM3.73.Sejak itu, *Ringgit pernah mengukuh 25%* sehingga tahap USD1 to RM2.96 pada bulan Mei 2013.Selepas harga minyak turun dan negara Amerika Syarikat melakukan polisi Quantitative Easing II (QE2), Ringgit turn balik sehingga tahap  USD1 kepada RM4.27 hari ini,, 25 Mei 2017.Ini bermakna Ringgit pernah naik 25% dan kini turun 14% hari ini  berbanding tahap RM3.73 bila Najib mula menjawat.Nak tanya Tun Mahathir atau pengikut dia...Kalau Najib mesti bertanggungjawab kerana matawang Ringgit pernah mengukuh 25% dan kini jatuh 14%...*Maka siapakah yang perlu bertanggungjawab kerana matawang Ringgit terus merosot 65% dan tidak sekalipun mengukuh selama 22 tuhan Mahathir menjawat Perdana Menteri?*LSS.

column8: {Adion} Hubungan Kesultanan Melaka Dengan China        Parameswara telah menjalinkan hubungan persahabatan dengan Kerajaan China sebagai langkah keselamatannegeri Melaka. Melaka memiliki hubungan yang dekat dengan Dinasti Ming di negara China.Kerajaan Ming di bawah pemerintahan Maharaja Yung Lo telah mengiktiraf Parameswara sebagai Raja Melaka.Hubungan ini menyebabkan kerajaan Siam dan Srivijaya tidak berani mengugat Melaka. Di bawah perlindungan Ming, Melaka berkembang menjadi pelabuhan penting di pesisir barat Semenanjung Melayu yang tidak dapat digugatkan oleh Majapahit dan Ayutthiya.      Hubungan diplomatik antara Melaka dan China mula terjalin apabila Laksamana Yin Ching melawat Melaka pada tahun1404 dan disusuli dengan lawatan Laksamana Cheng Ho pada tahun 1405 dan 1409.Parameswara memohon perlindungan dari China. Melaka bersetuju menjadi negeri di bawah naungan China dan bersetuju menghantar ufti. China telah mengurniakan payung kuning, cap mohor dan sepersalinan pakaian sebagai tanda pengiktirafan kerajaan China kepada Melaka. Melaka juga menghantar utusan ke China.      Pada tahun 1414, Parameswara mangkat dan digantikan oleh Sultan Mahkota Iskandar Syah. Hubungan China-Melaka terus terjalin apabila Sultan Mansur Syah berkahwin dengan Puteri Hang Li Po, anak maharaja China dan bermulalah kehadiran masyarakat imigran di Semenanjung Tanah Melayu.Persahabatan Melaka-China bertambah erat,tetapi pada zaman pemerintahan Sultan Muzaffar Shah,Kerajaan Melaka bertambah kuat dan Melaka berjaya menewaskan serangan Siam di Muar dan di Batu Pahat tanpa bantuan dari Kerajaan China. Hubungan Melaka dan China terus renggang apabila Kerajaan China mengamalkan dasar tutup pintu pada abad ke 15. Dan kemudiannya bermulalah penjajahan Portugis, Belanda dan British di Melaka dan Tanah Melayu.

column11: {RD.} Maaf Dato AKJ.Tajuk posting Dato... 'Proton Buka Projek Nasional lagi'... dengan Negara Komunis China, kah?Atau... 'Proton Bukan Projek Nasional lagi'.Izinkan saya mencerita mengenai pe'el orang terdesak.Saya ada kawan. Nak kata dia kaya, tak jugak, kerana dia bukan jenis yang suka menunjuk-nunjuk atau bercerita mengenai kemewahan beliau. Cara berpakaiannya macam orang tak berharta. Berkereta Proton-Saga, generasi pertama yang warnanya sudah lusuh. Bila anak-anak dah besar, baru nampak kereta Camry & Myvi baru, parking depan rumah. Anak-anak, mungkin naik malu, tumpang atau bawa kereta bapak mereka itu.Tinggal ditaman perumahan-murah. Tak tahulah saya jika dia ada rumah banglo di kawasan Bandar Besar.Yang saya pasti... dia memiliki banyak tanah di merata-rata tempat. Kebanyakannya ditanam kelapa-sawit. Ada juga tanah bersaiz lebih kecil yang dipajak kepada mereka yang mahu mengusahakannya.Rahsianya... dia punyai simpanan WANG yang banyak dan sesiapa yang 'TERDESAK' akan cari dia. Tapi... dia hanya sanggup beli tanah atau emas saja. Kereta atau lain-lain jentera, dia enggan terima. Katanya... orang selaunya akan jual jentera yang sudah nak rosak.Moral of the story:Negara China juga memegang kepada perinsip-kehidupan seperti kawan saya ini. Selain dari 'menolong' orang terdesak, kawan saya ini mendapat untung yang lumayan.Maklumlah, orang yang 'TERDESAK' atau mereka yang berhutang keliling-pinggang sehingga dihambat bank atau Along, selalunya akan melelong harta-pusaka yang mereka ada, demi WANG segera. Jika disaman oleh bank, kemudian di istihar bankrupt, sudah tentu akan mendatangkan kesipuan yang amat besar. Inilah sebenarnya situasi yang dihadapi oleh PM yang pada masa yang sama, melantik diri-sendiri menjadi Menteri KeWANGan.Bertambah rumit lagi... Harga minyak dunia jatuh. Pendapatan Negara merosot. Belanjawansentiasa deficit (mahu berbelanja melebihi kemampuan) walaupun dilaksanakan GST.Tapi, reputasi dan air-muka nak kena jaga. Walaupun 'poket sudah kosong'... jangan harap Kerajaan akan lancarkan austerity-drive (kempen berjimat-cermat). Potong gaji Menteri ke apa. Mana boleh. Malu la. Nanti hilang credibility dimata dunia... Credit rating jatuh. Ditempelak Rakyat dan masyarakat dunia... Tu la tubuh lagi 1MDB dengan berhutang, guna Jho Low sebagai orang-tengah dan klepet berpuloh-puloh Billion.Yang paling bangang... kalau nak klepet pun, mengapa ambil dari WANG Rakyat yang dihutang. Mestilah Rakyat akan tahu, kerana hutang mesti dibayar-balik.Kata orang... biar papa, asal bergaya. Maka dilancar banyak lagi project berpuloh-puloh Billion untuk menampakkan bahawa Kerajaan beliau masih kaya-raya. Atas sebab itu juga BR1M terpaksa diteruskan, lebih-lebih lagi, bila PRU14 sudah tidak boleh ditangguhkan seperti tertangguhnya PAU.Berserabut dengan pelbagai scandal hingga sudah tidak boleh berfikiran waras... Pak Lah pun diangkatnya sebagai Negarawan Setia terunggul dan terbilang. Diberinya grant 5 Juta, nak buat legasi, seolah-olah WANG itu keluar dari poket beliau sendiri. Akan diberinya juga kursi di IPTA... maka akan jatuh lagilah nilai & reputasi mahasiswa-mahasiswi yang dihasilkan. Sudah terlupa kah bahawa bangsatnya mertabat Malaysia bermula dengan manusia ini?

'membenarkan' itu juga membawa erti bahawa mungkin policy automotif negara sudah berubah, tetapi kerajaan tidak mejelaskan apa yang sudah diubah, maka kita tidak tau.2. column13: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,Kamil Tajuddin 10.44 PM...*Maka siapakah yang perlu bertanggungjawab kerana matawang Ringgit terus merosot 65% dan tidak sekalipun mengukuh selama 22 tuhan Mahathir menjawat Perdana Menteri?*1. Tun yang harus bertanggungjawab pada masa itu dan kalau itu satu kesalahan maka Tun harus dihadapkan ke mahkamah.2. Salah satu sebab yang kita masih ingat kenapa ini berlaku mungkin ada dalam catatan ini....'The Asian crisis was sparked in 1997 by a loss of confidence on the part of foreign investors. In Malaysia the situation was dire. Funds were pulled out of Malaysian markets and investors speculated against the local currency, the ringgit. By September 1998, the local currency had fallen 40% from pre-crisis levels and $140 million had been wiped off the value of the stock market. As the currency slid, pressure increased to raise interest rates to try to keep money in the country. But higher interest rates hurt businesses. The Malaysian economy contracted 2.8% in the first quarter of 1998. Prime Minister Mahathir bin Mohammed was enraged by the disruption to the country's recent history of steady economic growth and accused financier George Soros, the Jews and “rogue speculators” of trying to destroy Malaysia's currency. He railed against the world financial order and said that countries that insulated themselves had a better chance of survival.Calling for reform of the entire world financial system, Mahathir imposed capital controls on September 1, 1998. The ringgit's value was fixed at 3.80 ringgit to the dollar (about 10% higher then where it was trading in the market at the time). All ringgit that had been taken out of the country was ordered to be repatriated by the end of the month—although that deadline was later extended. The government then imposed tight limits on transfers of capital abroad by residents in Malaysia and froze all foreign portfolio investment (in stocks, bonds, etc.) from being taken out of the country for 12 months.' (1)2. The most famous advocate of capital controls for Asia was Massachusetts Institute of Technology economist Paul Krugman, who, in a widely-publicized article in Fortune magazine, advised Asia's leaders to take drastic action. “There is a virtual consensus among economists that exchange controls work badly,” Krugman wrote in a piece entitled “Saving Asia: it's time to get radical” which ran on September 7, 1998. But “when you face the kind of disaster now occurring in Asia, the question has to be: badly compared to what?” Krugman asked. (1)(1) http://policydialogue.org/publications/backgrounders/casestudies/capital_controls_malaysia/

column16: {Aku} Kadiag, salaam.'Pojok' hang kali ni pasai'Proton bukan projek nasional lagi' dapat liputan dlm banyak blog dan macam hang singgong Johari dok betepok tu memang janggai. Tapi dlm otak atau 'mindset' depa, juai kad Geely tu kena ra'i sebagai satu capaian yg cukop baik...almaklumla, Malaya masih dok pegang 50.1% saham dlm Proton, kira majoriti la tu...walaupon 'Lotus' terlepaih majoriti kak Geely. Aku ingat dlm otak orang koporat kalu hilang pegangan walaupon 1%, magna pengurusan sebenagnya (kuasa eksekutif) secara mutlak dah bepindah ke Geely, jadi apa paedah nak teruih pegang 49% dlm Lotus tu....dan kalu juai perabih dpt la fulus lebih sikit. Tapi lain pulak dgn keh Tan Sri Peter Sondakh, 'cukong' dari Indonesia tu. Pemegang saham tebesag (dari Malaya) tak dak kuasa buat keputusan atau 'executive'.Tapi yg tak seronoknya, hang tak cerita 'nilai' sesaham yg tukag tangan dlm juaibeli Proton dgn Lotus ni. Teringat aku keh depa juai syarikat moto Augusta dulu, tak sampai harga besi buruk. Kalu ingat2 balik bulih nangih tak belagu...Pasai harga sesaham Proton dgn Lotus ni, aku tengok dlm 'the Edge' pon tak dak...tak tau la kod aku telepaih pandang....Hang senarai masaalah ekonomi yg Malaya dok hadapi macam ni:'Secara tersirat ekonomi kita, walaupun berkembang pada kadar yang agak tinggi, sedang mengalami masalah sistemik (wabak) yang semakin teruk –1. kadar tukaran ringgit lemah,2. harga barang dan perkhidmatan naik, 3. kadar inflasi makin tinggi, 4. hutang kerajaan dan isi rumah melambung, 5. pengangguran meningkat dan 6. gaji membeku...'Mintak maghap Kadiag, masaalah ekonomi lazimnya mai sekali dgn aspek sosio-politik, tu kod orang dolu2 guna istilah macam 'political economy' bila nak ungkap pada keadaan di Malaya ni. Dan dari isu2 yg hang senarai tu, yg paling teruk pada aku ialah isu 'kredibiliti' dan kejahatan jabatan atau 'malfeasance' orang2 besag. Contoh semasa yg hang bulih nengok dua kepala mata2 (peringkat daerah) bulih kena tahan SPRM pasai bagi pelindungan katanya pada romah hurud (?) dan romah judi haram (di Malaya ada romah judi halai kod...). Dilapog jugak di romah koporal ('kuarters' kod) depa jumpak 800,000, kalu orang besag no. satu 2.6 ribu juta dlm akaun bank dia bulih kira manasabah...dak ka? Jadi kalu ada mata2 tahan Bangla ka Indon naik moto tak dak lesen, lepaih tu mintak 50 ringgit, hai ...nak marah pon macam kena bepada pada, benci pada kerja tu tepaksa sandag pd murkanya Allah ta'ala dan kena cepat2 istighfar.Jadi aku agak la, lebih baik kalu hang senaraikan masaalah yg kita dok hadap ni nombo satu ialah masaalah selingkohan/kredibiliti/integriti pemimpin sebagai 'ataih' sekali.Maghap Kadiag no.Aku

column23: {Zalman A} Datuk,Gerrymandering in full swing. Do not forget who the EC works for:According to research by Politweet, BN can win an additional 11 seats in the Selangor State Legislative Assembly with the new boundaries proposed in September 2016. These 11 seats would be won with no changes in votes from GE13 but only through the shifting of voters to strategic seats for BN.Similarly, in the September 2016 proposals for Melaka, the seat of Bukit Baru, won by Pakatan Rakyat by 48 votes in GE13, would be won by BN with a 1,600-vote majority with the new boundaries. The marginal seat of Telok Mas, won by BN by just 700 votes in GE13, would become a safe seat with a 3,000-vote majority.Worse still, based on the September 2016 proposal, the Bukit Katil federal seat, won by Pakatan Rakyat in GE13 by nearly 7,000 votes, would now be won by BN with a 4,800 vote majority. This move is especially suspicious, given that in August 2016, one month before the proposal became public, the Melaka Chief Minister called for the EC to change Bukit Katil boundaries to make it easier for BN to win.The same pattern emerges throughout the country. In Perak, the safe Pakatan Rakyat seats in GE13 of Changkat Jering and Sungai Rapat would be won by BN, with no change in votes. In Kuala Lumpur, Nurul Izzah Anwar would lose the seat of Lembah Pantai.http://www.themalaymailonline.com/what-you-think/article/the-new-election-boundaries-where-ge14-will-be-won-or-lost-zoe-randhawaThere is merit in having a snap election in Selangor soon.At least retain that before the EC's cheating takes hold.

column27: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,Off topic, Datuk...very off topic...minta maaf Datuk...tak payah la coretan ini di siarkan kalau tidak kena mengena...I would like to thank the Sandakan Memorial Scholarship Trust, Barker College in Australia, St Michael’s School in Sandakan and the Australians in general, for their kindness and generosity...may God bless you all, especially to those Australians who defended North Borneo and perished during the Sandakan Death Marches of 1945.Aussie college honours Dusuns for saving WWII POWs.May 29, 2017.Barker College is hosting three Sabah girls as a form of gratitude for the Dusun community's act of hiding six Australian POWs during the Sandakan Death Marches.PETALING JAYA: One of Australia’s most historic private colleges is honouring Sabah’s Dusun Christian community for its role in saving Australian prisoners of war (POWs) during World War II.Through the Sandakan Memorial Scholarship Trust, established by historian Lynette Silver and her husband, Neil, Barker College sponsors girls from farmers’ families in remote villages to attend secondary school at St Michael’s School in Sandakan.Silver told The Sydney Morning Herald (SMH) that so far, 37 girls had been sponsored to complete their studies, with eight going on to tertiary education.However, three girls in particular have been singled out to spend three weeks at Barker itself, as a tribute to six Australian POWs who survived the Sandakan Death Marches of 1945 thanks to the Dusun community.The Sandakan Death Marches were a series of forced marches by the Japanese of Australian and British POWs from Sandakan to a jungle death camp in Ranau. Over 1,000 POWs died on the marches.Only six survived, thanks to the Dusun Christian community which hid them for up to five weeks, according to Silver.“They never gave the POWs away despite the fact the Japanese were offering money and food to starving villagers if they handed over the POWs,” SMH quoted her as saying.“The risks were enormous. Had the POWs been discovered, the Japanese would have killed everyone in the village,” she said in the report.Genevia Binti Handry, 17; Suzie Binti Aitor, 18; and Agnes Jackson, 18, are being hosted at the college in honour of four Barker “Old Boys” who died in the atrocity – Corporal James Lillyman, Gunner Isaac Sefton, Lance-Bombardier Charlie Starky and Staff Sergeant Alan Waters.Lillyman, 37, died of starvation and malaria on June 17, 1943. According to the report, he was too ill to be sent on the death march. The other three, however, all died in 1945.Sefton, 43, died from beriberi and starvation on April 4. Starky, whose age was not provided in the report, died in January of starvation and malaria. Waters, meanwhile, died in Sandakan on June 9.Tony Gamson, president of the Old Barker Association which paid for the girls’ airfares to Sydney, told SMH that a total of 92 Old Boys died in war.“Hosting these girls is an opportunity to give back something to those people who put themselves in great danger protecting Australian POWs,” he was quoted as saying.According to the report, Genevia will soon begin university in Kuala Lumpur as a pharmacy student. Suzie wants to be a nurse, while Agnes wants to be a teacher.Barker College was founded in 1890. In a statement on its website, it said hosting Genevia, Suzie and Agnes helped form a more meaningful connection with “one of the nation’s saddest stories of WWII”.http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/nation/2017/05/29/aussie-college-honours-dusuns-for-saving-wwii-pows/
column28: {sukasamasuka} Datuk yang mulia,"Melayu akan hilang, amaran Dr M.May 29, 2017.Bekas perdana menteri itu berkata, bangsa Melayu akan gagal dan hilang di muka bumi kerana mereka sudah hilang semangat kebangsaan.PETALING JAYA: Kata-kata “Tak Melayu hilang di dunia” tidak mencerminkan nasib Melayu di zaman ini, kalau dilihat dari kaca mata bekas perdana menteri, Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad.“Apakah buku sejarah di zaman akan datang akan tertulis di dalamnya, ‘Maka di zaman dahulu terdapat satu bangsa yang dikenali sebagai Melayu, yang sudah pun hilang, kerana semangat bangsa luput diganti dengan ketamakan nafsu’,” tulisnya dalam catatan blog terkini.Pengerusi PPBM itu berkata, bangsa Melayu akan gagal dan hilang di muka bumi kerana mereka sudah hilang semangat kebangsaan.“Sesungguhnya saya amat sedih akan kehilangan semangat kebangsaan di kalangan orang Melayu, tua dan muda.“Jika tidak diupah dengan duit, pangkat atau jawatan, kontrak atau sebagainya biarlah negara hancur, tidak ada apa-apa yang sanggup dibuat untuk menyelamatnya. Jauh sekali dari menghadapi sedikit risiko.”Beliau membandingkan orang Melayu zaman ini dengan zamannya yang sanggup mengorbankan wang dan kehidupan sendiri demi memperjuangkan kebebasan negara serta menebus maruah bangsa tanpa mengharapkan sebarang balasan.“Hari ini orang Melayu sudah banyak berubah. Bagi ramai daripada kita, sudah tidak ada lagi kesayangan kepada bangsa dan negara. Semangat kebangsaan dicemuh sebagai perkauman – racist. Kita malu jika bersemangat Melayu.”http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/bahasa/2017/05/29/melayu-akan-hilang-amaran-dr-m/Luahan hati Tun memang tepat...“Jika tidak diupah dengan duit, pangkat atau jawatan, kontrak atau sebagainya biarlah negara hancur..."Datuk nenek moyang kami ada tinggalkan pesan...ada empat perkara yang akan menjatuhkan seseorang atau bangsa...perempuan, wang, arak dan judi...seperti cakap Tun!

column32: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,"Pemuda Melayu kemalangan tersentuh terima bantuan wanita cantik Sabah.May 29, 2017.KUALA LUMPUR: Empat hari kemalangan yang berlaku sekitar 11.30 pagi Ahad itu berlalu, namun hati Faizal Hasbullah Alimin, 20 masih rasa tersentuh menerima bantuan dua wanita Cina yang prihatin.Menurut Metro pada Rabu lepas, kemalangan berlaku di Lebuh Raya Kuala Lumpur-Karak, ketika Faizal bersama abang saudaranya yang menunggang motosikal lain hendak menuju Bentong dari Hulu Langat.Ketika itu, singgah dua wanita cuba membantu mengurus kecederaan pada tangannya.Kisah dan gambar Faizal dibantu wanita Cina terbabit tular di media sosial selepas abang saudaranya memuat naik gambar tersebut di Facebook, Isnin lalu.Pada Jumaat, The Star Online melaporkan Faizal sangat terkejut apabila doktor Cina yang pernah menolongnya itu datang melawatnya di wad.Faizal berkata, apabila dia mengucapkan terima kasih, doktor tersebut hanya menjawab “sama-sama”...Doktor wanita itu enggan mendedahkan namanya dan tempat dia bekerja.Memetik SuaraSabah.com pada Ahad, doktor wanita terbabit ialah anak kelahiran Sandakan, Sabah bernama Doktor Koh Siew Ling.Sementara itu, Datuk Bandar Kota Kinabalu, Datuk Boon Hai Yeo memuji tindakan doktor muda itu dengan memuat naik status di Facebook: “Well done Siew Ling…We are proud of you…Ur mum and family will be very proud too.. God bless you.”http://sarawakvoice.com/2017/05/29/pemuda-melayu-kemalangan-tersentuh-terima-bantuan-wanita-cantik-sabah-dr-siew-ling/God bless you Siew Ling!Note: Datuk Bandar Kota Kinabalu, Datuk Boon Hai Yeo is a Chinese Muslim.

column6: {Zalman A} "SHAH ALAM: PKR president Datuk Seri Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail will be interim prime minister should Pakatan Harapan win the 14th General Election, said party vice-president Rafizi Ramli (pic).The announcement, in his speech at PKR's 12th annual national congress Sunday, was followed by Rafizi detailing a plan that would have Dr Wan Azizah making way for her husband Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim to be prime minister."(Dr) Wan Azizah will be interim prime minister, and Anwar will be released (from prison)," he said to applause from the delegates.He said Anwar could be released from prison within a month of Dr Wan Azizah becoming interim prime minister."After he is out, we can hold a by-election to make him the prime minister," he added.Rafizi made the announcement despite Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia deputy president Mukhriz Mahathir's assertion earlier on Sunday that Pakatan's choice for prime minister will be discussed together by all parties before a decision is made."DatukNo person in their right mind will vote for Kak Wan.This is worse than the Kajang Move.I fear the Opposition is not getting its act together.And time is too short.

column10: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,So "What is Brewing at Finance Ministry?" seems to be nothing more than a simple distraction really, come to think of it...shall we say, just a sideline issue designed to confuse just about everybody and nothing more than that...but, wait...who will bring bigger plate to the table?Of course, none other than Irwan Serigar, our new Minister of Finance 11. Out you go Johari and Arul Kanda. It doesn't really matter to me.Closer to mind is what Zalman A 11:39 PM had been saying all along...the choice of the 7th PM of Malaysia.Politically, PKR of Pakatan Harapan had voiced out their choice, a bit rather too prematurely perhaps, but, they let the cat out of the bag, nonetheless.But, that choice doesn't make Anwar the 7th PM, but rather Dr. Wan Azizah.Say what you like, she will be the 7th PM of Malaysia.She is not a bad choice after all, considering anybody is better choice save for Najib..I was told even a monkey can be a better PM!So, we shall have the first woman PM, nothing to shout about considering India, Sri Lanka, UK, South Korea are well ahead of us, but woman as she is, that would be our first, not bad!So, what is in for all of us...I mean those who want BN to go. 1.  For once, UMNO is in for a real dilemma with that choice.2. She is as clean as a slate...now, that is something we never have before.3. She is not even a "politician"...or the lack of it...but, a simple housewife who just want to be a good wife and mother...very much like Tun Dr. Siti Hasmah.4. She is not a political animal, but a nurturing mother...perhaps that's what we need to heal Malaysia.5. There is no skeleton inside her closet...so????...what is there to attack her?..perhaps someone doesn't like her wearing gloves and fan...yeah, that can be political issues to be exploited by UMNO...at least something out of nothing.6. Kun Nan has no issue on her dress too.7. She is a very reluctant politician, I must say, don't you agree Zalman A?8. She doesn't want to be our PM...a bit strange, but that's the way she is.9. She is not Rafidah ok...or Sharizat...Sharizat, the Cowgirl?10. If the 50% of the women voters like her, there you have it.

column16: {The True Opposition} Taken from Steadyaku47 who shared this article from one of his readers:Datuk, please share with the PKR and DAP leaders.Stop being selfish (Rafizi?)  and get act together.  Stop being obsessed with Azizah/Anwar as the next PM.  Part I: johan iskandar  Message From A Malaysian VoterI am 47 years old, married male and a father of 3 kids. I run a small cafe in a small town that most of you probably never heard of before. I have never voted before and will be voting for the first time this next GE.The reason is because I feel that NOT voting this time around with all that I see happening to my country would be a terrible mistake! I feel that even if my vote will probably not change the dire conditions we are in at least my conscience will be clear.I am powerless otherwise to effect change when half the country seems to be filled with idiots, bigots, racists and religious zealots who have nothing better to do than sow turmoil and divide us further as citizens of this great country.I feel powerless and lost and agitated by what I read, hear and watch. WTF is happening is anyone’s guess. Be that as it may I feel my one vote will register with some numbers in the cosmos of our politics and that is a start.As a voter, I’m aghast at the stupidity I see from both sides of the political divide. The incumbent is a lost cause as I’m sure anyone with half a brain can see but the so called Opposition is worse! Here’s what I humbly suggest IF the Opposition is well and truly sincere in effecting the changes necessary to put our country on the right trajectory for all its citizens. Remember them? 1. Stop the petty bickering NOW!2. If PAS wants to leave so be it! Move on I say!3. Replace Wan Azizah as the (whatever she is in Keadilan).. She hasn’t the chutzpah to go up against the ‘enemy’. She maybe strong as a wife and a mother to have to go through all that she’s been through but on the National Level she simply doesn’t have what it takes!4. Name Dr. Mahathir as your choice of PM! Anwar can wait! Show us you’re putting the nations interest above your own this ONE time. And while you’re at it why not name the entire proposed cabinet so we can judge for ourselves.5. Forget the BN bashing... it’s getting stale. We already know what BN is. 6. It’s the economy...Stupid! Focus on the country’s economic future! What are you going to do for the nation? What changes are you planning? In detail? Communicate that with us and you might stand a chance of defeating the incumbents whatever dirty tricks they play.7. The rakyat (most that at least have the internet and actually knows how to use it anyway).. wants to see you win! But all these petty bickering and silly bravados is not doing you any favors! Stop it!8. Get to the ground running. What’s your message? Just saying you want to topple BN is not enough! Bring the masses your ONE true message and we’ll listen.9. It’s the little things. Communicate at our level, be ever humble, playing the victim is over. Get up and work for our votes!!!!! Work for it!!! It’s tough sure but you have chosen this path so stop your goddamn whining and start working!!10. Show unity! If one party wants to go its own way then let them! Get a single common logo and do that NOW! 11. Speak in ONE voice! Or keep your mouths shut!12. Get it together! Mission Impossible? Maybe..... But the other side of that is Never Say Never!!13. Forget Manifestos! No one pays the slightest attention to it! Safe your money for something else. Get down the grassroots and just talk and listen.contd in Part II
column17: {The True Opposition} Part IITaken from Steadyaku47's column:Part II contd:14. Enough about race, religion already! Get out of that ‘trap’. It serves no purpose in the larger scheme of things.Please... I implore you do all this as time is running out for you and for all of us. It’s CRITICAL that you be UNITED and has a CLEAR VISION of what needs to be done! I need you, we all do whether we like to believe it or otherwise. You’re our only hope and I don’t feel you are sincere or seriously committed to the whole idea of one day be given the responsibility of administering this country the way it needs to be administered so that everyone regardless of race, religion, social status will be given an equal opportunity and be provided with the framework for a level playing field in all matters so that all will prosper and no one will be left behind. So get to work will you? I mean REAL work and not this jibby jabby wishy washy pathetic excuse of campaigning that I see today. I sincerely hope that my message will reach out to those that matters the most and I wish you all the best in the coming GE and pray for your win!A Malaysian Voter.?
column18: {Zed-85} Saudara sukasamasuka,Berkenaan dengan Wan Azizah sebagai PM.Saya rasa yang paling penting dan utama adalah Pakatan boleh menang.Kalau Pakatan tak menang, usaha untuk keluarkan Anwar dari penjara amat susah.Oleh itu, bakal ketua Pakatan mestilah seorang yang boleh membawa Pakatan untuk menang.Saya rasa ramai yang simpati terhadap keluarga Anwar tetapi agenda utama Pakatan Harapan mestilah untuk memberi harapan kepada rakyat.Agenda yang berbentuk personal atau peribadi besar kemungkinan tak dapat sokongan ramai. column17: {Jojo} Eloklah jika kita semua bergerak ke hadapan (move on) dari PAS. Pada saya PAS sudah jadi parti dungu kerana mereka mahu bekerjasama dengan kleptokrasi. Islam bukan parti politik dan parti politik itu bukan mewakili Islam. Tidak wajib mengundi PAS. Malah adalah haram lebih2 lagi jika parti politik itu bekerjasama dengan kleptokrasi (pemerintahan penyamun) dan menolak bersama2 dengan penentang kleptokrasi.Jika PAS tidak mahu lagi bekerjasama dengan DAP, boleh sahaja PAS bersama2 dengan PH sebagai gabungan iaitu jv PAS+PH. PAS tidak perlu menjadi ahli PH cuma sekadar jv untuk menjatuhkan kleptokrasi. Kenapa perlu PAS jv dengan PH ialah kerana jika PAS bersendiri, parti ini akan terkubur dan akan membantu kleptokrasi menang kerana PAS hanya membantu memecah undi.Tapi memandangkan mereka lebih rela bersekongkol dengan kleptokrasi, eloklah kita semua maju ke hadapan tinggalkan PAS dan pasang strategi untuk menggagalkan kleptokrasi seterusnya mengembalikan kegemilangan negara ini.

column5: {Trengkas Usang} To be honest, Zaid's take on Pakatan's PM candidate actually makes sense. The country's elections ever since the independence almost always decided by the voters living in rural areas together with the Felda settlers. The only way to make them sway towards Pakatan Harapam is to nominate Mahathir as their candidate for prime minister post. I'm afraid there's no other way. Pakatan have to be strategic in their thinking. At the moment they are too idealistic. The country's real-politic don't work that way. If you're refusing to acknowledging this reality, you're forever doomed. Please do not let your egos and prides clouded your judgments. Please get real otherwise you're forever being in the opposition. Not being able to this fact will make them blind of what need to be done in order to defeat Umno BN and form the government. What's actually on Pakatan's mind when they trying to propose Wan Azizah as top choice? Let's be honest she does not quite have it. She's too lighweight. She is not like her husband. She doesn't the touch, the charisma to sway the hearts and minds of the Malays voters. Especialy those in the rural areas. Mahathir has that. In short she doesn't have enough clout to move the 'Malay's mountain'. To do that you gonna need someone of great stature. Someone massive, a heavyweight whose able to land mighty punches to the target. That someone is no other than Mahathir. Even Muhyiddin and Mukhriz will not make the cut. They won't be able to sway the Malay voters let alone Wan Azizah or Azmin or even Mat Sabu. In order to capture Putrajaya Pakatan needs Mahathir magic. Without him there's no way Umno can be defeated. Love him or hate him, there's no other way. If Pakatan doesn't trust him, at the moment, he is indispensable to the opposition. He's highly instrumental to energize the Malays' psyche towards massive and all around change of heart. The biggest change in their lives. Without Mahathir's presence they will not budge. Pakatan don't have much time left. They have to be quick. To come out with their PM's candidate. They can't afford to waste any more time. The clock is ticking. They need to start now. Malays' core sentiment are not easy to stir. It takes time. The sooner you start, you will stand a better chance. Just name Mahathir as your candidate. That's all. If you choose Mahathir, Malays votes in rural areas and the Felda settlers are already in the bag. The rest are just an icing on the cake.

column13: {Mr.Tai-pan.Jr} Malaysia 2k17 - Res Ipsa Loquitur (Part 1)Why Are We Still Harping On 1MDB?WRITING for The Malaysian Insight, Jahabar Sadiq asked a simple question that deserves an appropriate answer: Why does Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Bersatu) harp on 1MDB, when the 2,881 respondents in an internal poll have stated that their number one concern is the increasing cost of living? First of all, Bersatu is not the only party "harping" on 1MDB. Tuan Ibrahim of PAS has raised the issue. DAP has, of course, highlighted it the most through Tony Pua. But, as the author correctly noted, even Anwar Ibrahim had raised it in 2010, before the job was taken over by Rafizi Ramli in PKR. In other words, all parties are raising the issue and this includes, first and foremost, some members of Umno.  Dr Mahathir Mohamad, Muhyiddin Yassin and Mukhriz Mahathir had all raised within the internal structure of the party. But to no avail. Thus, Bersatu was formed to check the rot in Umno and the stain that the latter has left on the honour and dignity of the Malays. Secondly, the gargantuan size of the issue does not allow one to remain impervious to it. The author said that the average or rural voters cannot compute or comprehend anything in the billions of ringgit. Dr Mahathir has raised the same point too. But he has not given up, precisely because the voters fail to understand. It was now his duty to make them see the gravity of the situation.The job of exposing systemic and scurrilous corruption cannot be left solely to the countries that are investigating the financial malfeasance. As the author may note, there are six (or more) ongoing investigations into 1MDB. If this issue had been left to the device of "outsiders” only, wherein the pride of Malaysians? In fact, the whole of the country would stand accused of being cavalier with high larceny.  Thirdly, The Malaysian Insider then, has gained a strong following by exposing 1MDB almost on a daily basis in 2015. It didn't seem to lose any readers and followers. In fact, it is on this basis that it was probably bought over by The Edge, before it reincarnated as The Malaysian Insight. Has the new online portal dropped 1MDB? No. It can't. Precisely because this is an issue of serious national importance, with grave ramifications. If 1MBD does not rationalise its debts – and it doesn't seem like it can – Malaysian taxpayers would be looking at paying picking up the tab of RM43 billion or more. Granted that no one in Malaysia has been held criminally responsible, it is all the more vital to focus on the 1MDB issue. Perhaps the presentation to the people needs to be simplified given the complexity of 1MDB story involving a web of extra-territorial and international financial and non-financial institutions. Perhaps some Phd candidate in the field of finance, financial crime or even strategy should take up a research on this web of deceitful financial interplay. Fourth, since when is the focus on 1MDB  a zero sum game? By latching onto 1MDB, since when did Bersatu forgo other issues? It didn't, and it won’t. In fact, in the history of all political parties in Malaysia, none has resorted to using focus groups and opinion surveys right from the very inception of the party to understand the "voice of the people."Bersatu has done just that. It has canvassed the views of thousands of voters in order to warn Umno of its egregious violation of the fiduciary and financial rights of the Malaysian taxpayers. That shows Bersatu is truly a people’s movement that has evolved into a political party with very specific aims and objectives as enshrined in its constitution.
column14: {Mr.Tai-pan.Jr} Malaysia 2k17 - Res Ipsa Loquitur (Part 2)Why Are We Still Harping On 1MDB?Fifth, granted that the financial malfeasance of 1MDB is due to the financial ineptness of the Malaysian prime minister cum financial minister, indeed, cum public official as alleged, isn't it only apt to hold him to account, as he has failed in all three portfolios, as alleged? As the prime Minister, his dereliction of duties, as alleged, suggests a sheer indifference to corruption that had affected the entire fifth and fourth floor of his office, if not Umno in its entirety. As the sitting finance minister, some RM44 billion or more is allegedly now the debt of Malaysia's sovereign fund that is 1MDB. If Khazanah, the sovereign fund of Malaysia, had mismanaged the funds, wouldn't heads be rolling now? Yes, they would. But in the case of 1MDB, there has been zero culpability and accountability. Instead those who had wanted to initiate investigations into 1MDB had been either sacked, transferred or, in one case, even transferred to the Prime Minister’s Office. Done with such arrogated impunity. Last but not least, the debt of 1MDB could have been used to build basic amenities for the poor and under privileged people in Malaysia, without reference to race, creed and colour. Yet, instead of using the money to defray the economic pain and burden of the average Malaysian, the US Department of Justice investigations alone show that they splurged – yes, splurged – on art pieces, paintings, obscene movies, fancy condominiums in New York and elsewhere. If this is not conspicuous corruption and money laundering, both of which impact the living standards of the average Malaysian, what is? A media portal like The Malaysian Insight can serve Malaysia by focusing on, among others, issues of corruption, malfeasance, abuse of power, and grand larceny. It does itself a disservice by resorting to telling Bersatu – and by logical extension, other parties – to drop the issues from their agenda and re-education campaign. If anything, The Malaysian Insight should ask if there is anything it can do to help the Malaysian voters, both rural and urban, to understand the severity of the 1MDB problem. It is important that the rural voters, and that includes the Felda settlers, be told of what is happening in 1MDB in a simplified manner. Telling them about the Islamic Medium Term Notes that 1MDB had issued may not be the way to do it. Bersatu is willing to convene a cross party dialogue, with The Malaysian Insight in attendance, on why this issue can and will break Umno-led Barisan National (BN). Perhaps the author is right in suggesting that the average voter cannot comprehend the magnitude and scale of the alleged state-sponsored heist when it crosses the billion ringgit threshold, but the ongoing explanation cannot just stop. In fact, as the survey has showed, many of them are not sure about or do not understand the 1MDB issues. It is incumbent upon us, all parties and the media, to explain the issues in a more simplified way, as Dr Mahathir,  Muhyddin and Mukhriz have done after the survey.   The education system in Malaysia, weak as it is, still teaches students to differentiate between thousands and millions. All the students need to do to undestand is to break the figures up decimally. Thus, RM44 billion would be 440 times of RM100 million; or 4,400 times of 10 million; or 44,000 times of one million; 440,000 times of 100,000; or 4,400,000 of 10,000; or 44,000,000 of 1,000. Whichever the permutation, the Malaysian prime minister doesn't care. Had he done so, he would have spent the money in any one of the combination above in building better schools, hospitals, and universities. This 1MDB debacle is actually a huge "corruption tax" that the people need to bear, through no fault of theirs except in voting for Barisan Nasional. – May 11, 2017.  Dr Rais Hussin Mohamed Ariff is a Bersatu Supreme Council member and  the Bersatu policy and strategy bureau head.

column12: {sukasamasuka} Datuk,1. Dilemma politik PAS bukan dilemma Melayu...atau pun dilemma Islam.2. Melayu tak perlu PAS untuk survival bangsa...malahan tidak ada PAS pun, Melayu tetap ada juga.3. Kalau itu pasal Melayu, apa pula pasal Islam itu sendiri? Tak kan selepas 1,400 tahun, Islam perlukan PAS pula untuk survival...dan sejurus itu juga, bukan nya PAS yang membawa Islam ke Tanah Melayu dan ke Nusantara ini...not now, not in the next 1,400 years!4. Islam juga bukan pasal PAS bawa usul RUU355...itu omong2 kosong saja, Pak...sekadar hiasan luaran saja itu....orang bilang,laungan2 kosong dimusim pilihanraya saja, bila mana UMNO hanya tumpang sekaki.5. Islam itu juga bukan "pakaian luaran" ...serban nya...jubahnya...janggut nya...celak matanya...dan ketayapnya....itu kan hal2 sunatnya saja, bukan "Islam"nya...sebab, kalau itu saja yang dicari, lagi senang pergi saja la dimana2 kedai dan pasar gantung, banyak jual murah2....malahan ada orang gila dekat station bas pakai begitu...orang Arab kafir gembela babi di Egypt pun pakai begitu...hantu dan jembelang pun sama juga.Jadi yang orang2 PAS pakai itu adalah budaya orang2 Arab, bukan juga Melayu dan bukan juga "Islam"...tetapi kalau ada orang PAS yang berketurunan Arab, itu memang pakaian nenek moyang dia la.Lilitan serban putih si Hadi tu style keturunan dari puak Arab yang mana satu?...itu bukan Saudi...bukan Yemen...bukan juga Irag...dan, memang bukan Palestinian Arab...NO...NO...NO.Jangan suka2 hati pakai lilitan serban kalau tak tau hujung pangkalnya, ya habibi...sebab penjual daging babi di negara Arab pun pakai serban juga!Ini dilemma Islam dalam PAS kalau kita mau tau...cakap Arab saja belum cukup.6. Jadi, apa ka Dilemma Survival PAS itu, Datuk?Pasal Islam?...berapa ekor saja orang Islam dalam PAS?Pasal bangsa Melayu?...Melayu yang macam mana?...macam yang mengamal budaya Melayu atau yang macam berbudayakan suku kaum Arab?Pasal kuasa?...PAS kata hanya orang Islam saja yang bolih jadi Perdana Menteri Malaysia...macam la "Malaysia" ini bapa si Hadi yang punya!...pemikiran orang makan taik hidung!atau....atau dilemma yang satu ini, ya habibi...ia-itu7. "Dilemma Fulus"?8. Fulus talks, Datuk...said and done!9. UMNO ada fulus, Harapan ada apa?10. Itu la Dilema Kelangsungan Pas pada saat2 menjelang PRU14!

column14: {annai wants} Saya percaya ada org melayu yg berilmu yg diberikan oleh tuhan ttg risalah allah. Semuanya petunjuk jln lurus ada dlm rukun iman. Sbb nabi buat rukun islam pun disebabkan kaum arab ingkar dgn petunjuk di rukun iman yg disampaikan oleh nabi.Rujuk ayat 4 ali imran, sebelum al quran jadi petunjuk, ada satu la furqan diturunkan utk bezakan yg haq dan batil.Setakat ini saya tidak nampak ulama pas menyampaikan furqan pun...yg banyaknya ikut budaya arab...berlebih lebih dlm agama...mereka hanya perolehi sebahagian ilmu je...Perkara2 dlm rukun iman ulama pas gagal nak jangkau pun...mereka tidak diberikan pengetahuan....Kalau mana mana ulama dapat sampaikan furqan iaitu melerai rahsia dlm rukun iman, saya percaya islam itulah agama terbaik yg mempunyai petnjuk jln yg lurus....

column17: {Zed-85} Sallam Dato’Punca masalah antara Pakatan dan PAS pada pendapat saya adalah kerana matlamat dan tujuan Pakatan dan PAS berbeza.Pakatan hendak mengubah kerajaan dan menggantikan BN, tetapi PAS tidak berniat untuk ubah kerajaan. Sekurang-kurangnya 112 kerusi diperlukan untuk mengubah kerajaan.Kalaulah matlamat tak sama maka susah untuk berbincang dengan PAS.Ini umpama PKR, DAP, Amanah dan PPBM naik bas mahu ke putrajaya. Tetapi lebai-lebai PAS tak mahu ke Putrajaya tetapi mahu ke Kota Bahru. Ini yang jadi masalahnya.Cabarannya adalah mengajak lebai-lebai PAS bersama-sama ke Putrajaya.Saya rasa sebaik-baiknya Pakatan dapat buat tumpuan di Kelantan dengan menawarkan yang lebih baik kepada rakyat Kelantan. Pakatan boleh menawarkan kepada rakyat Kelantan biasiswa, royalti dan lain-lain yang mana PAS tidak boleh.Sekiranya Pakatan lebih diterima di Kelantan, sudah tentu PAS akan lebih rasioanal dan terbuka apabila berunding.Macamanapun, PAS tidak akan melepaskan negeri Kelantan. Kemuncak kepada usaha PAS iaitu RUU355 tidak berguna kalau PAS hilang negeri Kelantan.

column7: {PutraKraken} Salam DatukMaaf Datuk, saya teringat tak lama dulu Datuk ditegur kerana mengulas ekonomi yang bukan bidang kepakaran Datuk. Syabas Datuk!...saya faham dan bersetuju dengan ulasan Datuk....baiknya ekonomi mahupun politik. Diusia kita ini...pengalaman makan garam ada kelebihannya...Tu...kabinet Najib...memang semuanya pakar...sebab tu lah kita di tahap ni.Saya rasa Johari dan Husni jangan setakat membuat pengakuan itu bukan hasil rundingan mereka. Keluar dan luahkan apa yang mereka tahu...barulah nanti dapat tidur lena....Johari...kamu tahu MO1, MOF, PM dan Pengerusi Lembaga Pengarah 1MDB yang punya kuasa dalam Artikel 117 adalah orang yang sama. Kamu tu siapa?...hanya khadam yang mesti ikut telunjuk...dimana maruah kamu?1MDB dah mampos dah...bukan lagi sebuah syarikat yang "going concern"....mayat 1MDB dibawa ke MOF untuk dibekukan...dan MOF akur untuk mengambil alih semua tanggungan 1MDB. column11: {Rizal}  What does payment of USD1.2 billion result in? It results in Najib not having to stand in the dock and be grilled by questions. So Najib is actually finding ways to avoid going to court. Despite talking big and sounding virtuous and pretending angry at IPIC for denying it was paid, Najib and the government lied.So he pays up a little. But it is a ruse. It is just a refined and elevated way of saying- boss I pay u a bit, so donâ€™t take action against me ok? The lawyer termed it more stylishly as a no predicate offence. In practice it means, using some legal device to stop being brought to court. That is devious.Malaysia through 1MDB/MOF will take over all the financial obligations associated with the 2 bond issues guaranteed by IPIC. The total amount is USD3.5billion. It frees IPIC from responsibility of paying bondholders should Malaysia refuse to honour her obligations.In doing its business, most of them shadowy and suspicious, 1MDB ran up huge debts. More than USD50 billion. It borrowed some USD3.5billion from IPIC to pay off some portion of the mountainous debt. IPIC wants the money it loaned.The USD3.5billion loan has increased to USD4.8 billion with interests. The interest on the USD3.5billion is therefore USD1.3 billion. There is another small loan amounting to USD500millon including interest.So, that s why IPIC is demanding USD6.5 billion in total.Read my lips: Malaysia must pay USD6.5 billion to IPIC. If it pays the USD1.2, it still owes IPIC USD5.3 billon.

Plus the USD3.5 billion stolen- the amount is a whopping USD10 billion.1MDB is responsible to the USD3.5bliion to bondholders. column10: {Zalman A} Datuk,The recent developments in 1MDB.The Singapore papers report an ongoing settlement.However, everything goes back to the ECRL deal with China.The leaked term sheet of the ERCL contract reveals this.Total CCCC cost of acquiring all remaining parts of 1MDB and its worthless companies and fund units: USD7.5bn or MYR30 bn. Term Sheet, China’s obligations:(a) End July, CCCC assumes USD4.78 bn of 1MDB (i.e. 1MDB Energy) debt to IPIC, due between Oct 2016 and 2022.(b) Pay on 1MDB’s behalf USD850 mn to IPIC;(c) Buys at USD315 mn, two Jho Low-affiliated companies, Loh Corporation Berhad and Putra Perdana Berhad.(d) Acquisition of 1MDB Ayer Hitam (Penang land, at USD850 mn, payment to IPIC);(e) Acquisition of 1MDB Global Inv. (USD940 mn);(f) Acquisition of 1MDB Brazen Sky (USD1.56 bn); and,(g) Acquisition of 100% of 1MDB Energy Holdings [Price (a) = USD4.78 bn]The CCCC calculation is the near exact sum in 1MDB total losses (money ‘unverified’), estimated by the Auditor General as well as others.Doubling the rail contract price returns, by back looping, the cost of bailout from CCCC to Malaysia so that, on the surface, Najib Razak is seen to have not only resolved the 1MDB scam but also without incurring a sen. This deal wipes clean the slate at 1MDB, completely — with IPIC especially, and with 1MDB Energy (which underwrote the USD bonds along with IPIC); selling one of the last two pieces of land, Ayer Hitam; and by transferring ownership out of Brazen Sky, 1MDB Global Investments, Putra Perdana and others. It means China picks up all their liabilities, along with all of 1MDB’s criminal past and any asset issued in its name but frozen in the US and elsewhere.Loh Corporation Berhad and Putra Perdana Berhad have nothing to do with us.They are Jho Low owned companies.Hence not only is the Malaysian taxpayer paying double the oost of the ECRL, we are also clearing Jho Low's business debts.Is this legal?Of course not.In fact it should (in a civilized country) enhance Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil's jail term.If the Malays were less corrupt then Mappadulung would have been in jail years ago.
column11: {Zalman A} Trump is a man with a long history of corruption.But if he says bad things about Muslims, Americans still vote for him.Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil is a man with a long history of corruption.But if he plays race & religion games, Malays still vote for him.(Unlike Trump, Mappadulung must also add a lot of $$$$$$$.)The momentum of the DOJ action has been stalled because Trump fired the people in charge at the DOJ.We can only hope that the Swiss and Singapore will stay on it, and that the UAE will not lie to cover-up the wrongdoings at IPIC.Maybe the UAE are a better Muslim country than the corrupt Malaysians.

Dia bukan jahil sangat soal corporate deal dan corporate maneuvre. Dia pernah jadi CEO syarikat yang disenaraikan di Bursa Malaysia. Beli satu skuadron jet pejuang F18 Super Hornet lebihan tentera Amerika, banyak lagi kes boleh dibakulsampahkan.”You may be right.Let us look at the motivations of IPIC and hence the UAE leadership:a) They know full well that the “681 American pies” or the 681 million that arrived in Mo1’s account is proceeds from the bond sale that they were never paid for.b) They know full well that based on the other “syarikat tiruan” like Blackstone in this whole saga that the deception was deliberate.c) They know full well that their two officers Khadem al-Qubaisi and Mohamed Badawy al-Husseiny are full accomplices of Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil and Jho Low.Perhaps they only want to get their money back.The fact that the rakyat of Malaysia are playing twice the actual cost of ECRL is not their problem, because as long as Mappadulung hands over the money, the UAE are at least not losing financially.The biggest question is whwther they will hand over Khadem al-Qubaisi and Mohamed Badawy for questioning in jurisdictions that are affected.The offences of money laundering and fraud can still apply even if money is stolen from China deals to repay the first theft.I hope the 7 countries do not give up, even if Hisham buys 20 submarines, 3 aircraft carriers and a squadron of F18 Super Hornets.You can be sure that Umno & MO! will get “rezeki” from all military defence deals.That always happened even before 2009.

column29: {Rixal} Whatever qualifications were achieved by Mohd Puad Zakarshi, they plainly did not demand logic.Because, the settlement by 1MDB doesn’t undermine the DOJ case, to the contrary it confirms it. Period.If 1MDB had really paid $3.5 billion in ‘guarantee deposits’ to IPIC, as Najib continues to laughably claim, then Malaysia would never have lost the arbitration case and been forced to pay back the $1.2 billion that IPIC later bailed them out with.Instead, the court would have pointed out that the bail out was just a third of the up-front deposit and IPIC would actually still have over $2 billion of 1MDB’s money left.This is not what has happened.  The settlement involves an agreement by 1MDB to pay back the bail out money and to take over the responsibility for the remainder of its debts.It is therefore a concrete admission by Malaysia that it could not prove its claims that it had deposited a single cent let alone billions with IPIC.And that means that the money trails supplied by the DOJ investigations, showing instead that all the money was siphoned off into a bogus BVI account to pay for Jho Low, Rosmah and Khadem Al Qubaisi’s fun and frolics, has been confirmed by the settlement and not weakened.It is plain as daylight, yet this Minister of Disinformation is attempting to say the opposite. How stupid does he think people are in Malaysia?He is also asking people to believe that the payment is going to come from the ‘monetisation’ of non-existant ‘units’ that 1MDB also doesnt have, because all the PetroSaudi money was funnelled into another off-shore company (Good Star Limited) and stolen as well.Puad says we should believe his story because the PM’s office said it (just like they said IPIC received money which it didn’t).So, who is going to believe this illogical and mendacious fellow when he goes on to say that Najib won’t be touching taxpayer’s funds to repay the debt?Is there a single voter who believes that?
