column9: {Zed-85} Sallam Dato’Dalam sejarah kejadian manusia, setahu saya belum pernah ada orang yang berderma begitu banyak sekali iaitu RM2.6 billion terus masuk ke dalam akaun peribadi individu.Antara sumbangan derma yang terbesar di dunia adalah daripada Mark Zuckerberg iaitu pencipta Facebook berjumlah US1 billion, tetapi derma ini tidak masuk ke dalam akaun peribadi. Derma ini di masukkan ke dalam tabung derma untuk manfaat tertentu.Sumbangan derma yang masuk ke dalam akaun peribadi pernah terjadi di Indonesia apabila Sultan Brunei memberikan derma sebanyak US 2 juta, kepada Presiden Gus Dur pada tahun 90’an. Presiden Gus Dur telah dipecat setelah undi tidak percaya dilakukan oleh kongress Indonesia.Berita dari WSJ pula mengatakan sebenarnya RM2.6 billion bukan derma dari Tok Arab tapi adalah daripada duit 1MDB.Sampai sekarang tidak ada saman yang dilakukan kepada WSJ.Mengikut media massa pula, WSJ kemudian mendapat hadiah Pulitzer iaitu hadiah kewartawanan paling prestij kerana melaporkan skandal 1MDB.

column21: {Zalman A} PETALING JAYA: Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) mendakwa PAS sengaja mencari alasan untuk tidak menyertai gabungan pembangkang melawan Barisan Nasional (BN).Ketua Penerangan Datuk Kamarudin Md Nor berkata PAS sebenarnya sudah mengetahui lebih awal tentang hasrat PPBM membawa mereka menyertai gabungan untuk pilihan raya umum akan datang.“PAS pun sudah tahu,,,jadi tidak menjadi suatu yang baru,” katanya kepada FMT. “Ini sengaja nak jadikan alasan saja. Di PPBM kita tidak ada masalah.”Beliau menjawab kenyataan Presiden PAS Datuk Seri Abdul Hadi Awang hari ini, yang berkata rundingan kerjasama politik antara kedua-dua parti berakhir apabila Pengerusi PPBM Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad umum menyertai PH.Menurut Hadi, keputusan diambil kerana PAS tidak mahu bekerjasama dengan parti yang ada kaitan dengan DAP dan Amanah.“PAS pilih tak kerjasama itu nasib dia,” kata Kamarudin. “Sambutan terhadap PPBM dan parti pembangkang yang bersama PH juga luar biasa.” Ini semua petanda rakyaat sedia ubah kerajaan.”Datuk,Hadi is very kind.He says he will only take Selangor, Perak, Kelantan, Terengganu and Kedah for PAS.UMNO can have the rest.I wonder if Hadi is rooted in reality.Nik Abduh was thrashed in Pengkalan Chepa division voting.Does the "UMNO Hijau" branch of PAS have as much traction as they think they do?We shall see.In the meantime we await the RU355 sandiwara in Parliament, when Hadi's master MO1 also waits to "tumpang glamer".The Malays must be told to see through the hypocrisy.

column23: {Zalman A} SEBERANG PERAI: Kubu kuat Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim nampaknya tersedia untuk pertembungan antara PAS dan PKR selepas parti Islam memutuskan semua kerjasama dengan parti reformasi di kawasan Parlimen Permatang Pauh.Yang dipertua PAS kawasan Omar Hassan hari ini mendakwa PKR cuba menjejaskan kedudukan PAS dalam kalangan pengundi Melayu-Islam di sana menjelang Pilihan Raya Umum ke-14 (PRU-14).Beliau juga mendakwa PKR tidak menghormati PAS sebagai rakan kerjasama kerana mereka mengekalkan kerjasama dengan DAP dan Parti Amanah Negara untuk menyerang mereka.“PKR didapati sewenang-wenangnya menggunakan sebilangan ahli PAS untuk kepentingan politik PKR tanpa perbincangan terlebih dahulu dengan PAS,” katanya dalam kenyataan hari ini.Lebih memudaratkan apabila ahli PAS mengadu PKR meminta mereka keluar parti bagi tujuan memegang jawatan tertentu dalam kerajaan negeri Pakatan Harapan, tambahnya.“Sifat tidak bertanggungjawab oleh PKR ini menunjukkan PKR sangat tidak menghormati prinsip setiakawan dan boleh menjejaskan PAS,” katanya.And so it begins.This is the start of Umno Hijau's push to return MO1 to power.Next month, in April PAS will formally talak tiga PKR after the PAS assembly.hadi and MO1 have already, no doubt, "divided the map" of the Peninsula (PAS has zero hope in East Malaysia.)Hadi is not greedy, he only wants to rule 5 states.That includes Selangor and Perak.The Malays will be very generous to give Selangor and Perak to Hadi, who did a terrible job in Terengganu and was kicked out after one term as MB.Melayu mudah lupa?

Di satu ayat Quran yang lain, Allah firman, selama 50,000 tahun. Berseronoklah kau buat sementara waktu!

column8: {Pompuan} SALAM DAKJBuat apalah Tun nak berdebat dengan Nazri. Tak mendatangkan apa-apa faedah kepada UMNO ataupun pembangkang. Dan juga kepada negara. column11: {A KADIR JASIN} 1. Pembahas Pompuan, antara lain, berkata: “Buat apalah Tun nak berdebat dengan Nazri. Tak mendatangkan apa-apa faedah kepada UMNO ataupun pembangkang. Dan juga kepada negara. Kira-Kira merendahkan martabat Tun lagi. Nazri is game for anything. He basks in the limelight. He will not lose anything. It's Tun who will further erode his dignity. Tun is a class above the rest. He is not acting like a statesman at all. The perfect match for Nazri is Boboi.”2. Apa saja yang kita buat dengan niat yang baik dan disertai kebijaksanaan, Insya Allah akan bawa hasil hatta berbahas dengan seorang MP kelas Boboi.3. Mungkin MP kelas Boboi tak mampu bagi kita ilmu dan pengetahuan, tapi ramai orang yakin Tun boleh mengajar mereka sesuatu.4. Itulah yang kita baca selama ini mengenai hujah dan kenyataan Tun di dalam media massa. Banyak soalan yang wartawan tanya adalah kelas Boboi tapi Tun bagi jawapan kelas dunia.5. Itulah Tun yang Pompuan sendiri akui bila dia berkata “Tun is a class above the rest “.6. Also Tun has repeatedly said, he is not concerned about how he is perceived and remembered. He is not interested in being a statesman and resting on his laurel while the country he helped built is run to the ground by a kleptocratic leader.7. We should thank Mohamed Nazri for his willingness to debate with Tun in a public arena since the BN-controlled Parliament has disallowed all attempts to debate these issue in the Chamber.8. I would say, thank you “the chief” for according us the opportunity.Wallahuaklam.
column12: {Buyong} Dato, Kalau kita imbas kembali sejarah debat Nazri, kita Akan ingat debat Nazri-Salahuddin Ayop di Dewan Bahasa Dan Pustaka suatu waktu  dahulu. Pada masa itu saya penyokong kuat UMNO. Dari mula hingga  akhir perdebatan saya kecewa dengan Nazri yang mewakili UMNO.Datang dengan hanya berkain pelekat, berkopiah putih dan tersengeh2 cuba mengawal perasaan gementer agaknya. Semua isu yang dibahas Dan soalan yang ditanya tidak dijawab dengan betul  sebaliknya lari dari topik, mempersenda dan banyak membuang masa perbahasan.  Saya yakin Nazri Akan mengguna taktik yang sama. Nazri tidak akan bersedia untuk perdebatan ini sebab dia tahu memang tiada jawapan kepada persoalan yang dibincangkan. Sebaliknya nazri akan sentiasa cuba membuang sebanyak masa yang boleh dan membuat serangan peribadi yang tiada kena-mengena dengan topik. Keesokannya, mainstream media akan menonjolkan nazri sebagai jaguh kerana berjaya berhadapan dengan Tun. (Walaupun dia hanya bercakap kosong sepanjang perbahasan).Tv kerajaan tidak Akan menayangkan perbahasan ini. Kita perlu mencari saluran sebanyak mungkin untuk membuat live streaming supaya rakyat dapat menilai tanpa perlu 'bantuan tafsiran' dari media kerajaan.
column13: {Pengamen Endang} Talking about the most ardent admirer and ferocious defender Datuk Kadir, I just can't bring myself to support a leader who steal money from public fund to provide wealth and luxuries to his family. I just can't. The thing is, the deeds he committed past several years couldn't even be defined as corruption per se. Typical corruption case there must be some kinda transaction, be it business dealings, favouritism, kickbacks, etc. but the thing that he did was outright stealing. Lot of it. Typical Malay attitude. Always looking for the easiest way possible to make money. Always shy away from doing the hard work. With all the powers one has at disposal, why not being creative about it. There must be a way to have lots and lots of money in the shortest period of time. And the art of funneling all those monies without looking like thieving. There's must be a way. There's always a way to bypassing all the rules.Rather than setting up proper company and win favour through corrupt dealings, like past corrupt leaders used to do, there is other way it seemed which was much much more easier. That is stealing outright from the country's treasury. Of course you can't do it openly. You need to create some kinda fund to raise the money. Bilions upon billions. And move the monies somewhere else in far far away land. Somewhere safe and hidden from the glares of Malaysian authorities such as Bank Negara, LHDN, Customs, and MACC under the pretense of overseas' investments. And then you pilfer every now and then if the need arises.
column14: {Mat Bakar} Sallam DAKJ,Padang Rengas dalam kenangan, bandar kecil ini akan selalu saya tempuhi setiap kali konvoi saya dalam perjalanan ke utara setiap kali di beri misi memburu dan menghapuskan pengganas komunis di utara negara (sempadan Kedah/Thailand) di tahun tahun awal 70an. Begitu juga tika saya bertugas di markas 2 Beriged, Ipoh, pasti saya akan tempuhi pekan ini bila ke unit unit tentra di Taiping. Perhatikan pohon pohon durian dan buah buah lain yang tumbuh subur di sepanjang jalan hingga ke Bukit Berapit. Memang subur dan menawan hati terutama pada mereka yg tinggal di KL.Apakah pertembungan Tun dan Nazri akan terjadi? inilah persoalan yang sedang mendesak otak saya, apakan Nazri ingin dimalukan di hadapan penyokong dan warga Padang Rengas. Tun memang bijak memilih PR sebagai venue untuk pertembungan ini. Bagai seorang Panglima perang yang sedang mengumpan musuhya masuk ke dalam "killing Zone" dan memberi pukulan maut.Ikhlas saya katakan bahawa Nazri tidak mungkin berhadapan dengan Tun kerana Tun terlalu knowledgeable dan boleh mematahkan setiap hujah Nazri sebagaimana seorang komando yang pakar mematahkahkan leher musuh setiap kali membuat serangan senyap. Sebagaimana biasa alasan demi alasan akan diberikan untuk Nazri mengelakkan diri dari pertembungan ini. Kita tunggu dan lihat bagaimana ( "Pondan of Padang Rengas" bukan saya kata tapi Zam yang kata), akan mengelakkan diri dalam debat ini. Sallam sejahtera.Wallahukalam.

Dan Tong San pon turunkan nilai duit dia, di turut oleh Jepun....Ada wakil rakyat ni nak mintak maghap...? Tengok: Aug 11, 2015 - KUALA LUMPUR: Tourism and Culture Minister Datuk Seri Nazri Aziz said the depreciation of the ringgit is good for the country's tourism industry. “Only mad people do not understand what it ...(Astro Awani).  'Rengaih' dlm basa tempatan magna gatai atau gatai melampau, katanya pokok Rengaih ni ada racun, munkin Mad bin Saleh kata 'toxic'.Kadiag, aku nak tulih pasai lain sikit yg penkomen lain pon ada singgong, yagni para perlu kita kekai dijalan untuk ujudkan satu "mass movement", satu gerakkan massa, macam di Korea Selatan yg tumbangkan presiden depa...Ni pulak dari Jawa Pos, 11 Mac, tak salah aku berpuloh orang kena ligan oleh Komisi Pemberentasan Korupsi (KPK) kerana tersangka songlap fulus buat kad pebgenalan elektronik ....(untuk yg tak berapa paham, aku syak "parpol" magna patii politik dan "Kemendagri" pulak magna Kementerian Dalam Negeri)"dakwaan tindak pidana korupsi proyek pengadaan KTP elektronik (e-KTP) yang kini mulai disidangkan, diduga bukan hanya terdakwa mantan pejabat Kemendagri Irman dan Sugiharto yang terlibat, tetapi juga politisi terkemuka dari berbagai parpol. Terdakwa Irman bahkan menyebut beberapa parpol, termasuk parpol yang sedang berkuasa sekarang, turut menikmati uang suap proyek e-KTP yang diduga merugikan negara sekitar Rp 2,3 triliun dari nilai proyek Rp 5,9 triliun itu. Besarnya nilai uang yang digunakan untuk menyuap menunjukkan bahwa kasus tersebut merupakan kasus besar yang mempermalukan bangsa dan negara. Karena itu, kasus tersebut harus diungkap sampai tuntas.KPK tentu tidak akan berhenti mengungkap kasus ini hanya pada Irman dan Sugiharto serta sejumlah politikus, tetapi juga wajib menyidik keterlibatan parpol dalam perkara tindak pidana korupsi ini. Parpol adalah instrumen politik yang sangat penting dalam sistem politik dan demokrasi kita di bawah UUD 1945. Tanpa parpol, takkan ada pemilu legislatif dan pilkada. Bahkan, tanpa parpol, mustahil ada pemilihan presiden dan wakil presiden. Sebab, hanya parpol yang dapat mencalonkan pasangan calon presiden dan wakil presiden." Mintak maghap Kadiag no.Aku

column16: {sukasamasuka} Datuk.This is the way to go..."DAP promises Sabah, Sarawak 50% of all tax revenue...March 5, 2017...DAP secretary-general Lim Guan Eng reiterates DAP's pledge to give full autonomy to Sabah and Sarawak in line with Malaysia Agreement 1963.PETALING JAYA: DAP has outlined its autonomy plans for Sabah and Sarawak, vowing to return 50% of all tax receipts collected from the two states.DAP secretary-general Lim Guan Eng said DAP is committed to granting autonomy to Sabah and Sarawak in line with the Malaysia Agreement 1963 (MA63) should Pakatan Harapan and its allies form the federal government.“This includes full autonomy in the funding and administration of healthcare and education,” Lim told media today at a press conference following the DAP National Leadership Retreat 2017 held at a hotel in Subang Jaya over the weekend.He added however, that the autonomy in education will still be subject to the national curriculum.On the issue of financial commitment to the two states, Lim said a Pakatan-led Putrajaya would pay out 20% in oil royalty from Sabah and Sarawak’s respective oil revenue as well as return 50% of all taxes collected, including from the GST, to the states’ coffers.Presently, Sabah and Sarawak only receive a 5% royalty from their respective oil revenue.Under the Tenth Schedule of the Federal Constitution, Sabah and Sarawak are supposed to receive 40% of their respective states’ revenue from Putrajaya. In recent times, this has been a contentious issue, especially among opposition parties in the state.“Sabah and Sarawak will be fully responsible for the administration and financing of health and education in their states. They should have enough funds from the increased oil royalty and returned taxes,” Lim said.“Those who want autonomy, please support DAP.”Meanwhile, Sarawak DAP chairman Chong Chieng Jen, who was also present, said that DAP would hold true to its promise of autonomy and claimed that this was unlike Sarawak Barisan Nasional (BN).He claimed that even though Sarawak BN spoke on issues of autonomy, in reality it is a “servant and master” situation where the Sarawak government has to “beg” for autonomy from Putrajaya.“On the other hand, DAP is offering autonomy to Sabah and Sarawak.”Chong added that DAP will push for the inclusion of more Sabah and Sarawak’s history in the national curriculum, as well as reviving English medium schools and the teaching of native languages in the state."source: http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/nation/2017/03/05/dap-promises-sabah-sarawak-50-of-all-tax-revenue/1. IF there is no political understanding between DAP and the other Sabah-based Opposition parties in the next GE14...my vote is to DAP.2. column20: {sukasamasuka} Datuk."Monday, 6 March 2017....6,000 public university lecturers lost their jobs in 2016.As many as 6,000 lecturers in public universities, including professors, were either terminated from their jobs or had their contracts not renewed last year due to budget cuts.  It is estimated that the total number of public lecturers has dropped to 29,000, compared with 35,000 previously. Malaysian Academic Association Congress (MAAC) president Prof Datuk Dr Mohd Idrus Mohd Masirin said public universities had been adversely affected by the budget cuts in 2016, by at least 30% to 40%. He said the Education Ministry's move had forced universities to cut academic staff. Dr Mohd Idrus said some public universities had even resorted to not hiring administration staff to keep costs low."source: http://www.thestar.com.my/news/in-other-media/2017/03/06/lecturers-lost-their-jobs-in-2016/Mau cakap apa lagi?

column25: {sukasamasuka} Datuk."DAP can promise Sabah autonomy but will Pakatan, PPBM agree...March 7, 2017.Sabah party leader says Pakatan Harapan can't even agree on who will be prime minister, so how will they agree on giving Sabah back billions in revenue.PETALING JAYA: A Sabah opposition party leader has questioned DAP secretary-general Lim Guan Eng’s understanding of the Malaysia Agreement 1963 and the DAP’s promise of autonomy for Sabah and Sarawak.Speaking to FMT, SAPP deputy president Melanie Chia also questioned whether Lim could make promises on autonomy for Sabah and Sarawak on behalf of the opposition coalition Pakatan Harapan and Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM).“It’s unlikely that Mahathir will agree to DAP’s promise of giving us 20% oil royalty and returning 50% of all tax receipts collected from the state.“They can’t even agree on who will be prime minister. Can they agree on giving Sabah back billions in revenue?” she said.Over the weekend, Lim outlined DAP’s autonomy plans for Sabah and Sarawak should Pakatan Harapan and its allies form the federal government.He added this included full autonomy in the funding and administration of healthcare and education, 20% in oil royalty from Sabah and Sarawak’s respective oil revenue as well as the return 50% of all taxes collected, including from the GST, to the states’ coffers.However, Chia said returning 50% of all tax receipts to the state was unconstitutional.“We aren’t even getting what is constitutionally owed to us and he wants to promise us something which isn’t even in the constitution? Does he really know what he’s talking about or is he just making election promises?Chia also said DAP’s promise of autonomy in the administration and funding of education smacked of insincerity as Sabah and Sarawak should have a say over their education curriculum.She also slammed Lim for saying the 20% oil royalty and 50% tax revenue from the state should be enough for Sabah to look after its own education and healthcare needs.“There is a clear difference between us wanting to take back what is rightfully ours and the duties and responsibilities of the federal government, regardless of whether it is a Barisan Nasional or opposition government. Lim should understand this.”source: http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/nation/2017/03/07/dap-can-promise-sabah-autonomy-but-will-pakatan-ppbm-agree/1. Who is SAPP?SAPP lost all state seats in the last PRU13.Even their President Yong Teck Lee lost to Junz Wong of DAP by 5,652 majority in N14 - LIKAS.Junz Wong had since left DAP to join Warisan (Datuk Seri Shafie Apdal) as its Vice President.Yong Teck Lee, once the Big Sabah Taiko, was the Chief Minister of Sabah in 1996 under the two-year rotation system arranged by the Barisan Nasional coalition in the state. The Chinese and Sabahans will never vote for this taiko no more as he did nothing as Chief Minister, but, guy sure can talk big.2. Who is Melaine Chia? She lost the Luyang seat (N16) to DAP by 8,676 majority...and, she too will never be voted by Chinese.3. column31: {Zalman A} ETALlNG JAYA , March 8 ? Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) and PAS will enter into negotiations on seat allocations in the next general elections, Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin said today.Muhyiddin, who is PPBM president, confirmed the cosier ties between the two federal Opposition parties, which he said have ongoing discussions led by PPBM deputy president Datuk Seri Mukhriz Mahathir and PAS deputy president Datuk Tuan Ibrahim Tuan Man.“So we have already received a new signal; PAS invited us to discuss seat allocations. That is a great way forward. There is progress and we will facilitate this in our meeting soon,” he said at the PPBM headquarters.“So this is the development. However, we still feel a framework of cooperation with PAS must be clear and also take into account the cooperation that we have already formed with Pakatan Harapan,” Muhyiddin added, referring to the federal Opposition pact.When asked how PPBM will deal with any possible clashes or overlaps in its two separate seat allocation talks with PAS and Pakatan Harapan, Muhyiddin said: “We will sort it out. We will try as much as possible to sort it out.”Datuk,This is a step in the right direction.Strategy is all-important.I think PAS and Amanah will have to make some mutual sacrifices.I hope both parties can see the importance of PRU14 to Malaysia's future.If MO1 returns to power we will see corruption like never before in our history.Do we want that?

column7: {Zalman A} Our Crime Minister is better at stealing money than managing it..."SINGAPORE, Feb 27 — When Malaysia forced foreign investors in its markets not to dabble in offshore derivatives in its currency last year, its target was speculative pressure on the ringgit, but it appears to have shot itself in the foot.The ringgit was the weakest currency in emerging Asia last year after China’s yuan, prompting Malaysia’s central bank to get a written commitment from foreign banks to stop trading ringgit non-deliverable forwards (NDFs), offshore contracts they use to hedge their exposure to the currency.The upshot has been a flood of money leaving Malaysian bonds as foreigners, who own US$47 billion of them, were unable to hedge their risks in onshore markets because of a lack of liquidity.“It’s a market that’s kind of been destroyed,” said Gene Frieda, the London-based global strategist at bond giant fund Pimco, who blamed the inability to hedge for making it difficult to make significant bond trades.Although Frieda said the currency now looked cheap compared with regional peers, he couldn’t see it rallying under the circumstances."This policy of BNM is backfiring.Why does Finance Minister (1) also known as "MO1" resign?He is killing the economy.

column10: {sukasamasuka} Datuk." Baru-baru ini saya tanya seorang ahli ekonomi dan penyelidik muda yang sedang naik namanya, apakah BR1M boleh atasi kesan GST ke atas orang miskin?Dia jawab macam ini:"Kutipan GST tahun 2016 kira-kira RM39 bilion. Bilangan isi rumah di Malaysia 6.35 juta. Jadi bayaran purata GST setiap isi rumah kira-kira RM6,141 setahun.“Ini anggaran kasar sebab perniagaan pun bayar GST. Saya tidak tahu peratusan GST yang dibayar oleh pengguna dan perniagaan."1. Aku rasa "ahli ekonomi dan penyelidik muda" ni sudah silap la Datuk.2. Kutipan GST tidak ada kena mengena dengan 6.35 juta isi rumah sebab "isi rumah" atau "rumah kediaman" BUKAN nya "Tax Collector".3. Premis perniagaan adalah "Tax Collector" untuk kerajaan, tetapi jumlah kutipan GST pun bukan berdasarkan berapa banyak nya premis perniagaan itu...sebab kutipan GST bergantung pada berapa banyak hasil penjualan dari perniagaan itu...lagi banyak menjual, lagi besar la kutipan GST nya...ini la yang dipanggil "Consumption Tax".4. Jadi, "purata GST setiap isi rumah kira-kira RM6,141 setahun" sudah silap.5. GST di kutip dari setiap orang yang berada di bumi Malaysia...termasuk31,700,000 penduduk Malaysia,27,000,000 pelancong asing*2,000,000 Pandatang Tanpa Izin, 1,860,000 Pekerja Asing pegang Pas Lawatan Kerja Sementara,Jumlah = 62,560,000 ini ada la pembayar GST.*termasuk pelancong asing walaupun mereka mungkin hanya tinggal dalam 1-2 minggu sahaja di Malaysia...makanya sukar untuk membuat purata dalam setahun.6. Setiap orang dari yang paling miskin tepi jalan raya hingga billionare akan bayar GST yang sama kalau mereka makan sayur kubis.7. GST tidak menjana aktiviti ekonomi baru atau hasil kutipan cukai dari industry baru sebab ia adalah "consumption tax".8. BRIM menjana "consumption"...dimana penerima2 BRIM akan belanja beli barang2 seperti pakaian, perkakas dapur dsbnya yang dikenakan GST.9. Jadi siapa yang dapat RM1,200,"nilainya" sebenarnya hanya tinggal RM1,128 sebab barang2 yang dia beli semua kena 6% GST.10. Pada dasarnya hubungan BRIM dan GST ini sama la dengan kalau tangan kanan UMNO hulur RM1 kepada rakyat, tetapi tangan kiri dia sudah ambil RM5.74 dari poket belakang setiap rakyat!(The Ratio RM39 billion GST : RM6.8 billion BRIM)

column19: {Zed-85} Sallam Dato’Orang melayu kena belajar akaun untung rugi.Selama ini orang melayu tak ada untung, ramai yang rugi.Kalau kira guna buka 555 pun boleh, bukan buku 355.Kalau dapat BR1M, kira 1 untung.Kalau bayar GST, kira 1 rugi.Kalau subsidi tarik balek, memang garenti rugi. Tak ada was-was. Sudah 2 kali rugi.Kalau harga barang naik, harga rumah naik melangit, harga kereta memang sudah tinggi. Sudah 3 rugi.Kalau toll naik, sudah 4 kali rugi.Kalau duit kita jatuh sekarang ini lebih teruk dari Thailand dan Indonesia. Sudah 5 kali rugi.Sekarang ini, biasiswa susah nak dapat , sudah 6 kali rugi.Setakat ini sudah untung 1 kali, rugi 6 kali.Ada juga orang PAS yang sokong GST. Tapi orang PAS sekarang sudah kaya raya. Pakai kereta Audi, mungkin tak heran sangat pasal GST.Al-Kisah dulu di England, ada Pahlawan Robin Hood. Robin hood menyamun orang-orang kaya kemudian memberikan kepada orang miskin. Pada waktu itu, tidak ada hukum hudud potong tangan di England.Sekarang ini, pada pandangan saya, ada banyak pahlawan Robin melayu, merompak dan menyamun orang miskin tapi di bagi balik semula miskin separuh, simpan separuh. Orang melayu pun ucap terima kasih daun keladi.
column20: {panglimo potaseh} Pada 1977/78 .. saya di tingkatan enam. Tanpa sedar, saya dan rakan melayu lain yang sekelas telah diberi kerajaan masa tu duit poket 55 ringgit sebulan atau 550 ringgit setahun. Masa tu kasut kulit ala Travolta baru 18 ringgit, jean levis 37 ringgit, sarapan teh dan roti canai 40-50 sen je. Saya tak pasti samaada kerajaan sekarang ada beri duit poket pada pelajar tingkatan enam. Kalau ada mungkin nilainya dah capai 10 kali ganda.Kelakar nya pemberian BRIM sekarang, semacam di bagi bermalam dengan bidadari syurga .. riuh rendah. Dapatnya RM450 hingga RM1200 se isirumah. Makna di hari pemberian BRIM tu laki-bini, Datuk-Nenek akan berdebat sapa dapat apa. Kalau diterjemahkan kepada dapat 1 kapla .. ia jadi RM90-RM240 sekapla .. alahai .. tu nilai sekarang .. aku sebagai budak sekolah 40 tahun dulu dapat 550 ringgit setahun?
column21: {A KADIR JASIN} 1. Pembahas ZED-85, antara lain, berkata:"Orang melayu kena belajar akaun untung rugi. Selama ini orang melayu tak ada untung, ramai yang rugi.Kalau kira guna buka 555 pun boleh, bukan buku 355.Kalau dapat BR1M, kira 1 untung.Kalau bayar GST, kira 1 rugi."2. Zaman saya kanak-kanak dan remaja dulu, bila emak atau ayah suruh ke kedai beli barang runcit, mereka akan bagi buku kecil jenama 555. Itu adalah buku hutang kedai runcit Cina. Cina kedai runcing pun simpan satu. Bila musim menuai tiba, Cina kedai runcit akan kira hutang dan ayah akan bayar dengan hasil padi.3. Kemudian saya diperkenalkan kepada buku untung-rugi bila ayah buka kedai runcit. Kemudian kedai lesen getah dan akhir sekali daging segar.4. Duit BR1M itu "untung kasar" sebab kalau belanja ke atas barang dan perkhidmatan kena tolak 6 peratus GST.5. Katalah semua dibelanjakan ke atas barang dan perkhidmatan yang kena GST, yang dapat RM450 akan bagi balik RM27 kepada kerajaan. Yang dapat RM900 akan bayar RM54 GST dan yang dapat RM1,200 kena bagi balik RM72.6. Pembahas Panglimo Potaseh, saya pun dapat juga RM50 sebulan masa dalam Form Six tahun 1967 dan 68. Dapat duit pergi Penang beli jeans Lee di Pitchay Gani Penang Road. Ada yang curi-curi ke Hatyai. Kena tanggap di Stesen Kereta Api Alor Star dan dirotan.7. Pembahas Buyong berkata: "Najib is a theft." DoJ Amerika tak kata macam ini. Mereka kata MO1 adalah kleptokrat.Wallahuaklam. Terima kasih.
column22: {Zalman A} KUALA LUMPUR: Mesyuarat Pakatan Harapan dan Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) hari ini belum memuktamadkan perbincangan pengagihan kerusi pilihan raya umum akan datang.Setiausaha Agung PKR Datuk Saifuddin Nasution berkata proses rundingan masih panjang memandangkan wakil PPBM – Timbalan Presiden Datuk Seri Mukhriz Mahathir dan Naib Presiden Tan Sri Abdul Rashid Abdul Rahman – tidak dapat menghadiri mesyuarat hari ini.“PPBM perlukan sedikit lagi masa sebab tugas untuk mengenalpasti kerusi yang PPBM akan bertanding belum selesai,” kata Saifuddin kepada pemberita seusai mesyuarat di ibu pejabat Amanah hari ini.PKR, DAP dan Amanah sudah selesai menjalankan kajian kerusi pilihan raya mereka.“Saya faham kerana PPBM baru sahaja ditubuhkan dan mereka sedang membaca tentang keupayaan dan kemampuan PPBM.”Menurut Saifuddin, banyak persetujuan dicapai dalam perbincangan lebih 3 jam antara komponen Pakatan Harapan hari ini. Hasilnya akan dibawa ke mesyuarat seterusnya.“Mesyuarat pengagihan kerusi adalah proses yang panjang dan berterusan. Soal pertindihan kerusi adalah sangat minimum. Semua perbincangan ini akan diselesaikan sebelum PRU,” katanya.Datuk,time is too short for these uncertainties.MO1 may call for election as soon as the gerrymandering passes Parliament.Also beware of a sudden attack on Selangor with PAS collaboration, if there is a sudden decision to cut ties with PKR in April.Hadi is mot to be trusted.If this happens, then PKR, Amanah & PPBM will have to unite to defend Malay areas of Selangor when PAS engineers 3-way fights.
column23: {sukasamasuka} Datuk."Jadi kalau kita kaji dan halusi, susah kita nak telan hujah yang kata GST selamatkan negara"1. System cukai GST ini suatu system cukai gila.2. Satu hantu pun tidak tau yang mana satu barang atau servis yang kena GST dan yang mana pula dikecualikan...kecuali pegawai kastam, itu pun bukan semua yang tau.3. Kita hanya tau kena GST bila dalam bil ada kena charge GST...mau gaduh pun susah sebab tidak ada orang yang tau...all system-driven...sebenarnya, kita tidak tau kalau kerajaan curi curi sudah masukkan list barangan atau services yang sebelum ini tidak ada GST.4. Tetapi, secara kasarnya, GST bukan 6%...contoh nya import cabbage kena 6% at point of entry...bila dekat restoran, masakan cabbage kena 6% GST...begitu juga bawang, soya, kopi,tepung gandum, susu dsbnya...jadi kita sudah bayar 12% GST bila makan sarapan, lunch atau dinner diluar!5. Itu la sebabnya Hadi salah...GST bukan "penggerak utama ekonomi negara"...tetapi, sebenarnya menghisap darah rakyat hingga ke tulang sumsum...sekarang mau drive my 2ndhand Kancil pun bukan main sakit...tetapi, sekali sekala dapat juga tumpang mandi di kolam renang belakang rumah aku...aku ada tiga, Datuk...kolam itik, kolam ikan keli dan kolam kerbau.

column27: {sham zam} salam dakjSemasa saya di utm skudai tahun 1990/94, saya akan balik kampung setiap cuti semester. Balik naik keretapi dgn menggunakan tiket konsesi umtuk pelajar sekolah/universiti yg diperolehi dgn mengisi borang dari pejabat HEP universiti. Tiket mesti dibeli untuk 2 hala pergi-balik dan dapatlah potongan 50% untuk koc kelas 3. tiada nombor tempat duduk namun saya memang selalunya tidur di tepi pintu gerabak maka setiap kali tiba di stesen2 kecil, saya akan terjaga bila pintu dibuka oleh penumpang naik atau turun. Konsesi ini benar2 membantu saya sebagai pelajar miskin dari kampung yg semuanya adalah penoreh getah. Benar2 membantu!Bagi sy jika konsep br1m adalah seperti tiket konsesi keretapi ini, ini akan benar2 kerajaan membantu golongan miskin. Malangnya br1m bukanlah bersifat seperti ini tetapi hanyalah kaedah memanipulasi (menipu) rakyat dgn mengutip 39b dan memberi kembali 17% bersama2 laungan kami mendengar denyut nadi rakyat. masih ada lagikah tiket konsesi ktm ini?

column30: {Zed-85} Sallam Dato’Berbanding dengan orang melayu, orang cina lebih peka pasal akaun untung rugi. PAS pula sekarang tengah sibuk dengan akaun akhirat. Akaun untung rugi dekat dunia ini tak penting sangat agaknya?Tapi orang melayu nak makan mimun, yang bujang nak berkahwin nak beli rumah. Kereta pun hendak kena beli, kalau tidak susah nak masuk meminang. Akaun akhirat saja tak cukup. Lainlah macam orang PAS,, sudah kaya, boleh pakai kereta Audi A7/Q7. Berkenaan dengan komen Dato’ mengenai kedai runcit orang cina, penulis terkenal Amerika John Steinbeck ada menulis, kalau tidak silap saya buku “Cannery Row” berkenaan dengan orang cina yang buka kedai runcit. Mengikut cerita John Steinbeck, dalam kedai runcit orang cina,  segala-galanya ada.Di pekan Cannery Row di Amerika ada saintis yang buat kajian berkenaan katak. Oleh kerana ada permintaan (demand) “katak”, maka katak pun di buat niaga di kedai runcit cina.Ada pemabok yang minta diberikan “beer” dahulu supaya ditukarkan dengan katak. Kemudian katak boleh dijual oleh peruncit cina Lee kepada saintis.Mengikut cerita Steinbeck, Peruncit cina sebut , “I want to see flogs first”Perkataan “r” memang agak susah untuk disebut orang cina kampong. Untung rugi jadi untung lugi.Tapi sekarang ini, orang cina ramai yang sudah makan McDonald, sebutan “r”  lancar lidahnya.Sekarang ini, Dato Najib hendak jemput masuk orang Cina ramai-rami ke Malaysia, orang cina bukanlah duduk diam saja, yang mana ada “untong” mereka akan buat.Pembahas panglima potaseh ada berkata seluar Levis dahulu tak sampai RM50 ringgi, sekarang ini seluar Levis satu saja sudah  RM200 lebih. column36: {Zalman A} Those cannot win will spoil the chances of others.From Sinar Harian.......KEDUDUKAN Pas Selangor kini goyah setelah parti itu bertegas tidak mahu bekerjasama dengan DAP dan Amanah pada PRU akan datang.Pada PRU lalu, daripada 56 kerusi Dun di Selangor, DAP menang 15 kerusi; Pas (15) dan PKR (14) sehingga berjaya membentuk kerajaan yang pada masa itu dikenali sebagai Pakatan Rakyat. Manakala BN pula memperoleh 12 kerusi.?Setelah berlaku pergolakan politik sepanjang empat tahun lalu, pembahagian kerusi antara parti-parti pembangkang turut berubah dengan DAP kekal 14 kerusi; Pas (13), PKR (13), Amanah (2) dan Bebas (2). BN kekal 12 kerusi.?Analisis yang dibuat oleh Oriental Daily mendapati, pada PRU lalu, daripada 21 Dun yang dipertandingkan Pas, parti itu menang 15 kerusi dengan lapan kerusi daripadanya menang atas sokongan daripada pengundi bukan Melayu.Kelapan-lapan kerusi Dun yang dimaksudkan itu ialah Taman Templer, Lembah Jaya, Paya Jaras, Seri Serdang, Chempaka, Meru, Dusun Tua dan Tanjong Sepat.“Semua lapan kerusi itu berada dalam kawasan bandar dengan jumlah pengundi Cina menghampiri atau lebih daripada 30 peratus. Dijangkakan, pada PRU kali ini, tanpa sokongan daripada pengundi Cina, adalah sukar bagi Pas untuk mempertahankan kelapan-lapan kerusi yang dimenangi mereka dulu,” kata seorang pemimpin pembangkang kepada akhbar ini.Selain itu katanya, dua kawasan luar bandar seperti Dun Morib dan Tanjung Sepat dimenangi Pas dengan kelebihan majoriti kurang daripada 1,000 undi turut berada dalam keadaan tidak menentu.“Oleh itu, atas faktor kehilangan sokongan pengundi Cina, Pas kemungkinan akan kalah sekurang-kurangnya 10 Dun di Selangor pada PRU14,” kata beliau lagi.Hmmmmm...

column45: {Zalman A} "KOTA BARU: Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia hopes to be the glue that holds all opposition parties together.Its deputy president Datuk Seri Mukhriz Mahathir said there is hope yet for them to co-exist although PAS and Parti Amanah Negara do not see eye to eye."Today PAS invited us to share the stage in Kelantan, while Amanah also invited us to share the stage in Johor."This is a good development. It also negates claims by certain people that PAS has shut its doors on us," he said.Mukhriz said Pribumi is open to negotiations with any party because it is not bogged down by any baggage."We have endorsed a deal with Pakatan Harapan (for straight fights against Barisan Nasional in the next general election), and we are still open to negotiations with PAS," he said.Mukhriz was at a function where former Kuala Krai Umno Youth committee member Abdul Rahman Muda handed over membership application forms from 200 PAS and Umno members who quit their parties to join Pribumi.Mukhriz said Pribumi is on a recruitment drive to ensure that it has its own machinery in the general election."To oust Umno/Barisan Nasional, we need to establish a strong ground machinery," he said.Mukhriz said Pribumi still maintained a cordial relationship with PAS although some of its leaders had said hurtful things."We know some people use underhanded tactics to foil PAS-Pribumi relationships."But all those who are making noise are not part of the negotiation team."We have held three negotiation sessions with PAS. And they all went smoothly," he said."Datuk,PPBM has to be the glue...because there is nobody else.With all due respect, Wan Azizah cannot possibly lead the Opposition.She, Anwar and PKR must face reality.There are bigger things at stake now.

column18: {Alias Dasuki} Dato, just to refresh the memory. Bank of China exited the Malaysian scene in the early sixties following the enforcement of the Banking Act, 1958 and the setting up of BNM in 1959. By the time Malaysia was established in 1963, only the Singapore branches of the Bank were still in operation in this part of the world. I believe the Bank must have been quite traumatized with its experience in Malaya then that when we inspected its Main Branch in Singapore (upon Singapore's decision to join Malaysia ) we were greeted with Patriotic Chinese Songs throughout our tour of duty there. The Bank's efforts, perhaps, attained their objectives since its existence there continued to this day, saved by Singapore's subsequent expulsion from the Federation. Its luck even appeared to have changed for the better after Tun M left the scene. BoC had not only managed to come back to the Malaysian scenario, but had also managed to open branches in strategic locations. I would not be surprised if it has now really come back with a vengeance to grind. Imagine if it were to have a branch each at every nook and corner. With every function being automatized, who needs a Malaysian around anymore ?

The recent PAS rally in support of the private member’s bill tabled by PAS president Abdul Hadi Awang, to amend the Syariah Courts (Criminal Jurisdiction) Act 1965 turned out to be a damp squib - or in simple English - a big flop!It was a flop in several ways. column38: {sukasamasuka} Datuk."Najib: We were right with GST, subsidy rationalisation...February 23, 2017...The prime minister says finance ministry's role not only to manage the country's fiscal and monetary policies but it is also an 'operating ministry'."1. "...the GST and subsidy rationalisation, was the right decision as it managed to increase the country’s revenue...that proceeds from the GST, introduced on April 1, 2016 at the rate of 6%, was RM41 billion."If we import cabbage and government collect 6% GST at point of entry, I think it is very very wrong because cabbage is an ordinary vegetable food for the low income group and poor people like me.But, if the new government wants to abolish the GST, it is a good idea, but can still collect some kind of "6% GST like tax" from food service outlets like hotels and restaurants, I think it reasonable.Because of the current GST collection system, consumers have to pay double GST on cabbage if similar food is being served out-of-home. It is easy to say stay home and eat cabbage, then again most of us, have to eat our meal outside because we work outside.Considering 60-70% of our food bills is imported, this is the main cause of rising cost of living, bearing in mind, for lower consumer group...the 8 million households that received BRIM???...food bill accounted for more than 50% of monthly expenses.So, there is nothing to be proud of when Government can collect RM41 billion in GST as the tax does not constitute new economic activity...unless eating cabbage is a new economic activity, never done before.GST is a consumption tax for food and drinks...think about it?2. “The two countries will follow our steps. India will be implementing the GST in April next year with the highest GST rate of 23% and Saudi Arabia will also be implementing the GST for the first time."Please, don't take credit for doing something that has nothing to do with you.Malaysia, let alone you, is not the one who introduce GST in the world...I don't know whether you even pass your economic paper at Nottingham University...let alone India wants to follow your step...as for the Saudis, may be, you know what I mean right.You want to teach the Arab how to collect taxes...they invented Islam for you, stupid...Bugis like you want to teach the Arabs...my foot!..look at yourself in the mirror first!..will the Chinese in China follow your footsteps too????3. "“This means that we were not wrong in implementing the GST. It was the correct thing to do,”It is very wrong unless you eat your Berkin bags like cabbage.4. "Najib said...Barisan Nasional (BN) could lose the elections if it (GST) were implemented.However, he said, the BN scored a landslide victory in the Sarawak state election despite the opposition harping on the GST issue."The guy is dead. The victory is not yours. You miss the point when he said "marry the Iban girl". It is the native way of saying "you are our permanent enemy" because marriage is to cement friendship and family...you can't do it man...you stupid idiot, you don't know the culture.5. "...the finance ministry had gone through an evolution as its role was not only to manage the country’s fiscal and monetary policies but also becoming an “operating ministry” to implement various programmes such as the Urban Transformation Centre and Entrepreneurship Development Programme."????????????Really???..You can't even manage our Ringgit!Then again, that UTC, lots of money for the UMNOs' warlords...someone "deep inside" told me.As for the EDP...it is for UMNO only...show us the numbers...if you have the numbers.By, the way what happen to the 1 Million Homes Program...UMNO's last election promise...very quiet.
column39: {Joker} Datuk,the statement by the former Bank Negara Malaysia governor Tan Sri Dr Zeti Akhtar Aziz that she would cooperate with the Government's special taskforce to probe the central bank's alleged US$10 billion (about RM44 billion) foreign exchange (forex) loss in the 1990s.According to Zeti, the US$10 billion was never raised during her tenure as Bank Negara governor.Today, she said: "If I am called by the taskforce, of course I would cooperate with the authorities."It is something that had happened almost 30 years ago. It is the wish of the current leadership to investigate the matter but I cannot comment on it until the investigation is completed," Zeti said.The key words "It is something that had happened almost 30 years ago" shows how ridiculous the current govt and leadership has become.The current leadership is a joke in the rakyat's eyes and minds. They are their best adverts in this campaign.
column40: {Leader of the new world} Chinese president Xi Jinping has vowed for the first time that China should take the lead in shaping the “new world order” and safeguarding international security.  Not too long now, look out Malaysia!
column41: {Sharing is caring} Datuk,sharing this worthy comment by "Legit" to certain remarks made by the ruler of Johore on an 'amnesiac, perhaps a little senile' politician (extract from Malaysiakini):LegitHRH Tuanku, our beloved country has gone to the dogs under the current PM. The country is called a kleptocracy and is fast becoming a basket case. We used to proudly call ourselves Malaysians when we travel overseas but now it is shameful to identify ourselves as Malaysians in the eyes of foreigners. Malaysia was a shining star when Tun was the PM. He had many flaws and he ruined many of the institutions in the country. He even brought the royal institution to its knees which was in effect triggered by the actions of HRH your father. Now we all agree that you are initiating major development projects in Johor which is a good thing for Johor and the whole country. People of Johor and Malaysia have great respect and admiration for Your Majesty and TMJ but at the same time they expect Your Majesty to question the corruption and the thievery going on under the current administration. Mahathir may be a monster but now we need his help now to get rid of this corrupt regime. Daulat Tuanku.
column42: {Aku} Kadiag, salaamSekali lagi hang bawak satu isyu yg sangat penting untuk rakyat. Tapi aku pandang lain sikit ~ aku nampak ada perubahan yg sangat luag biasa bukan dok kena kak Malaya saja tapi untok beberapa negara di seluroh donia. Untuk kesan drama sikit, benda ni bulih disebut "penghijrahan" atau dlm telo Indonesia, di sebut "imigrasi". Sorang dari penkomen blog hang ni tulih :"Rest assured the regular Chinese Malaysian knows of the Cina Komunis colonization of Malaysia. Why do you think the skilled and talented Chinese Malaysians are heading to Singapore in the hundreds of thousands?"(Vinnan 10.39 pagi). Lepaih tu aku tengok yg dok semai dan ubah anak padi di Sg. Dua, Bagan Ajam adalah orang2 muda Bangla.Di tv, khemah2 pelarian Suria di Urdun sampai ke kaki langit, katanya penghuni dia lebih 1 juta orang. Tu tak kira yg di pebatasan Turki dan yg dapat lari ke Eropa, Kanada, Yunani dll.Seperti tulih Vinnan (op cit), beribu dah masuk Singapo, dan beribu pulak yg lari ke Ostolia, Kanada dan jugak ke New York, ada angin2 China Malaya dari Salak South beli satu blok apatmen di New York. Aku bincang2 jugak dgn member China aku untok sama2 tinggai Malaya... dia kata masaalah besag ialah rasa sunyi... tu la aku kata, kita pindah sekampong sekali, kalu satu kampong macam sekog lembu, yg pindah tu biag separoh lembu sekali. Zaman dolu2, tanah di Ostolia morah, aku kata kak bini aku, kita beli 10 ekag, kat Cairns ka, di Gladstone ka...di utara Queensland, cuaca lebih korang macam di Malaya, romah pon buat ataih tiang, kerbau macam hak di Malaya, bulih ikat kad tiang romah, tanam pisang belakang romah, kita bukak kampong di sana, bukak masjid, buat sekolah, kedai... tapi masa tu bini aku tak mau dok jauh dgn mak ayah dia...Almarhum Prof Hamka pon ada sentoh pekara ni dlm 'tafsir Azhar' dia,...tak salah aku dia guna istilah 'gelombong' penduduk untok gejala pindah randah ni....Balik pd tajuk hang, aku nak kiyaih imigrasi bukan saja untuk orang2 saja, tapi jugak modai, atau 'capital', jugak tentera dan senjata macam peringgi, belanda, Siam, Jepun, Indonesia(majapahit, sri vijaya) dll ke daerah yg namanya Malaya ni. Keadaannya jadi parah bila pemerintah klepek rakyat yg sedia lemah atau 'hapless', miskin, tak bersatu...Hang tak ada dengag ka satu2 negara diseluroh donia,yg bagi masok rakyat Korea Utara tampa visa ialah Malaya.?Mintak maghap no pasai aku lencong sikit dan kalu tesilap.Aku
column43: {Zalman A} "Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) wants an election pact with PAS to avoid three-cornered fights during the coming 14th general election (GE14).Its deputy president, Mukhriz Mahathir, said PPBM would hold talks with PAS to form an election pact.“Like it or not, we (PPBM) need to have a date to finalise if we can have a pact with PAS, even if it is an electoral one,” he told reporters here today.Mukhriz was here to attend the four-day PPBM retreat programme which began on Monday.Also attending the programme were party chairman Dr Mahathir Mohamad and president Muhyiddin Yassin.PAS president Abdul Hadi Awang was reported as saying that PAS would stick to its decision not to work with PPBM for as long as it collaborated with DAP and Parti Amanah Negara.Meanwhile, Mukhriz said for the GE14, PPBM would concentrate on Malay-majority areas."Datuk,Can Hadi Awang EVER be trusted?Why are so many PAS leaders so rich suddenly?If PAS is being ordered by UMNO to split votes, can they really "negotiate"?Can Hadi Awang EVER be trusted? This is the question.If No PAS, then no victory for the Opposition but at least it is better than holding a snake that has embraced the even bigger Bugis snake.
column44: {Zalman A} "SHAH ALAM: Penganalisis politik melahirkan keyakinan Umno/Barisan Nasional (BN) akan dapat menguasai Selangor pada pilihan raya umum akan datang jika PAS bertegas tidak menjalin kerjasama dengan Pakatan Harapan (PH).Pensyarah Kanan Hal Ehwal Politik dan Antarabangsa Universiti Utara Malaysia (UUM), Shukri Shuaib berkata demikian semasa soal jawab program “Wacana Politik: Perjuangan atau Populariti” anjuran Sinar Harian, hari ini.“Sekiranya PAS tidak bersama PH, Umno boleh ambil semula Selangor malah bukan itu sahaja pembangkang juga akan kehilangan Pulau Pinang,” kata Shukri."What is PAS doing?The mat salleh call this "Run with the hare and hunt with the hounds" or talam dua muka.Are you an ally of PKR or a tool of UMNO?Why so confused, PAS?
column45: {vinnan} Anonymous Aku said...Kami pun tak mahu jadi hamba Cina Komunis. Soalan RM 141 Billion. Apa lagi Cina Komunis mahu? Orang Melayu tahu jawapannya tapi Mat Gian dan Minah Gian  sudah ketagihan candu Hak Istimewa Ketuanan Melayu-Islam yang tak mungkin dirawati.
column46: {the lawgiver} Dato, I refer to your last blog post on the Forex task ForcePart  1. You rightly pointed out that forex losses about 25 years ago was RM30 billion and under MO1 is around MR180 billion. The RM200 billion or thereabout forex loss is part of collateral damage caused by1MDB. Then the depreciation of ringgit, high cost of living, increase in cost of imports, the shame to the nation and now our government is being described as a kleptocracy government. Don’t think Agong wants to visit overseas outside ASEAN nor our rulers as Malaysia is being ridiculed everywhere because of 1MDB.According to press release from PM's office cabinet decided to establish a task force to investigate because present government is transparent.  We laud this high aspirations.But we would like to ask cabinet if this is the reason given why cabinet is silent on 1MDB?  Surely cabinet knows rakyat is going to ask this question.So what is cabinet’s answer to this question?  Or is it transparent when it comes to others but cabinet is blind, dump and deaf when it comes to 1MDB and MO1? ln Singapore, a few were charged and convicted in 1MDB-linked cases.  ln Switzerland investigations are going on and DOJ in America had filed a case in court to seize assets related to 1MDB.Since cabinet decided to form task force please also investigate losses under Najib.  Incidentally, the task force investigating 1MDB was disbanded by present AG while other countries are still investigating and our AG refused to cooperate with requests from other countries for help.
column47: {the lawgiver} Part 2. I suggest to save money the forex task force should also investigate :Cowgate: MR240 million government loans to enable cows to live in condos...the court ruled case should proceed but AG instructed DPP to withdraw it.Ministry of youth: the scandals of over RM100 million. We have not heard anything since it was exposed.Khazanah: It seems to support Pak Lah’s policy on giving priority to agriculture. Khazanah built something somewhere in country and was left as white elephant.  We know nothing what Khazanah is doing yet it is our money.Its investment in a Turkish airport is bleeding MAB.  It formed a research outfit and gave RM1 billion for this purpose and rakyat want to know what research this outfit is doing.Pension fund (KWAP) loaned RM4 billion to 1MDB. What has happened to this money?Sabah water scandal: we were fed almost daily with pictures of cash, cars, etc.  We were very excited as we believe MACC is now serious and free to investigate. Then the expected happened.  After creating so much hope, we are told after a long silence that case is under money laundering. We can only conclude that UMNO politicians are involved in this scandal and they must be protected.  A charge under money laundering will save UMNO and its members.Felda: purchase of Eagle High plantation from Peter Sondakh. Dato had written about his relationship with Najib and if l may add also Datin Seri Rosmah.  Originally FGV was going to be buyer but due to objections from the opposition paeries it was delayed. Then Felda decided to buy and price was reduced but Felda has no money and oppositions continued to object and put up a very strong case.   Now new chairman said government is buying and Felda will manage. Why must government buy? Sure this is a good case for the foex task force to investigate also.
column48: {the lawgiver} PART 3Mara and Tabong Haji in particular on purchases of properties overseas and later on purchase of 1MDB land and purchase of bonds related to 1MDB.Forest City in Johor.  Who approved freehold titles for foreigners and yet locals only get leasehold?  And to publish agreements between the parties to see if other incentives were given to this development.There must be many more losses which other readers can highlight. As government say it is transparent, let us all name the projects that should be investigated.The next topic Dato wrote on a minister who has decided to resign but his name was not mentioned.  Zahid it seemed rushed to Sabah and later announced that Anifah was not resigning.  Why did Zahid pick on Anifah? MO1 said he has not received any letter of resignation and called YAB Azmin a liar. Anifah has not said a word. Before this there was talk that Zahid himself was on the way out especially after the Sungai Besar and Kuala Kangsar by-elections when he became a hero to UMNO grassroots. Najib’s advisors told Najib to remove Zahid. We saw the letter being circulated and Zahid came out with a statement that he was 101% loyal to Najib. People asked why the l% extra? Then another statement to say he had never toppled a leader.  Zahid has selected memory.If not Anifah who as Dato rightly asked is the minister?  Dato named a few. Khairy’s boys said he has signed his letter of resignation but just kept in his briefcase. We wonder why Najib remarked that he is puzzled that Khairy never asked him for anything. But we hear BN is monitoring and reporting Khairy's movement to Najib.Dato, if we ask the ministers they keep dumb. But we should ask their wives. Ask Zahid's wife (or wives?) and Dato will get an honest answer. Has Dato ever seen his wife with Flom? Ask Mustapha’s wife and Anifah’s wife. And rest of the wives.Ask Kak Ijat. At one time she was very angry with Najib but cooled down once made advisor. And Najib has many advisers and we don't know what they do except receive pensions and now salaries too. What other benefit do they get? We know Kak Ijat’s son got a scholarship to go and do further studies in USA while scholarships for the rest of rakyat have been cut but UMNO Putra still can get them. We like to know and like to read if advice is written to justify employing and paying them.To publish the details of the RM140 billion investment by China which the government claim is FDI. We now know the east coast railway is a contract given to Chinese company without tender and we have to pay for this very very expensive contract. Let us have the details. Dato Seri Mustapha please tell us if this is FDI.All the above should be included for the task force to investigate. Then only we can believe that government really is transparent.As Najib’s cabinet say they are transparent, let us allow the task force to investigate, if not rakyat will say this is political sandiwara.Salam Dato and keep writing.
column49: {sukasamasuka} Datuk.Zalman A 10.07PM..."If No PAS, then no victory for the Opposition but at least it is better than holding a snake that has embraced the even bigger Bugis snake."1. Agree with you Zalman A.2. If we come to that, it is the Will of God.3. PAS needs UMNO to implement the Shariah Law in Malaysia...using the Parliamentary system at the initial phase...or Phase 1.4. But, in actual fact, Shariah Law doesn't need Parliamentary proceedings to formulate its law as all the Shariah Law has been prescribed in the Quran and the Hadis...so, technically, there is nothing the MPs,  the Muslims and the Non-Muslims alike, can do or debate, except to agree...this is Phase 2.5. The Shariah-compliant Parliament is a rubber-stamp Parliament...as no one dares to voice out disagreement in regards to any Shariah law...this is Phase 3.6. With the power vested in the Agong supported by the Council of Rulers...Malaysia shall be declared an Islamic country like Saudi Arabia and Brunei...and, shall began the process of  replacing the existing laws with either the Shariah-compliant Laws or 100% Shariah Laws like the amputation of hand ...this is Final Phase 4.7. It is not a bad scenario after all for the Malayan people...except, UMNO and PAS and all the MPs who supported the Hadi's Bills have violated the International Treaty known as the Malaysia Agreement 1963, an important legal document for the  formation of Malaysia ...also known as the "20 Points" for Sabah...and, the "18 Points" for Sarawak.8. This Treaty supersedes the power of the Malaysian Parliament and the Agong...because, without this Treaty there is no Malaysia.9. If we have to come to this...where UMNO has the gut and the political will to support Hadi's Bill right to the end using the Parliamentary system...then we have one option left which is open to all Malaysian.10. We demand the right to hold, not one, but three Referendums.11. A "Sabah Referendum" to decide whether we Sabahans want to be part of this  so called "Islamic" Malaysia...and, "the right of the Sabahans for self-determination" as a nation of her own right....like Singapore.12. A "Sarawak Referendum"...like point 11.13. A "Malaya Referendum"...please choose your own terms of reference, if you will...if I may suggest, to include, one of which, is "to kick out either Sabah or Sarawak or both, out of Malaysia because they are secular kafirs".14. Let the Sabahans and the Sarawakians free once again to join the 9 billions "lost sheep in the wilderness to be devoured by the wild wolves"...and, their place is in Hell!15. May God bless the Malayan Muslims under the guidance of PAS and UMNO... they all shall enter Jannah!16. Malaysia is a legal entity...not, a natural country...very much like the State of Israel...created and born under the auspicious of the United Nations...an association of three nations...bound by International laws...but, of different races, cultures and "adats", religious beliefs and diverse physical locations.17. There shall never be unity of the tribes till the day of judgement in Malaysia...for that matter, anywhere in the world...it is in the Quran...but, just a common understanding among men to do common good and live a good life."Wahai umat manusia! Sesunguhnya Kami telah menciptakan kamu dari lelaki dan perempuan, dan Kami telah menjadikan kamu berbagai bangsa dan bersuku puak, supaya kamu berkenal-kenalan (dan beramah mesra antara satu dengan yang lain)......."Surah al-Hujarat ayat 13.18. Only a Referendum can establish the ultimate aspiration of the Malaysians...as our Parliament is not the right venue due to rampant corruptions.19. I am sorry if we have to come to this, but, for the sake of our children and future generations.20. I will not turn my back and betray the trust of my other non-Muslims families and friends because of UMNO and PAS.I AM A MUSLIM!..SHALL DIE AS ONE...not because of UMNO and PAS.
column50: {big_ekor} Dun be stubborn. Be humble. Learn mandarin. Learn how to work hard and have proper attitudes in life. Orang melayu has been gostaning and can continue to do so, the world will not wait for you. Weak culture weak mental strength. Perpectually kept dumb by kleptocratic class. If you are a weak culture and small country play that part to survive. Take the last train. And that train is China. China is approaching it's previous level at Ming Dynasty. As far as I am concern the malay race has past the point of no return. It has missed it's chances due to poor choices. Be that as it may, just blend in with others. Forget about ketuanlan.

column0: Task Force Forex Idea Najib Yang Hebat
column3: {Joe Harry} Benar, penubuhan siasatan forex hanya untuk "menuduh" tun penjenayah bagi melemahkan pembangkang dan PPBM khasnya.Kejadian yang hampir 30tahun, yang tidak diambil kisah oleh rakyat jelata diwaktu itu. Malah tak ramai yang tahu menahu. Maka najib memanaskan isu ini untuk kepentinggan politiknya dan bukan untuk mencari kebenaran. Selepas pru14, isu ini akan ditutup buku. Sebab itu najib hanya tubuh badan penyiasat dan bukannya suruhanjaya siasatan diraja sebab badan penyiasat boleh diarah berhenti atau dibubarkan pada bila-bila masa tanpa perlu menamatkan siasatan.2. Kenyataan azmin, saya rasa menteri itu adalah zahid. Walaupun zahid lama bawah najib dalam satu kementrian tapi zahid adalah orang kuat anwar yang kemudian berpaling masuk umno semula.Sebelum ini pun zahid pernah kata yang orang umno berkomplot nak jatuhkannya dibagan datok.Saya rasa zahid ada jumpa dengan azmin dan bincang untuk masuk pkr sebab itu azmin tahu. Zahid saja menafikan kerana nak serang najib /umno disaat akhir.
column4: {Zalman A} Salam Datuk,Let us do the task forces in 10 year batches, from most recent.First batch, 2007-2017.1) ECRL TASK FORCE.Here are 3 questions for them:a) In July 2016, Fadillah Yusof said the ECRL cost would remain RM30 billion as set by govt in 2015, not "pumped up" to RM60 billion to cover up 1MDB debts. But now the cost is confirmed RM55 billion. How did the cost go up by RM25 billion in under 6 months?b) The leaked documents show that two Jho Low companies (Loh & Loh Corporation Berhad and Putrajaya Perdana Berhad) will have their debts of US$315 million cleared by this deal. (If the names sound familiar, it's because the MACC arrested people from these companies before the Bugis thief sabotaged the investigation.) What does Jho Low have to do with the ERCL? c) The papers signed confirm that part of the mark-up will go to fill the US$6.5 billion hole created by the theft from Aabar and IPIC. Why does the name of 1MDB even appear in the ERCL deal documents?
column5: {Zalman A} 2) FELDA TASK FORCE:a) KUALA LUMPUR (Dec 23): Datuk Seri Nazir Razak, chairman of CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and younger brother of Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak, today questioned Federal Land Development Authority's (Felda) acquisition of a 37% stake in Indonesia's PT Eagle High Plantations Tbk for US$505.4 million (RM2.26 billion).Nazir posted a black-and-white photograph on his Instagram this evening of his father — the late prime minister Tun Abdul Razak Hussein –  addressing a group of people, presumably early Felda settlers.The photograph was uploaded on Instagram together with the message: "Felda announced buying 37% of Eagle High for US$505m or 580 rupiah per share. Eagle High's average price in November was 212 rupiah per share, so a 173% premium for a non-control stake. I hope the board will fully justify the acquisition & valuation even though the deal is no longer made by listed FGV (Felda Global Ventures Bhd)."b) Why are Felda shares almost worthless now?c) Why did Felda buy do many luxury hotels, and who pocketed the "difference"?
column6: {Zalman A} 3) RECOVERY OF STOLEN 1MDB MONEY TASK FORCE:"According to The Wall Street Journal , Najib spent a total of US$15 million on holidays, shopping and jewellery. The spending was done at stores in the United States, Malaysia, Italy and elsewhere.Malaysian investigation documents, it claimed, showed that Najib's credit card was charged US$130,625 at exclusive fashion store Chanel in Honolulu, two days before he teed off with US President Barack Obama on Christmas Eve of 2014.That trip became a controversy as parts of Malaysia's east coast were then hit by devastating floods and Najib had to fly back to visit the affected areas.WSJ reported that a worker at a Chanel store in the upscale Ala Moana Center recalled that Najib's wife, Rosmah Mansor, shopped there just before Christmas."The transaction in the Chanel store was paid for with a Visa card in Najib's name, according to the Malaysian investigation documents. At first, the transaction didn't go through and Najib, who was present, had to call his bank to approve the charge, said one of the people aware of the shopping trip," the report alleged.The documents, it claimed, revealed that the credit card was paid for with an account in Najib's name, and that account had been credited with US$9 million a few months earlier.According to the documents, WSJ alleged that the money came from SRC International, the former unit of 1MDB that is now under the Finance Ministry, which is headed by Najib."On the day Najib played golf with Obama, SRC International transferred a further US$9 million to the account via 1MDB's corporate social responsibility arm. The money arrived the day after Christmas," stated the WSJ report. WSJ claimed that there was also a recorded expenditure on June 28, 2011, at Signature Exotic Cars, a car dealership in Kuala Lumpur, for US$56,000."Najib's credit card also incurred charges of €750,000 in August 2014 at an Italian branch of De Grisogono, a Swiss-owned jewellery store, again being financed from the same account as the expenses in Hawaii, according to bank-transfer information that forms part of the Malaysian government probe."A person who works for De Grisogono confirmed Rosmah, the prime minister's wife, was a client of a branch of the jewellers in Porto Cervo, a tiny Sardinian resort." it added."If the WSJ is not sued "next Tuesday", then the Task Force can convene to gather the evidence that the 24-hour AG is trying so hard to ignore.
column7: {Zalman A} TASK FORCE FELDA (bah 2)Peneroka FELDA, seperti yang saya tulis dahulu, yang berjumlah 112,635 orang, yang mendiami di lebih 300 tanah rancangan, mesti sedar perkara ini. Musibah warga FELDA bukan terhad kepada isiu hutang purata RM120,000/peneroka, atau pertelingkahan kadar perahan atau rungutan bayaran bukan dalam bulan semasa. Ini masaalah yang ‘real’ yang dihadapi oleh peneroka setiap hari. Masaalah ini rentetan dan akibat dari tamak haloba seorang yang bernama Najib Tun Razak.Tapi sengat bisa isu2 ini diringankan sedikit kerana secara umumnya, kehidupan warga FELDA terlindung. Sekurang kurangnya dapat elaun sara hidup dari RM1000-RM1500 sebulan, ada tanah untuk rumah, ada tanah ladang 10 ekar, ada kemudahan awam dan sosial dalam tanah rancangan dan lain. Mereka seolah olah nya leka kerana ada jaminan dari kerajaan UMNO untuk menjaga mereka. Dan berserta jamina tersebut, ancaman bahawa jika UMNO bukan kerajaan, kehidupan selesa peneroka FELDA akan hilang.Namun demikian, untuk jenerasi kedua bagaimana?  Mengikut suatu kajian oleh UIA, anak peneroka FELDA yang berjaya menjadi pelajar pusat pengajian tinggi, jadi doctor, lawyer dan graduan2 bidang lain hanya 1.5% sahaja. Apa jadi dengan 98.5% lagi?Mereka jadi sampah masyarakat, bercandu dan bermadat dan duduk ditanggung ibu bapa dalam tanah rancangan. Masa depan mereka bagaimana? Sedangkan tanah seluas 360,000 hektar milik FELDA plantations sudah dipajak kepada FGV dan tidak mungkin dikembalikan. Bukan rumah dan perumahan warga felda yang dibina, tapi pengurusan FELDA membeli hotel dan kondominum. Bukan melabur dalam core business, tapi beli business yang bukan2 seperti membuka kedai2 pastry yang rugi dan ditutup, melaksanakan projek membela ikan sturgeon- ikan yang masih jadi bahan dan objek kaji selidik dinegara2 dimana ikan sturgeon itu ikan watan. FELDA gatal hendak membela sturgeon di sungai Pahang di Jerantut. Akibatnya rugi besar. column8: {BIJAN83} Datuk,tahun 1991 pelabur ASB dapat durian runtuh luar biasa dari PNB.Pelaburan ayah saya yang cuma $16,000 lebih pada tahun 1990 menjadi hampir $30,000 pada tahun 1991.Ada kaitan tak cerita saya ni dengan cerita Tun M main forex?heheSetau saya sekarang memang ramai individu yang main forex.Memang boleh dapat untung banyak.Tapi kalau leka ketika trade boleh hangus semua.Masalah kalau main forex secara individu modalnya ciput.Maka untung pun tak sampai juta-juta.
column9: {sukasamasuka} Datuk."Perniagaan forex adalah kegiatan biasa bank-bank pusat macam Bank Negara Malaysia."1. Memang betul kata Datuk.2. Tetapi, sebenarnya peniagaan forex ini, berunsurkan "judi"...maka, haram dalam Islam...sebab ada elemen2 spekulasi atau pertaruhan harta...dimana tidak ada sesiapa pun dapat menentukan the end result...dan ini akan menyebabkan pengagihan harta yang tidak adil...yang menang akan dapat harta tanpa melakukan apa apa yang producktif.Surah al-Maidah ayat 90..."Wahai orang yang beriman!...sesunguhnya arak, judi, pemujaan berhala dan mengundi nasib dengan batan batang anak panah, adalah (semuanya) kotor (keji) dari perbuatan syaitan. olih itu hendk la kamu menjauhinya supaya kamu berjaya"3. Forex menjual-beli komoditi yang dipanggil wang...macam menjual-beli komoditi seperti beras, gandum, kopi, minyak mentah dbnya dipasaran terbuka.4. Tetapi, menjual-beli beras, minyak mentah dsbnya adalah halal dalam Islam sebab kita tau nilai barang itu.5. Tetapi, wang itu sebenarnya tidak ada nilai nya...kecuali nilai kos membuat dari kertas atau logam selain dari kos pengedaran dan kos menyimpan...sebagai contoh, kos membuat mencetak mengedar sekeping USD1 sama dengan USD100.6. Kerana wang itu tidak ada nilai macam gandum, makanya perniagaan forex itu diharamkan dalam Islam sebab "nilai" itu tidak bolih dijualbeli.7. BNM bukan bank Islam, jadi bolih berniaga Forex.8. Konsep berniaga Forex asas nya senang saja...supply and demand...dimana matawang dijual beli macam pasaran komoditi.9. Bila supply RM exceed demand, nilai RM jatuh...BNM akan beli RM to create "false" demand using reserve....maka reserve BNM jatuh..."Misalnya pada 8 Disember lalu, Bank Negara mengaku rizab asingnya jatuh sebanyak AS$1.9 bilion (kira-kira RM8.4 bilion) daripada AS$98.3 bilion (RM442.35 bilion) kepada AS$96.4 bilion (RM433.8 bilion).10. Bila demand RM exceed supply, nilai RM naik...reserve BNM naik.
column10: {Pena Ekonomis} Dalam keadaan Bank Negara yang sedang berusaha sedaya upaya untuk mengukuhkan nilai ringgit yang menjunam ke tahap terendah sejak krisis kewangan 1998, Kerajaan mengambil tindakan kurang bijak dengan menambahkan lagi beban ke atas Bank Negara dengan menubuhkan pasukan siasatan ke atas isu yang telah berlaku lebih 25 tahun dahulu. Menteri Kewangan yang ada sekarang dah lah langsung tak membantu dalam usaha untuk memulihkan nilai ringgit malah menambahkan lagi beban kepada Bank Negara yang terpaksa gali fail-fail lama dengan isu lapuk yang  belaku puluhan tahun dahulu yang impak dan kesannya tiada kena mengena dengan kehidupan rakyat jelata sekarang. Walaupun bukan satu keperluan pada masa ini, ianya dirasakan satu keperluan untuk menumpulkan serangan bertali arus Tun Dr. Mahathir. Pada masa itu, Mahathir banyak megambil risiko dan menggunakan banyak cara demi untuk meningkatkan pendapatan dan kekayaan negara. Perniagaan forex adalah salah satu caranya dan effort beliau tersebut berakhir dengan kegagalan. Cubaan negara berjinak-jinak dengan industri berat melalui biji timah dan besi melalui Perwaja Steel juga gagal. Namun banyak lagi gamble Mahathir yang berjaya seperti percubaan negara dalam pelaburan sumber mineral petroleum dan gas secara besar-besaran. Percubaan ini berjaya dan Petronas adalah bukti kejayaan beliau. Petronas kini dikenali sebagai salah satu syarikat multi nasional terulung negara yang dikenali seantero dunia.  Berkenaan isu forex ni, ya, negara kerugian besar pada waktu itu tapi tidaklah sampai memeras dan menindas rakyat untuk mendapatkan kembali berpuluh-puluh bilion wang yang telah hilang. Mahathir tidak memperkenalkan cukai GST kepada rakyat pada waktu itu untuk menggantikan wang yang telah hilang. Mahathir tidak memansuhkan subsidi gula, subsidi beras, subsidi tepung, subsidi minyak masak, subsidi minyak petrol untuk menggantikan wang yang telah hilang. Mahathir tidak memotong bajet Kementerian Kesihatan, Kementerian Pendidikan dan universiti-universiti awam untuk menggantikan wang yang telah hilang. Mahathir tidak mengurangkan wang pinjaman PTPTN kepada pelajar miskin untuk menggantikan wang yang telah hilang. Mahathir tidak menutup pejabat-pejabat Tourism Malaysia untuk menggantikan wang yang telah hilang. Mahathir juga tidak memotong perbelanjaan penyelenggaraan mesin OMR Lembaga Peperiksaan Malaysia untuk menggantikan wang yang hilang. Mahathir tidak menaikkan cukai eksais rokok secara membuta-tuli sehingga harga rokok melambung lebih RM 15 sekotak bagi menggantikan wang yang hilang. Pada zaman beliau, kenaikkan harga rokok tidak pernah lebih dari 50 sen. Kenaikkan pada masa beliau adalah lebih bertujuan untuk mendidik rakyat supaya menjauhi tabiat buruk tersebut, bukannya untuk menambah hasil Kerajaan semata-mata. Beliau sedar, jika harga rokok dinaikkan secara mendadak, perokok tegar tetap membelinya dan ini akan mengurangkan lagi pendapatan mereka apabila wang banyak dihabiskan untuk membeli rokok yang telah dinaikkan harga. Apabila banyak wang dihabiskan untuk membeli rokok yang telah mahal, belanja bulanan mereka bertambah dengan gaji yang tidak naik. Ini akan meningkatkan lagi kos sara hidup mereka dan taraf kehidupan mereka akan jatuh secara drastik. Kuasa membeli akan berkurangan secara mendadak dan ini akan menambahkan lagi beban kepada rakyat. Beliau arif akan semua itu dan oleh sebab itulah cukai dosa (sin tax) tidak boleh dinaikkan sewenang-wenangnya untuk menambah hasil kerajaan. Ditambah pula dengan cukai GST dikenakan kepada rakyat pada masa sekarang, bertambah-tambahlah lagi sengsara rakyat. Sebab itulah sesuatu dasar atau polisi fiskal yang diambil hendak dikaji dan diperhalusi secara menyeluruh akan impak dan kesannya ke atas kehidupan rakyat dan bukannya dilihat dari sudut hasil atau monetary kepada negara semata-mata.

column13: {Zed-85} Sallam Dato’Kalaulah sudah hilang berbillion ringgit, saya setuju dengan cadangan buat RCI.Tapi sepatutnya buat RCI pada tahun 1997 atau 1998. Ini hendak tunggu 2017 baru nak buat RCI. Kenapa hendak tunggu sampai 20 tahun. Kenapa tak mahu tunggu sampai 100 tahun.Kalau penyamun rompak bank, sudah tentu Polis akan siasat serta merta. Polis tak tunggu sampai 100 tahun baru hendak siasat kerana orang-orang yang berkenaan sudah lupa atau sudah tidak ada lagi.  Selain itu, kalau anggota sekuriti tak cukup atau kamera rosak, bank akan betulkan supaya kejadian tidak berulang lagi. Oleh itu siasatan tak boleh ditangguhkan lama.Saya agak heran kenapa kerajaan perlu tunggu 20 tahun baru hendak buat RCI.Hari ini orang berkempen dan berkumpul kerana kempen 355.Kalau kita pusingkan jam semula pada tahun 2013, waktu dekat pilihanraya, orang agak sibuk pasal hudud. column21: {adion} Short term memory loss syndrome.When a person experiences short-term memory loss, he or she can remember incidents from 20 years ago but is fuzzy on the details of things that happened 2 years ago.There are a number of causes of short-term memory loss, some which are a result of medical conditions and others that are related to injuries or other outside influences.

column9: {shah} 1. PAS telah membuat kepututusan dasarnya untuk tidak menjalinkan apa-apa kerjasama politik dengan parti AMANAH dan DAP serta parti yang mempunyai hubungan kerjasama dengan AMANAH dan DAP.Ini bermakna PAS secara tegas dan jelas menolak hasrat parti PPBM untuk menjalinkan kerjasama dengan PAS dan akan memutuskan hubungan kerjasama dengan parti PKR.2. Sayu dan sedih dengan keputusan PAS tatkala mengenang nasib rakyat yang tertindas dan terbeban akibat salah guna kuasa UmnoBn 'merompak wang rakyat'. Rakyat sangat mengharapkan masa depan Malaysia tanpa UmnoBn berkuasa selepas PRU ke-14 nanti.3. Rakyat mengharapkan satu pakatan (grand coalition) gabungan kekuatan parti pembangkang untuk meranapkan dan menamatkan kuasa politik UmnoBn.Berbondong-bondong rakyat dari Melayu Umno meninggalkan parti Umno yang kononnya keramat menerajui pemerintahan negara sejak lebih 60 tahun, semata-mata mahu melihat kepimpinan Melayu Islam yang baru dan bukan atas nama Umno untuk menerajui negara.KERJASAMA PAS-PKR TERBATAL4. Alasan yang diberikan ialah PAS tidak akan bekerjasama dengan mana-mana parti yang menjalinkan hubungan kerjasama dengan  parti DAP dan AMANAH, manakala hubungan dengan PKR akan diputuskan semasa muktamar parti.Alasan ini sudah tentu mengecewakan rakyat dan menjarakkan PAS dari rakyat terbanyak. Tempoh sebulan yang diberikan PPBM kepada PAS sudah tidak diperlukan lagi kerana PAS sudah pun ada keputusan dasar kerjasamanya dan polisi yang diputuskan.Berdasarkan kenyataan sebegitu, adalah wajar untuk PAS tidak perlu menunggu hingga muktamar PAS pada April nanti untuk menentukan kedudukan PAS dalam hubungan kerjasama dengan PKR.Sudah terang lagi bersuluh, PKR sepertimana PPBM sudah mempunyai hubungan kerjasama politik dengan DAP dan AMANAH, malah telah menandatangani 'perjanjian kerjasama politik' untuk meranapkan kuasa politik UmnoBn pada PRU ke-14 nanti. 5. Oleh itu secara perinsipnya hubungan kerjasama PAS dan PKR yang sedia terjalin sudah terbatal dengan keputusan dasar yang diumumkan oleh Tuan Guru Datuk Seri Presiden PAS.Adakah ini bermakna PAS perlu menarik diri dari kedudukannya dalam kerajaan negeri Selangor dan melepaskan semua jawatan Exco, Ahli Majlis Kerajaan Tempatan, JKKK, ketua kampung, syarikat berkaitan kerajaan (GLC) dan apa-apa jawatan lantikan politik dengan segera secara berprinsip.Adalah lebih baik untuk PAS  mengelakkan dari apa-apa persepsi atau tanggapan serong yang menampakkan PAS masih sayang pada kebendaan dan ketamakan kuasa yang diperolehi hasil dari kedudukkan dalam pentadbiran kerajaan negeri Selangor.Sudah sampai masanya Yb Datuk Iskandar Abdul Samad yang juga Naib Presiden PAS dan rakan-rakan Exco kerajaan negeri dari PAS melepaskan jawatan Exco dan apa-apa jawatan lantikan politik yang berkaitan.6. Berdasarkan keputusan yang dinyatakan PAS, semua parti pembangkang sudah boleh merumuskan  PRU ke-14 akan menyaksikan pertandingan 3 penjuru  termasuk PAS juga sudah boleh  merancang 'strategi 3 penjuru' untuk memastikan UmnoBn dikalahkan pada PRU ke-14.Usah lagi menghabiskan masa dengan agenda pujuk rayu untuk PAS menyertai gabungan pakatan pembangkang, sebaliknya semua parti termasuk PAS perlu tumpu kepada usaha 'pujuk rayu rakyat' untuk menolak UmnoBn pada PRU 14 nanti.DATO' HJ MAHFUZ HJ OMARAhli Parlimen Pokok Sena14 Feb 2017/17 Jamadilawal 1438H.

column14: {Zalman A} POLITICS OF UMNO IN PAS.......PETALING JAYA: Pemuda PAS Wilayah Persekutuan dan Kelantan hari ini membuat laporan polis terhadap Penasihat Amanah Kelantan Datuk Husam Musa yang didakwa mengatakan parti Islam itu menerima dana RM90 juta daripada Umno.Laporan dibuat secara berasingan di Ibu Pejabat Polis Daerah Dang Wangi, Kuala Lumpur dan Pasir, Kelantan.Ketua Pemuda Wilayah Persekutuan Khairil Nizam Khirudin dalam kenyataan pada sidang media hari ini menggesa Husam supaya menamakan individu yang didakwa menerima wang itu.“Kalau betul ada, sebutkan nama supaya kita boleh cari siapakah orang yang beruntung mendapat RM90 juta tersebut, tapi kalau tak ada, jangan bertindak bacul,” katanya.Pemuda PAS Wilayah Persekutuan membuat laporan polis agar Husam disiasat di bawah Seksyen 499 Keseksaan kerana fitnah jenayah.“Kami meminta Husam supaya jangan bertindak bacul dengan tidak berani menyatakan nama orang yang sepatutnya dinyatakan,” katanya.Di Kelantan, ketua pemuda PAS negeri Ahmad Fadhli Shaari berkata laporan polis dibuat agar Husam disiasat di bawah Seksyen 500 Kanun Keseksaan kerana menyebar maklumat palsu.“Kami mohon agar siasatan itu dilakukan segera. Hari ini bukan setakat Pasir Mas dan Rantau Panjang, bahkan 12 kawasan lain turut mengambil tindakan serupa,” katanya lapor Harakahdaily.Salam Datuk,Pemuda PAS have learned the UMNO trick of wasting police time by making far too many reports in too many places.Where did they learn this?Did they attend UMNO training camp?Or is Hadi confident that his best friend MO1's 24-hour replacement AG will happily charge Husam with a crime?The 24-hour replacement AG has done a very good job of ignoring the most massive crimes against the Malaysian people.
