Mengukur darjah signifikan kepekongan yang hinggap dibetis 1MDB. Dari bacaan perubatan saintifik dari Tumasik ini, 1MDB boleh lah iktiarkan perubatan dinegara sendiri, yang terkenal dengan rawatan batin, pawang dan uztas. Segala penyakit mereka bisa mengobati .. yang perlu di sediakan adalah fulusnye je.Kalau lah berjaya diubati saya yakin 1MDB ini akhirnya sebelah kaki nya akan ditongkatkan dgn kaki kayu juga .. ala lanun "Treasure Island". Ha barulah boleh jadi lanun yang betul-betul rupa lanun. Tapi kita musti ingat bahawa lanun era "Treasure Island", mereka merampok harta ditempat lain dan hangkut masuk ke negaranya sebagai khzanah negara demi untuk kesenangan anak cucu bangsa mereka. Rompakan cara gini barulah duitnya boleh dibawa ke Mekah Almakuramah .. betul tak uztas? Opp Pak ustaz kita belum baca lagi novel "Treasure Island".
column16: {Zalman A} MO1 MILKS THE LAST DROP....."The last of 1MDB's assets is expected to be transferred out in the coming months, as part of a plan to wind up the scandal-plagued Finance Ministry-owned company.According to Singapore's Straits Times, the remaining assets are Tun Razak Exchange (TRX), Bandar Malaysia in Kuala Lumpur and a 94.7-hectare plot of land in Ayer Itam, Penang.The report said the assets will be transferred to two Finance Ministry-owned companies, Aroma Teraju Sdn Bhd and Piramid Pertama Sdn Bhd."Datuk,Keep an eye on Aroma Teraju Sdn Bhd and Piramid Pertama Sdn BhdThe last is accurate.MO1 has used 1MDB as a pyramid scheme.
column17: {Zalman A} Khianat keatas FGV menjatuhkan maruah peneroka. Saya percaya inilah yang telah terjadi keatas peneroka. saya bukan anak peneroka- tapi saya berkecimpong dan bergaul dengan warga peneroka di Felda Chini, Pekan. Bertahun saya melakukan kegiatan politik disana dan sedikit sebanyak tahu akan gaya hidup dan pemikiran peneroka.Bila isa samad ditegah oleh mahkamah daripada menjadi pengerusi KPF, dia meletakkan proxy nya sebagai Pengerusi. Isa samad bukan kakitangan felda. Dia juga bukan anak peneroka. Dia hanya cukgu sekolah yang mula nya enggan jadi wakil rakyat. Ketika itu elaun wakil rakyat kurang daripada gaji guru. Tengku Razaleigh yang menyokong Isa jadi wakil rakyat.Hari ini Isa Samad kaya raya. Dia datang ke parlimen pakai kereta maserati. Ini tanda kejayaan Melayu. Orang Melayu pun berkata- apa salah nya jika Melayu pun pakai Maserati, Cina boleh? Maka semua orang Melayu mengagungkan kejayaan seperti ini.Somehow, orang Melayu kita ini tertarik dengan tokoh2 lanun dan pencuri.Mesti ada kaitan positif antara kaya nya dia dengan kerjaya politik sebagai MB dan menteri. Rasmi( nature) kaitan tersebut, mungkin boleh dibincangkan dimasa lain. Penyelidik dari bidang statistik dan econometrics boleh lah buat kajian kaitan antara kerjaya politik dan kekayaan.Hari ini kita hendak cakap mengenai koperasi permodalan felda (KPF)- jentera pelaburan bagi pihak peneroka. 112,000 peneroka. 220,000 ahli koperasi.  Pemilik 51% Felda Holdings( dahulu), memiliki kadang2 lebih 70% dalam beberapa syarikat.Kebanggaan orang Felda. Seluruh negara. Kecuali yang diharamjadahkan oleh Najib. Mereka lah jebat si anak tani.
column18: {Zalman A}  Hari ini, tidak lagi mampu membayar dividen seperti dahulu2 dalam belasan peratus. Hari ini terpaksa jual asset satu demi satu untuk terus membayar dividen. Jika tidak, mereka yang dahulu bersetuju memindahkan share KPF kepada FGV akan terdedah menjadi ejen dan barua Isa Samad dan Najib Razak. Duit RM2.2 billion mungkin telah lesap. Yang boleh ditunjukkan oleh KPF ialah ladang sawit di Sarawak yang terpaksa ada kos nya. Mengapa KPF tidak buka ladang ala felda disana jika sudah ada ladang besar?Disini bising sangat hendak buka ladang untuk jenerasi ke2.Ini  patut jadi bisnes model nya- KPF beli ladang besar dan buka estet ala felda. Jika KPF membeli, maka tanah2 kerajaan yang percuma itu, boleh di mohon oleh anak2 bangsa yang bukan jenerasi ke2 atau ke3 felda.  Kesian lah kepada anak kampong tradisional dan orang melayu yang miskin dalam bandar.Sekarang nasi sudah jadi bubur. Apabila kamu menyediakan tempat tidur, maka terpaksalah kamu yang tidur diatas nya. KPF sudah tidak ada dan wang mengurang. Lama kelamaan KPF akan hilang semua.Jika pengurusan KPF dilakukan oleh puak peneroka sendiri, ingat lah Najib tidak memandang kamu sebagai ada potensi. Itulah sebab nya KPF ditendang keluar dari FGV. Dia tahu KPF akan jahanam. Persepsi Najib keatas KPF sebegini adalah penghinaan keatas peneroka sendiri. Tapi peneroka kata tidak mengapa. Durian runtuh ada. Tahun ini dengar nya lagi banyak. sebagai umpan pilihanraya. orang Felda jual anak dan bini pun tidak mengapa. Tujuan Isa hendak jadi pengerusi KPF ialah untuk menguasai duit yang ada berbilion Ringgit dalam akaun KPF. Bila proksi nya dilantik, ada terma dalam perlantikan itu yang menyebut bahawa pegerusi KPF ada hak untuk membuat keputusan mengenai pelaburan atau perbelanjaan sebagai kata pemutus.Peneroka tidak nampak bahawa Isa Samad letak proxy dalam KPF. Dia ada hak membuat keputusan akhir. KPF baru sahaja mendapat RM2.2 bilion sebagai imbuhan menyerahkan 51% share nya dalam felda holdings. Tapi isa mahu meletakkan tangan kotornya keatas wang tesebut.Jadi apa yang diperlakukan keatas RM2.2 billion tersebut? Ada sebuah ladang sawit di Sarawak yang sudah berada agak lama dalam pasaran; harga nya antara RM750-800 juta. Tapi pengerusi KPF memutuskan untuk membeli ladang tersebut sebanyak RM1.2 bllion- kira2 RM400 juta tambahan.
column19: {Zalman A} Sudah tentu, ketika ini, Pengerusi KPF yang proxy Isa, menggunakan enterprise value per hectare.Atau, adakah ini komisyen kepada beberapa orang?Isa hendak memastikan bahawa setiap sen dari RM2.2 billion jangan dimanfaatkan oleh KPF dan peneroka.Sesiapa yang hadhir dalam mesyuarat luar biasa meluluskan pemindahan saham KPF kepada FGV akan ingat suasana seperti orchestra mesyuarat tersebut. Seolah sudah diatur- ada kumpulan akan bersorak dan bertepuk tanda sokong, ada kumpulan yang mengeboo bila soalan yang tidak secocok dengan kehendak Isa Samad dimajukan. Ada kumpulan yang buat bising bila se2orang hendak mendapatkan mikrofon.Suasana mesyuarat tersebut macam mesyuarat parti MIC suatu ketika.Semua sudah diaturkan supaya isa Samad berjaya memindahkan share KPF kepada FGV.Lebihan wang dari RM2.2 billion tolak belian ladang sawit di Sarawak bagaimana diguna? Kemungkinan besar, lebihan digunakan untuk membeli saham FGV. Bayangkan ini- setelah ditendang keluar, KPF dipaksa membeli saham dalam syarikat yang menendang nya keluar. Saya tidak tahu, KPF ini ada maruah atau tidak. Setelah diperlaku demikian dan dihina, masih lagi mahu membeli saham FGV.Sekarang KPF , setakat ogos 2016 ada 5.8% share dalam FGV. Ia memiliki 211.76 juta saham FGV yang hari ini bernilai RM338.8 juta sahaja. Jika 211.76 juta saham itu dibeli pada harga RM4.55 perbelanjaan KPF ialah RM963juta. Ertinya, KPF rugi atas kertas sebanyak RM 624 juta. Hilang sudah RM624 juta.Peneroka tidak rasa apa2 kah? Pertama KPF ditendang keluar. Mereka dapat RM2.2 bilion sedangkan pasaran menilaikan pegangan KPF bernilai RM4 billion lebih. Ertinya, dengan RM2.2 bilion, KPF telah melepaskan peluang mendapat wang yang lebih, sebanyak RM2 billion. http://sakmongkol.blogspot.my/2017/01/ganyang-kpf-ganyang-maruah-peneroka.html
column20: {Zalman A} "PETALING JAYA, Jan 6 — Opposition parties must end their feuding and re-organise in the lead-up to the general elections, PKR vice-president Nurul Izzah Anwar warned today.The Lembah Pantai MP said the opposition should instead focus on its reform agenda and put the public as its top priority.“It's about how you manage the communications in the lead-up to the elections.“I would urge everybody to understand the electorates are waiting, so we better get our acts in order,” she told reporters at PKR headquarters here.Izzah was asked earlier whether Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) is a liability for the opposition pact Pakatan Harapan due to the party's reported internal problems.PPBM was recently caught in controversy following the “removal” of Anina Saadudin as the head of its women's wing Srikandi.PPBM had signed an agreement with Pakatan Harapan to form an electoral pact to face Barisan Nasional in the 14th general elections."Manifesto tadak?PM candidate tadak?Shadow cabinet tadak?Logo tadak?The people don't know what the alternative to MO1 is.Time is short.Shadow cabinet means that one person is expert to attack the gomen on all their blunders.It builds credibility.Tak kan jemaah menteri MO1 tu "terrer" sangat?
column21: {azhar} Do you expect the Malays to believe that Najib Razak and Rosmah sit together by themselves and at times, with their cohorts, to plan, plot, and scheme of ways and means to make money for themselves at the expense of the Malays?No, you are wrong. It is not “at the expense of the Malays”.They believe that it is planning and plotting and scheming to make money for the good of the Malays.That is the story being sold to Malays, especially the UMNO Malays.Once the Malays buy that story, everything else falls into place – the RM2.6billion, the 1MDB heist, everything is being done for the good of Malays.Oh, and of cos, Islam.“And what of Jho Low?”And what, indeed, of Jho Low?Using the logic of ketuanan Melayu, he is just another orang Cina doing the bidding of a Melayu, as all orang Cina should be doing.Remember, it’s for the good of Melayus?And Melayus hold the upper hand in Malaysia.So what if Jho Low has made lots of money?Tak pe lah.He is only one orang Cina who has made some money. At least, the other orang2 Cina in Malaysia didn’t make any, so that is some consolation.“then he is beholden to Jho Low to not only carry the caper out…but to keep quiet about it all”Of cos, Jho Low would carry out the orders of a Melayu.Also, Jho Low still has family in Malaysia who make good hostages.“The fun will really start when Jho Low has to front up in court to tell his side of the story.”To be honest, I doubt if Jho Low would be fronting any court anywhere soon.The legal process can be exploited for many years and UMNO has demonstrated that it will be as uncooperative as possible.Eventually, the statute of limitations would kicked in and all those countries trying to prosecute Jho Low can go whistle Dixie, just as Hong Kong had to in the Michael Chia case.Of cos, all the above depends on Malays believing that all this is being done for the good of Malays.I keep forgetting, and for the good of Islam, of cos.That is what the Bugis pirate will spin.
column22: {sukasamasuka} Datuk."Saya [Datuk AKJ] tak boleh salahkan mufti, lebai dan haji kalau mereka tak faham [pasal 1MDB].  Mereka mungkin pandai agama tapi mereka tak tahu urus niaga."1. 1MDB ada la skim penipuan yang memang sudah dirancang sehalus2nya dengan begitu rapi.2. 1MDB berasakan penggunaan jenama "1Malaysia"...dan logo "1Malaysia".3. "Malaysia Bolih" adalah satu jenama yang diasakan olih Tun berlandaskan semangat nasionalisma orang2 Malaysia pada ketika itu tanpa mengira bangsa, agama dan jantina.Jenama "Malaysia Bolih" ini mencetuskan semangat bekerja keras untuk mengharumkan Malaysia.4. Bodowi pula melancarkan jenama "Islam Hadhiri" nya pula...dimana satu hantu pun tidak tau apa binatang "Islam Hadiri" ini kecuali orang2 UMNO di tingkat 4 Putrajaya seperti KJ dan geng dia.5. Najib pula melancarkan "1Malaysia"...slogan politik kosong yang berteraskan konsep "One Israel"...political fund untuk party2 di Israel...sama dengan 1MDB untuk dana party2 UMNO dan rakan2nya termasuk PAS.6. Jadinya, memang tepat sekali bila Datuk kata..."Mereka [mufti, lebai dan haji] mungkin pandai agama tapi mereka tak tahu urus niaga."...sebab penggunaan konsep dan jenama "1Malaysia" ini adalah untuk mengelirukan orang ramai...semada di bandar2 dan juga di kampong2.7. Ramai juga orang fikir yang "1Malaysia"DB [1MDB] ini sebuah syarikat untuk orang Melayu sebab...tolong Melayu...kerana 1MDB banyak jasa seperti mengadakan...Klinik "1Malaysia"...bayar RM1 saja untuk orang Melayu dikampong2Kedai Runcit "1Malaysia"...untuk Melayu dapat rumah kedaiKedai Buku "1Malaysia"...supaya Melayu dapat buku2 murah"1Malaysia" Naik Haji...beribu2 orang UMNO/PAS dapat naik haji free"1Malaysia" Tun Razak Exchange untuk keagungan ekonomi Islam dan Melayu..Bandar "1Malaysia"...untuk pembangunan hartanah Melayu8. Jadi 1MDB banyak jasa.9. Tetapi, 1MDB adalah dana untuk UMNO dan rakan2nya.Duit untuk dana 1MDB adalah duit rakyat dari kutipan cukai...itu la sekarang asset2 1MDB masuk dalam kerajaan.10. Sambil menyelam minum air...Najib makan duit rakyat...curi duit rakyat...Tun tau perkara ini...Datuk pun tau perkara ini...ini la penipuan terbesar di Malaysia olih pembesar2 orang Melayu UMNO.Lim Kit Siang dan DAP tidak ada kena mengena sebab kuasa di tangan UMNO.Begini la kerja haramzadah anak2 Melayu dalam UMNO.
column23: {sukasamasuka} Datuk."Kerajaan Singapura ada sumpit ajaib. Soalnya ia hendak guna atau tidak terhadap Cina kepercayaan Najib ini. Boleh jadi Singapura ada agenda lain dengan Jho Low. "1. Singapura adalah salah sebuah "trading" nation yang terbesar di dunia.2. Untuk hidup, Singapura terpaksa berhadapan dan bersaing dengan negara2 "Melayu" seperti Malaysia, Indonesia dan Philippine dan orang2 Islam.3. Sumber mata pencarian Singapura adalah berniaga sebagai trading nation, tidak ada pilihan lain sebab tidak ada minyak, kelapa sawit, bijih timah, air dan kayu balak.4. Tetapi Singapura perlukan semua sumber...asas nya adalah wang rinngit.5. Itu la agenda Singapura dengan Jho Low...duit.6. Najib dan UMNO perlukan duit, bukan kelapa sawit atau Felda.7. Hadi dan PAS perlukan duit, bukan Hudud.8. Hanya cara saja berbeza.9. Singapura dapat duit cara "halal"...ia-itu berdagang...dengan apa cara sekali pun...termasuk jual dan beli maruah manusia seperti Najib dan Jho Low..."sumpit ajaib" made-in-Singapore.10. Sebenarnya sumpit ajaib Singapura sudah lama mengena sasaran...maruah Melayu.Bila maruah Melayu tergadai sebab perbuatan haramzadahnya, UMNO lost its moral authority to govern Malaysia.Itu saja.
column24: {Boley Jalan} Dato, yg jelas umno penipu melayu........tiada bahasa/kata2 yg dapat memberi gambaran busuknya umno hari ini.
column25: {hihwag} Makcik Kiah masa kecil2 tahun 60an dulu seorang pelajar yang pintar.  tetapi kerana kemiskinan, kerana dia anak sulung ditambah dengan adik2 yang ramai terpaksa mengorbankan pelajarannya, terpaksa membantu keluarga agar adik2 yang lain dapat teruskan pelajaran.Tak pernah kita terfikir yang senario ini akan berulang kembali pada tahun 2017…60 tahun selepas merdeka dan berbaki tiga tahun sebelum kita melangkah menuju negara maju.  Pada hari ini berapa ramai anak2 melayu khususnya yang terkandas bukan kerana tidak pandai tetapi tidak mampu untuk meneruskan pelajaran.9A dalam SPM tidak membawa apa2 makna lagi kerana biasiswa sudah hampir pupus.  Tempat untuk ke universiti awam sangat terhad, swasta mencecah 50-60 ribu setahun dan PTPTN kita tahu lebih memudaratkan daripada membantu.  Jurusan yang diminati tidak disokong, maka akhirnya anak2 terpaksa berpuashati dengan bidang yang langsung tidak diminati.  Kos sara hidup yang tinggi menyebabkan ibubapa tenggelam punca menabung duit sen-sen demi menyambung pendidikan anak2.  Kalau iman sudah menipis, dia pasti sanggup mencuri bahkan membunuh demi anak2.Seorang rakan bercerita bagaimana dia cuba memujuk anaknya untuk menukar bidang daripada perubatan kepada kejuruteraan kerana perubatan tidak lagi mendapat tempat dinegara ini dan kosnya mencecah jutaan ringgit.  Si anak tidak membantah cuma berkata…”kita suka menjadi doktor bukan kerana nak jadi kaya, tetapi nak membantu memberi rawatan kepada orang miskin dan menyelamatkan sebanyak mungkin nyawa.  setidaknya itu jihad kita untuk membalas jasa mak dan abah, juga jihad untuk agama, bangsa dan negara.”  Si ayah tidak terkata apa2.  Hari ini si anak sudah 4 tahun mengaji untuk jadi doktor dengan keputusan cemerlang, tetapi tiada sesiapa pun yang tampil membantu.   Kerajaan kemudian menukar PMR kepada PT3.  Anak jiran yang seorang lagi mendapat keputusan cemerlang.  Memang boleh sahaja diserap ke sekolah berasrama penuh, tetapi kerana menyahut seruan kerajaan melahirkan insan berkemahiran, kebetulan si anak memang ada sedikit bakat maka dihantar ke kolej vokasional.  Tup-tup hari ini keluar berita lulusan diploma KV tidak diiktiraf dan tidak boleh menyambung ke university jika tiada sijil SPM.  Apa ke jadahnya mahu SPM lagi kalau sudah 4 tahun berhempas pulas mendapatkan diploma?
column26: {hihwag} Tahun lepas setengah juta pelajar menduduki peperiksaan UPSR dengan format baru yang susahnya macam SPM.  Keputusan jatuh mendadak apabila hanya 4000 sahaja mendapat semua A berbanding lebih 40 ribu pada tahun tahun sebelumnya.  Jika kualiti yang dicari…nah sudah tersedia didepan mata, namun tanpa modal yang mencukupi apa peluang anak2 ini untuk ke peringkat yang seterusnya?  jika yang 4000 sudah tercekik, yang lagi 496000 bagaimana pula?Hari ini semua mesti bayar sendiri.  Ramai ibubapa yang kecewa.  Yang ada tiga anak sudah azab, yang ada 5, 7, 10 anak bagaimana?  Mereka yang sudah “give-up” akan berkata “buat apa suruh anak belajar tinggi-tinggi? Last-last berhutang juga, baik terus kerja, baik kahwin dengan menteri, baik jadi orang biasa-biasa jual goreng pisang.” Apa jawapan kita kepada soalan-soalan kecewa seperti diatas?  Adakah menteri bertugas masih boleh mendabik dada konon dasar-dasar yang direkanya berjaya?  Apakah dana2 yang dikata sudah sedikit itu mengalir ke tempat yang sepatutnya atau sudah masuk ke kocek sendiri menjadi jam-jam tangan mewah, menjadi ‘mansion’, kereta sport dan jongkong-jongkong emas?  Atau ditabur kepada manusia paling tak berguna, pakai baju merah bikin kecoh demi mengekalkan kuasa?Nation building bermula dengan pendidikan berkualiti dan mampu buat semua rakyat Malaysia.  Berkualiti dan murah apabila kerajaan menyediakan perbagai inisiatif membantu mereka yang ada usaha, ada sedikit kepandaian dan kemahiran.  “spare no expense” pada tempat yang betul, janganlah terlalu berkira untuk mewariskan negara ini kepada anak2 yang bakal mewarisi.Peliknya apabila pasukan bolasepak negeri tiada penaja, maka gegak gempitalah menteri-menteri, kerabat dan tokoh politik mengherdik syarikat korporat, agensi kerajaan pusat dan negeri kerana tidak turun membantu.  Tidak sampai 2 minggu beritanya menghuni muka hadapan (bukan muka sport di belakang lagi), selesailah segala isu…semua happy dan business is back as usual.Kita marah menteri bodoh dan bangang.  Kita pun sama bangang juga. Semoga Allah selamatkan negara ini dan gantikan pemimpin celaka kepada pemimpin yang berjiwa beragama.
column27: {Zed-85} Sallam Dato’Selain dari penyakit berulat, zaman dulu ada juga ramai orang yang perutnya banyak cacing kerawit.Oleh kerana dunia semakin moden, ada ubat yang dicipta untuk bunuh cacing kerawit, kalau tidak silap saya “Zentel”. Banyak ubat anti biotik yang semakin kuat dikeluarkan untuk bunuh bakteria dari dalam badan selain dari luar badan.Oleh itu penyakit kudis berulat tidak kita jumpa lagi.Dalam dunia moden ini juga, ada undang-undang yang dicipta untuk menangani rasuah, pengubahan wang haram, penyalah-gunaan kuasa dan lain-lain.Malangnya perlaksanaannya tidak sempurna di Malaysia. Walaupun dunia semakin maju , tahap pemikiran kita terutamanya orang melayu masih lama.Di Singapura, tidak ada tolak ansur dalam soal rasuah, pengubahan wang haram dan penyalahan guna kuasa. Kalau tidak silap saya lebih 20 tuduhan mahkamah untuk berapa orang telah dikenakan bersabit dengan 1MDB. Orang yang dituduh itu pun telah didapati bersalah.Saya rasa ramai orang melayu sedar negara dalam masalah. Ramai yang tahu harga barang semakin naik, duit Malaysia semakin jauh. Cuma ramai orang melayu yang tidak tahu setakat mana negara kita ini dalam masalah.Ibaratnya orang pakai motor kapcai. Bunyi enjin sudah lain dan enjin samakin panas dan susah nak start. Minyak motor pun cepat habis. Tapi masih boleh jalan lagi. Oleh itu jalan saja.Sepatutnya, hantar ke kedai, tukar gasket atau pun tukar saja motor lain. Ini nak tunggu sampai “Overhaul”. Masa overhaul, serba serbi kena tukar dan banyaklah duit yang keluar ditambah dengan GST.  Nak jual motor dah tak laku.Saya orang Johor.  Kalau di Johor, nak tunggu hospital terbakar barulah nak tukar wiring dan pendawaian dan macam-macam.Kalau di Singapura bukan saja undang-undang berjalan betul, Hospital Kerajaan sama standard dengan hospital Swasta. Hospital Singapura semuanya berhawa dingin. Tidak ada “Open air” wad dewan sampai 80 sehingga 100 orang.Pendekata, orang melayu yang untung sedikit, yang rugi banyak.
column28: {IdrisMdIsa} Satu kesalahan besar para agamawan bila mengganggap bahawa hanya dengan mengetahui ilmu wahyu mereka mengganggap diri mereka sudah sempurna, boleh mengeluarkan fatwa itu dan pendapat ini, sedangkan perkara2 baru yang timbul memerlukan ilmu yang holistic untuk memahaminya. untuk isu2 yg sedia ada pun, terutama sekali di dalam hal ehwal pentadbiran/pengurusan negara, sekurang2nya mesti ada ilmu asas ekonomi/kewangan dan undang2, sekuarnag2nya, dan tahap pengetahuan am yang tinggi. Bagi perkara2 sains dan teknologi boleh dirujuk kpd pakar masing2. Mereka tu ingat dengan membaca berjilid2 kitab agama they have become omnipotent tanpa menyedari yang mereka itu sebenarnya omni-incompetent and/or omni-impotent. Tuan2 mungkin tak percaya bahawa para2 mufti pun ramai yang berilmu tinggi tetapi masih tidak memahami agama. Mereka jadi pengtaklid buta kepada ulama2 silam sedangkan suasana zaman dahulu tidak sama dengan suasa zaman sekarang. Islam adalah suatu agama yang hidup, yang sentiasa bersesuaian dengan perubahan suasana dan zaman. Mereka golongan yang bebal sebenarnya dan tidak kuarang yang munafiq, zholim dan fasiq. Apabila orang agama menjual agama, runtuhlah benteng pertahanan terakhir umat Islam.
column29: {sukasamasuka} Datuk.hihwag 7:35 AM..."Kerajaan kemudian menukar PMR kepada PT3. Anak jiran yang seorang lagi mendapat keputusan cemerlang...kerana menyahut seruan kerajaan melahirkan insan berkemahiran...si anak dihantar ke kolej vokasional. Tup-tup hari ini keluar berita lulusan diploma KV tidak diiktiraf dan tidak boleh menyambung ke university jika tiada sijil SPM. Apa ke jadahnya mahu SPM lagi kalau sudah 4 tahun berhempas pulas mendapatkan diploma?"1. Tepat sekali 100%...ini la kisah benar tentang derita anak2 kita sekarang yang masih sekolah di kolej vokasional.2. Ini terjadi pada anak buah aku, ibu bapa dia marah.3. Ikut cerita dia, mereka kena habiskan dulu On-the-Job Training dari December 2016 hingga April 2017...dia ni "guninea pig" atau First Batch program student.Lepas April 2017, Malaysian Qualifying Examination akan process tahap pencapaian akademik dan vokasional mereka sebelum mengiktiraf Sijil Vokasional Malaysia [sama taraf dengan SPM] dan Sijil Diploma itu sekali gus.4. Apa yang terjadi, Kementerian Pelajaran...pada masa itu dibawah Muhyddin dan Mary Yap [seorang Cina Sabah yang memang baik dan berdedikasi tinggi tentang pelajaran sebab dia Cina dan bukan orang politik, tetapi bekas seorang Pengetua Terbaik]...melancarkan program Diploma Vokasional yang baru ini.. tetapi, sayangnya kedua2 mereka ini sudah tidak ada lagi di kementerian....itu la jadi kucar kacir buat masa kini.5. Vokasional program ini memerlukan bajet besar [mungkin dalam sekitar RM600 juta atau lebih] sebab Sekolah2 Teknik yang terpilih [25 buah di seluruh negara, kalau tak silap] pada ketika itu tidak lengkap untuk menampung program ini dari segi kelengkapan teknikal macam kolej2 vocational di England atau Germany.6. Muhy tau pasal program ini...tanya dia.7. Sebenarnya, aku sokong BN pada PRU13 lepas sebab aku terharu pada UMNO yang betul2 mau tolong anak2 Bumiputra kita untuk dapat technical skills supaya mereka setaraf dengan budak2 Jepun, British dan German.8. Program itu dilancarkan sebelum PRU13.9. Rupa2nya hanya permainan politik UMNO saja..."janji Melayu"...itu la "janji orang Malaya UMNO".10. Kita tidak ada duit untuk meneruskan program itu...kemana duit2 kita untuk pelajaran anak2 cucu kita?...mana la aku tau...itu kan janji kosong sahaja!
column30: {sukasamasuka} Datukhihwag 7:36 AM..."“spare no expense” pada tempat yang betul, janganlah terlalu berkira untuk mewariskan negara ini kepada anak2 yang bakal mewarisi."1. Memang betul kata kata kamu ini hihwag.2. Hanya dengan menguasai pelajaran yang betul saja anak2 cucu kita, jangan kira bangsa la, dapat keluar dari lembah kemiskinan.3. column31: {Zed-85} Sallam Dato’Berkenaan dengan komen gulangan ulama yang bercanggah dengan Tun Mahathir.Orang zaman sekarang pergi haji naik kapalterbang.Dalam kitab ilmu agama, ada tidak menerangkan macamana kapalterbang yang beratnya lebih 1000 Tan boleh terbang?Kalau kita tanya ulama macamana kapalterbang boleh terbang, golongan ulama tidak boleh jawap kerana dalam kitab tidak ada menyebut tentang “Hukum Bernoulli”.Mengikut Ilmu Sains, Hukum Bernoulli, apabila terdapatnya kelajuan yang berbeza diantara permukaan atas dan bawah,  perbedaan ini akan menyebabkan tekanan atas permukaan tersebut. Disebabkan bentuk sayap kapalterbang, kelajuan udara di atas melebihi kelajuan udara di bawah. Disebabkan perbezaan ini, terdapatlah tekanan ke atas di sayap dan menyebab kapalterbang terbang.Golongan ulama tidak belajar hukam Bernoulli tetapi apabila pergi ke Haji menggunakan kapalterbang walaupun tak paham macamana kapalterbang boleh terbang.Pada satu hari saya pergi ke ceramah di Masjid. Ada ustaz yang mempersoalkan macamana bulan boleh tergantung tanpa tali di udara. Sebenarnya Ustaz itu tidak sadar yang bukan sahaja bulan tetapi beratus satelit yang tergantung tak bertali di angkasa lepas mengelilingi dunia.Oleh itu bukan semua perkara ulama tahu dan kadangkala golongan ulama sendiri tidak sedar banyak perkara yang mereka tidak tahu.Saya bukan hendak mengecilkan golongan ulama tetapi ada golongan ulama yang tidak sadar bahawa ilmu mereka masih tidak mencukupi.

column35: {Zalman A} Institutional failure and lack of accountability are not limited to 1MDB. Year after year, the Auditor General has revealed staggering cases of mismanaged public funds. Government bodies bought wall clocks at RM 3,810 a piece (the market price is easily below RM 100) and scanners for RM 14,670 (market price: RM 200). The “normalization of corruption” is deeply embedded in the existing hierarchy, from the top to the bottom. In the newly released report, the auditors found that the Federal Land Development Authority (FELDA) lost hundreds of millions due to multiple transactions without proper authorization, dubious planning and execution, and complete mismanagement. It made news for two to three days before disappearing, like pretty much every other scandal. Corrupt acts are committed and revealed, followed by public outrage. But with no institution to exercise accountability, the news eventually disappears. It has become a normal cycle.The by-elections last year might provide some hint as to how the general elections will turn out. Najib’s coalition won both of them. I was in the suburban areas when opposition parties held a town hall panel session, inevitably speaking in English, touching on issues such as the removal of the attorney general. While these are big, national issues, it felt out of place. There is a visible gap between the politicians, the city folks, the demonstrators who so urgently and desperately want reforms, and the voters outside the cities, who voted for candidates affiliated to Najib’s party.To speak plainly, people don’t mind the status quo as long as they are not affected at the most immediate and personal level. The whole 1MDB scandal has been too complicated to be explained to non-English literate voters with no understanding of the complex technical terms, in a five-minute rally,. Financial scandals grow more complicated and people just lose interest. Maybe they underestimate the cost of it all, maybe they don’t care enough or just don’t lose enough; either way they are not angry enough to want to change the status quo.http://thediplomat.com/
column36: {Ruliros} Dato saya sangat setuju duit yg hantar imam dan jkkk pergi haji itu adalah duit haram haram yg kedua ialah mereka memotong peluang org lain dari pergi haji ketiga mana mufti yg makan dedak dan sudah terlalu lama itu perlulah berundur jerana ada juga mufti yg takut hendak mengur pemimpin yg rasuah dan mencuri duit rakyat utk keluarga mereka sekarang mufti ini jadi jurucakap dan penyokong pemimpin yg raduah kesian
column37: {Zalman A} Dangers of China "favours".A prominent socio-economic activist has warned Putrajaya that it risks putting Malaysia in the same trouble that Sri Lanka is in with its indebtedness to China.There would be a heavy price to pay if China-linked mega projects were to fail, said Azlan Awang, who is deputy chairman of Bantah-TPPA and a founder of Blindspot, a socio-economic interest group.Azlan told FMT there were similarities between Sri Lanka’s and Malaysia’s indebtedness to China.He pointed to a recent violent riot near the port city of Hambantota in southern Sri Lanka. The rioters were protesting against a deal they said would result in the port becoming a Chinese colony.The deal would see the port being leased for 99 years to a company in which China will have 80% ownership. It would also result in the establishment of an industrial zone where Chinese companies would be invited to set up base.Azlan said the deal was a consequence of Sri Lanka’s failure to pay for the China-financed Mattala airport project. It should give a glimpse of how Beijing would deal with those failing to pay their dues, he added.“Beijing may not be sending the Red Army, but the ownership of the Hambantota deep sea port as well as 15,000 acres of land for the new industrial zone ceded to China as it’s colony for the next 99 years will do.“For Malaysia, what will be our pound of flesh if we default on our humongous debts?”Azlan alleged that Putrajaya’s “indiscriminate and reckless” pursuit of investments and borrowings had led to “huge piles” of debt, without many multiplier effects or long term economic gains.“While China may not be perceived as imperialistic, it certainly does not extend money out of chivalry. China knows exactly where its pound of flesh will be coming from.”

column39: {Zalman A} Finally - strategic thinking!"Pas, PKR and Pribumi Bersatu leaders are discussing the formation of a coalition catering for especially the Malay Muslim electorates.“The question that needed to be posed to Pas leaders is that, which cooperation the party will gain most…either with Pakatan or Umno, the lynchpin of Barisan Nasional (BN)?” the geostrategist commented,Azmi also regarded the plan for a new opposition coalition as part of the game plan by Pas, PKR and Pribumi Bersatu to test the response of the grassroots, particularly supporters of the quarreling DAP and Pas.He said the coalition may actually becomes a reality if DAP and Pas supporters responded positively to the idea.On whether such a new coalition could affect Umno’s chances in the next general election, the geostrategist said the spill-over effect would be the reduction of the party’s conservative Malay votes bank."This is the correct way to go.
column40: {Faqqirulqhoir} I'm attracted to the comments made by En Zalman A (11.49 AM) concerning the flaccid response of most Malaysians to the scandalous and chronic misgovernance of the country. En Zalman rightly pointed to the annual ritual of presenting the Auditor General's report, which imperfect as it is, do point to a chronic and glaring criminalised culture long nurtured. The term used was "the normalisation of corruption". If I may interject however, they have got to this situation at a cost, a situation once much bandied about as "trust deficit". For the most part, this has been overlooked but its potency cannot be underrated. An assistant professor writing in the Singapore Straits Times recently noted that :" A trust deficit could potentially lead to more damaging systemic risk. Thinning public trust and greater tendency to talk down the economy could amplify Malaysia's political, social and economic risks...  An obvious benchmark of confidence is the Malaysian ringgit, Asia's worst-performing currency. Though there are external factors that have contributed to the weakening of the ringgit - Trumponomics, the attractiveness of US bond yields and weak commodity prices - analysts are also quick to add that the ringgit suffers from domestic risks, the premium of which is anybody's guess. Some see domestic risk as one contributing factor to the ringgit weakening to a rate of RM4.70 to US$1." (Abdillah Noh, Dec 29, 2016).Currently trending is how the United Malays chief 'spokesman' got a spectacular and public trashing by the Tengku Mahkota of Johore.My point to En Zalman is that many people can be 'worked up' on numerous fronts and issues but mayhaps they need to be regular 'brainstorming', coordination and relentless single-mindedness.Thank you and regards.

column6: {sukasamasuka} Datuk."January 5, 2017...Singapore PM receives praise over foreign worker comment.“Walking along [The Most Honorable Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong] Changi Beach on the New Year weekend, I saw this man sitting under a tree, alone yet not alone. He looked like a foreign worker, calling home on his cellphone.“As we enjoy the festive days with friends and family, let us spare a thought for the foreign workers who have left their families behind to work in a distant land,” Lee said, adding it was good that the internet and mobile phones helped these workers keep in touch and not feel quite so far away from their loved ones.Calling for Singaporeans to appreciate the contribution of these foreigners, Lee also highlighted how the foreign workers have to slog and save every dollar earned to help support their families back home.“They (foreign workers) build our HDB flats and MRT lines, they keep our roads clean and parks green, and they take care of our young and elderly,” Lee said.Singaporean Lay Sun Ong said Lee’s post demonstrated the traits of a great leader.“Thank you Sir for being a caring, compassionate and thoughtful person. Remind us to be more graceful towards the foreign worker. This is how a great leader should be. Lead by example,” Lay wrote."http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/highlight/2017/01/05/singapore-pm-receives-praise-over-foreign-worker-comment/Wow! my hat to you Sir, The Most Honorable Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.You are indeed a great leader whom I greatly have so much respect!A truly great nation!How wonderful to note that your father, the Most Honorable Lee Kuan Yew, made the right decision way back in 9 August 1965.Your father is a great leader too like you.

column9: {hihwag} Rising heat in Singapore case....Najib’s spin-masters will now be forced to add the Government of Singapore to its bizarre list of ‘international conspirators’, who are allegedly seeking to topple him.This follows today’s court developments in Singapore, where prosecutors specifically and repeatedly referred to the March 2013 transfer of $1.2 billion into the Falcon Bank account of Tanore Finance Corporation as being “suspicious”.$681 million of this suspicious money was within hours passed into Najib’s AmBank account in KL.Najib’s excuse that the money was a genuine donation from a Saudi Royal is not dignified with any mention from the Singapore authorities, since there is no evidence for it.Instead, the Swiss Falcon Bank Manager Jans Sturzenegger has been charged with 16 counts of money laundering, including his failure to report the suspicious money that entered Tanore’s account number 855029901 21st-25th March 2013, which was then passed into Najib’s private account.This guilty plea matches evidence from the US Department of Justice court filings, which specifically say that Falcon Bank staff were on record expressing concerns about the huge payments that were forwarded from 1MDB, through Tanore and on to Najib, but that they were over-ruled by the hierarchy of the Bank.

column13: {hihwag} TIME MAGAZINE.....TODAYShe gave her speech from her dining room, which also functions as her newsroom. It is here that she runs Sarawak Report, a nearly seven-year-old investigative news website. Sixteen months earlier, in July 2015, she had published a bombshell of a report: the personal bank accounts of Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak, she alleged, held nearly $700 million tied to state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB).“I want to say first how sorry I am not to be able to join you in Singapore as planned,” Rewcastle Brown, 57, told the crowd nearly 13,000 km away. Her audience, comprising mostly executives and auditors, was rapt. “The loss is entirely mine as it was a huge opportunity for me to meet with so many people of expertise in financial fraud — where I have been stumbling along as a jobbing journalist.”“So, where do I fit as a mere reporter into this juggernaut of a story?” she asked the crowd. “You can hardly expect me not to take advantage of this platform you have kindly provided me with, to put in a plea for the vital role of journalism and free media in exposing corruption that threatens to undermine all our democratic systems.”Rewcastle Brown’s British penchant for understatement is deceptive. The 1MDB controversy uncovered by this “mere reporter” is the biggest corruption scandal in recent memory to involve a head of government, in terms of both the sum of money involved and the magnitude of the sensational news story it has become. Rewcastle Brown is, as Abraham Lincoln apocryphally said of the antislavery author Harriet Beecher Stowe, “the little lady who wrote the book that started this great war.”

column7: {Zalman A} KUALA LUMPUR, Dec 29 — Malaysia’s Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) has secured government financing to fund its US$505.4 million (RM2.2 billion) purchase of a minority stake in Indonesian palm oil firm PT Eagle High Plantations Tbk , state news agency Bernama reported.In a controversial move, state-owned Felda said last week it would buy a 37 per cent stake in Eagle High, paying a 95 per cent premium its last closing share price at the time.The deal has under mounting criticism this week, with opposition lawmakers and industry analysts calling the deal overpriced. Some critics have also said Felda would have to raise money to fund the acquisition.Bernama quoted Muzzammil Mohd Nor, Felda’s deputy director-general, as saying that government financing was secured but there were no details on the amount of financing in the report.Left pocket, right pocket, Bugis pocket.That is how it works.The "mark-up" technique and steal the difference.Look at the joke that is TRX, whose failure is now back to square one, with its debts back on our shoulders.This is the Bugis songlap cycle: Buy, overprice, songlap, re-sell, absorb.It was like that in MOD days too.
column8: {Keluarga Felda dari seberang.} Salam Datuk AKJ:Sewaktu tertubuhnya BW Plantation Tbk/BWP di di kuasai oleh Tjipto Widodo pada tahun 1998(jika tak silap saya,ladang masih kecil kira 700hecter(zaman itu Financial Crisis)Tjipto Widodo besarkan perusahan tersebut pada tahun 2002 bersama Halim Ashari(Warga Negara Malaysia yg ada pengalaman di Bousted),Halim dilantik sbg President Director dan Widodo adalah Presiden Komisaris.Hasilnya memberangsangkan.Pada tahun 2009 Peter Sondakh melirik BW Plantation(barangkali MD nya org Malaysia dan juga ada saham besar di BW).Peter Sondakh/PS melihat ini peluang terbaik kerna PS terkenal sbg seorg beli jual perusahaan.PS tersenarai org ke 8 terkaya di Indonesia setelah sepak terajangnya dalam penjualan PT Excel Indo kpd Telekom Malaysia dan mula bangunkan empirenya diMalaysia hasil keakraban beliau dgn Najib(agaknya Najib yg jadikan PS tersenarai ke8 terkaya di Indonesia).Halim ashari melepaskan saham beliau di BW Plantation pada tahun 2014-2015.Dari situ PS tidak perlu memikirkan jaya atau tidak BW Plantation kedepan(ada 2 syarikat yg bawa BW Plantation ke mahkamah kerna hutang tertunggak tapi telah di selesai di luar pengadilan/mahkamah).Bagi PS beli BW dalam tempoh 5 bln 15 hari dan tawarkan pada FGV,kemudian Felda dan terakhir PIC/ anak perusahaan Felda.PS sondakh buat 'instant cash'saperti juga  moto 'cash is king'.Modus buat intant cash diulang tayang oleh PS sama saperti penjualan PT Excel pada Telekom.PS jadi lagi kaya sekarang hasil 2nd offer pada Malaysia kerna hanya dengan panggilan telepon transaksi berjaya kedua berjaya,tiada yg boleh halang,kerana moto Cash is King dan kuasa di tangan Gue(aku).PS bertambah kaya,sahabt di Malaysia bertambah uang,yg jual saham pada PS dah duduk goyang kaki di bumi Garuda.Salam semua

column10: {hihwag} To the NGOs, Welfare Department, the Church groups, the Sikh humanitarian associations, the Buddhist humanitarian associations, the political parties etc, there is another issue here.FELDA is having problems meeting its 'core responsibilities'.  FELDA does not sell roti canai. To make a long story short they are short of funds to pay the settlers.For the past 60 years 100,000 settlers  have depended on almost 100% on Felda for their lifeline. That lifeline is now under great duress.  The total population at the Felda schemes is much more than 100,000. Counting family members, dependents, second generation etc the population is in excess of 1.5 million people. If Felda cannot uphold its 'core responsibilities',  what will happen to all these Felda settlers, their families and dependents? How will they eat? How will they pay for their daily survival? A great humanitarian disaster could befall them. Could befall us.  Do not expect the kleptocratic gomen to put on their thinking caps. Look at that picture of that Felda director above.  The look on his face says,"??????? ?????? ????? ?????????? ???????, ???, ????''He never expected that the first class flights, the cigars, the London trips etc would actually require some hard work and some tough thinking on the job. Folks, obviously these folks cannot make the cut. It is we who have work to do. Lets all pull together.

column14: {Zalman A} Yo Online Media, plantation group has defaulted. Please ask the right questions.Here is more info. Talk is they have defaulted on their bank borrowings with at least one local bank. Which bank? The one that carries the logo of that endangered species. Cap Rimau. But "officially" it is not a default because the bank has "rescheduled" the loan half an hour before they defaulted ( missed their payment lah). Baik punya friendly banker.Kalau Cikgu Hamid tak bayar instalment depa lelong rumah. No "rescheduling" anything. The bank (which is a GLC) can now become an endangered species as well. So the bank put some conditions. The bank told the plantation giant to get a guarantee from the gomen. So they just called MOI and got a gomen guarantee. Baik punya friendly gomen. Can I have a gomen guarantee too? I want to borrow some money too. I know something about steel. Kan dulu I belajar engineer sikit. I nak buat special steels mini-mill. Weapons grade steel. Kan orang Arab suka  bunuh membunuh. Not much lah tapi mini steel mill pun about RM1.5 billion saja. Boleh tak gomen bagi  guarantee, then Bank endangered species tu pinjam RM1.5b kat saya?They rescheduled the loan but where is the cashflow to repay the loan?
column15: {Zalman A} The plantation giant has no money to pay the thousands of vendors and suppliers who do business with them. Their suppliers (especially SMEs) now have to wait up to six months to get paid for supplying materials, equipment etc. Lorry contractors have to wait 3 months or more. Some of the suppliers are facing financial difficulty. To bridge their cash shortage some of the SME suppliers have applied for bank loans - including from the same "cap endangered species" bank. Knowing that the plantation giant has defaulted the "endangered species" bank does not want to extend loans to SMEs doing business with the giant. It's double jeopardy isn't it? A huge section of the bumiputra SME supply chain is now at great risk.So online media, ask the right questions.Without anyone asking - except blogs like this one - our Pension Fund said that the plantation giant has not defaulted on their loans.  Maybe yes and no. If they could not pay the loan instalment yes it is a default. But if our friendly Pension Fund "rescheduled" their loan repayment then technically there is no default by the giant.Just like what our friendly  "cap endangered species" bank has done - they rescheduled the loan BEFORE a default could happen. So online media call the Pension Fund and ask them, "Thank you for the info. Can you confirm if you have rescheduled any loans extended to plantation giant?"Call the Pension Fund, the bank and the plantation giant as well and ask them "Is it true that some of plantation giant's loans from  Pension Fund, "endangered species bank", Ah Long, Muthupalaniappan Pillai Chettiar etc have been rescheduled?"Call and ask lah. Let's see what they say?- OSTBThe pattern is the same.a) Use mark-ups and shell companies to songlapb) When the inevitable happens, say it "taken over / backed by the govt"What does this mean?It means the rakyat has been sent the bill for the songlap and assumes the risk.
column16: {Zalman A} "PAS should focus on its allies in Gagasan Sejahtera instead of butting into the business of Pakatan Harapan (PH) component parties, its splinter Amanah said today.Selangor Amanah chairman Izham Hashim said when it came to the distribution of election seats, especially ones claimed by PKR, Amanah, who is also part of PH, should be the one to deal with it, not PAS.Izham was responding to PAS vice-president Iskandar Abdul Samad, who described Amanah as an “untrustworthy party” as it wished to contest in PKR’s seats in the next general election. Iskandar said this was akin to “stealing”.“The issue of Amanah’s alleged plan to contest in some of PKR’s seats is actually in line with the changes in the nation’s political landscape.“It may happen in the form of seat exchange among PH-PPBM components. But it will be decided jointly among us at a meeting.“Iskandar need not worry about this and, instead, he should focus on the distribution of seats among PAS’ Gagasan allies,” he said in a statement today."What of the Jan deadline to "build bridges" with PAS?Both Pakatan Rakyat and the current Oppo have poor self-discipline in making statements.One person, officially, to make statements to the media (outside of interviews, I mean).One agreed manifesto and policy.So simple.It should not be ignored.

column25: {Zalman A} Dr Dzul......"The year is coming to a close. While at least six jurisdictions are rigorously investigating and convicting those that have allegedly committed and abetted in the ‘international heist of the century’ and the biggest financial scandal in the modern world, where the money trail spans over at least 10 countries, not a whimper is heard on our own shores.Of the five countries now aggressively probing the matter, Singapore is the only one so far to have secured convictions.Besides the two former BSI bankers who have been sentenced to prison and fined for forgery and failure to report suspicious transactions, the republic convicted a third banker, a former wealth manager with the same Swiss bank BSI.Earlier, the Money Authority of Singapore (MAS) shut down two private banks - BSI and Falcon - and fined DBS Group, UBS and StandardChartered Bank for lapses in money-laundering controls.Very recently, US federal judge Dale Fischer denied postponement of the hearing in respect of documents filed by the Department of Justice (DOJ), hence denying the motion by Jho Low and his family to delay hearing on the 1MDB matter.Abu Dhabi has arrested Khadem Al-Qubaishi, ex-head of the Emirati government’s lnternational Petroleum Investment Company (IPIC) and Mohamed Badawy al-Huseiny, former head of Aabar Investments PJS, both in relation to fraud and money-laundering on 1MDB.Surprise, surprise, Second Finance Minister Johari Abdul Ghani has gone on record as commending the move by Singapore’s financial regulators to sort out money-laundering matters linked to 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB).He was reported to have commented that... “So as far as Malaysia is concerned, we are going through that process.” Now for how much longer, Honourable Minister?Simply put, is the attorney-general (AG) willing to see any legal proceedings on any one of these ‘rogues’ be instituted only after the 14th general election?The Malaysian AG, however, has very regrettably refused all assistance to other countries conducting the 1MDB investigation. In the same vein, he is similarly not willing to be assisted by any other authorities."The better question to ask is, who can take the blame?Only PDRM are "on the case" (or are they?)Who will they arrest?Shahrol Halmi? Cannot be the mastermind.Board of Directors? They were allowed to escape through the back door, and some are not resuming stealing on behalf of MO1.MO1 himself?The hand-picked barua2 of MO1 are there to cover crime, not solve it.
column26: {hihwag} Najib has continued to use his billions to pay local supporters, as leaked evidence from his bank accounts shows.Numerous cheques have been drawn from his slush funds to individuals from his party – the office holders whose votes support his continuing position in power.  In return, these individuals have chosen to believe Najib’s excuses for his money, including his explanation that it came from a small time royal from Saudi Arabia, (one AbdulAziz al Saud, who has connections with PetroSaudi).  Najib says it was AbdulAziz who passed him the $681 million dollars as a “donation”, plus the many other earlier payments into his account – including a further $170 million paid in November 2011 from SRC. He also claims that he returned most of the money via Tanore, although the DOJ say the money was traced to laundering in the states.Malaysia’s ruling elite is therefore entering 2017 entrenched in this corrupt collaboration with a leader, who has stolen the money they are enjoying from the public purse.As the economy groans and foreign investor confidence evaporates, this group are clearly further planning to squeeze one last dollop from Malaysia’s public funds. Yet another $680 million is the payment being offered by FELDA to buy out Eagle Plantations from Najib’s close friend the Indonesian businessman Peter Sondakh in a blatant further deal to pad out UMNO’s pre-election purse at the expense of Malaysia’s poorest farmers.The logic is that if Najib can manage to again buy the next election he will at last be able to put behind him the scandal that after two years has refused to go away, ignore the foreign critics and be safe from justice at last.Will he succeed?The answer will come in 2017…. probably.

column28: {sukasamasuka} Datuk.Beberapa jam lagi kita menyambut Tahun Baru 2017.Macam ada suatu perasaan bahawa tahun depan membawa lagi banyak kesedihan...kemurungan...bahawa Malaysia ini bukan lagi sebuah negara yang kita tahu selama ini.There is a sense of lawlessness...perasaan tiada undang undang dimana pembesar2 negara bolih membuat sesuka hati mereka...yang paling atas terus hidup mewah dalam istana impian...above the law.Kami ini pula macam semut...orang kecil...risau...harga barang making mahal...kena beli baju2 sekolah...buku...kasut...pensil...beg sekolah...lebih duit pergi kedai "barang bundle", barang buangan tapi masih bolih pakai juga la sebab kami kurang mampu...begitu la kalau belanja duit titik peluh sendiri.Orang UMNO ambil duit kami...pakai cukai GST...suka suka hati belanja...tidak ada ka undang2 lagi ka di bumi Malaysia ini?Tahun Baru 2017 tidak ada apa apa untuk orang macam kami.Bagi orang2 pembangkang...kamu sama saja macam UMNO.Tahun 2017 bukan untuk kamu...begitu juga 2018!...biar la apa yang ada...mungkin tiada.
column29: {Taosuo} On the sidelines, there appeared to be some low level "friendly fire" between Kak Wan and Dr Mahathir on whether BRIM handouts is bribery or not.In Islam, the key word is intention or 'niat'. If the money from the government's coffers is intended to buy support from the dreadfully poor, and the recipient feels obligated and do vote the BN as per the dogma "you help me and I help you"...then it is certainly bribery.On the other hand, if the recipient takes the money, sniffed a stench of possible buying of votes, and to affirm and register his/her repugnance and contempt for such endeavours, goes and votes for the opposition, then he is certainly not party.The BN expectedly is of course pleading good intentions but from my observations, this time around, not many are buying it.
column30: {Taosuo} On the sidelines, there appeared to be some low level "friendly fire" between Kak Wan(PKR) and Dr Mahathir on whether BRIM handouts is bribery or not.In Islam, the key word is intention or 'niat'. If the money from the government's coffers is intended to buy support from the dreadfully and desperately poor, and the not so poor, and the recipient feels obligated or beholden and do vote the BN as per the dogma "you help me and I help you"...then it is certainly bribery.On the other hand, if the recipient takes the money, sniffed a stench of possible vote buying and to affirm and register his/her repugnance and contempt for such endeavours, goes and votes for the opposition, then he/she is certainly not party.The BN expectedly is of course protesting good intentions but from my observations, this time around, not many are buying it. Yet, targeted groups like Felda settlers, some urban poor, the 'civil' service, village apparat including mosque officials, including from Sabah and Sarawak  etc may be coming in for further special 'considerations'... for which some of the anti corruption people is expected to not give a damn.
column31: {Jesse Labi} Salam,Dipetik dari komen dalam blog Shahbudin dot.comJAWABAN NAIK HAJI DARI FEE PROYEKPertama, sah atau tidaknya ibadah haji tidak terkait langsung dengan asal muasal uang yang dipakai untuk haji. Tetapi lebih terkait pada apakah pelaku haji itu memenuhi dan melaksanakan syarat dan rukun haji dengan baik serta tidak melakukan sesuatu yang membatalkan ibadah haji. Syarat, rukun dan yang membatalkan haji lihat: http://www.alkhoirot.net/2012/09/panduan-haji.html Jadi, asal sudah terpenuhi syarat rukun, maka hajinya sah dan tidak ada lagi kewajiban untuk mengulangi haji walaupun seandainya uang yang dipakai berasal dari uang haram. Ini sama dengan orang shalat wajib yang memakai baju hasil mencuri, shalatnya tetap sah asal terpenuhi syarat dan rukunnya dan tidak ada kewajiban untuk qadha (mengganti) shalat.Namun demikian, apabila uang yang dipakai untuk haji berasal dari uang haram, maka amal ibadahnya hampir pasti tidak diterima oleh Allah. Itu artinya, ia tidak akan mendapatkan haji mambrur. Imam Nawawi dalam kitab Al-Majmuk VII/62 ??? ?? ???? ???? ??? ??? ??? ?????? ? ??? ??? ???? ??????? ??? . ????? (Apabila seseorang berhaji dengan harta yang haram maka ia berdosa, tetapi hajinya tetap sah. Ini pendapat mayoritas ulama fiqih.)Dalam kitab Al-Mausu'ah al-Fiqhiyah (Ensiklopedi Fiqh) XVII/131 dijelaskan: ?????? ????? ??????? ????? ???????? ???? ??????? ????????? ????? ??????? ??? ??????? ????????? , ????????? ????? ???????? ?????? ?????????? , ??????? ???????? ????????????? ????????? , ??????? ????????? ????? ???? ???????????? ???????????? ???? ????????? ??????????? (Artinya: Apabila seseorang naik haji dengan harta syubhat atau hasil ghasab maka hajinya tetap sah akan tetapi ia berdosa tidak akan mendapatkan haji mabrur. Ini adalah pendapat madzhab Syafi'i, Malik, Abu Hanifah dan mayoritas ulama Salaf)
column32: {hihwag} There is really no evidence that the opposition can overthrow this kleptocratic regime or if the variables mentioned in the articles would fall into place, thereby facilitating a Harapan victory.This is not meant as an attack but rather a rejoinder that we are sailing through very dangerous waters and if we do not get our act together and move beyond simply cheerleading a disorganised opposition, we could end up in a whole world of hurt.1) Umno has always suffered electoral setbacks when faced with a cohesive opposition. As it is, the opposition is in disarray. PAS is a spoiler made worse by the reality that PKR needs them to remain politically relevant.2) Recent by elections have demonstrated that Bersatu or at least the personalities behind them and Amanah have not gained traction with the demographic that keeps Umno in power.3) The issue of corruption plays well with the urban demographic but again for various reasons has not become an issue with rural demographic. If Umno delivers everything it says it will deliver, the cycle of complicity will continue. Disenfranchised people will continue voting for a regime which puts rice in their bowls. I am not talking about the urban class but rather those people who have depended on real power, federal power exercised corruptly for their benefit. That is the culture some people forget that we are dealing with. We nurtured this culture.4) Felda settlers unfortunately are not easily moved by corruption scandals only because they have weathered such scandals over the long Umno watch. If the Najib regime can find a way to assuage their grievances, then they will remain firmly in the Umno camp. And since Umno has always found a way to placate this demographic and keep a tight lid on anyone attempting to proselytise to them, I do not think that banking on them would be beneficial to Harapan.5) The younger generation of Malay voters are a promising demographic but they are currently embroiled in a culture war that consumes most of their energy and effort.Young Malay oppositional types not only have to contend with the Umno regime but they also have to contend with the Islamic forces in this country with no help whatsoever from mainstream Malay political parties or non-Malay political parties who do not view them as part of a new deal but merely a specific racial demographic needed to win the throne of Putrajaya.6) Race and religion. While my views on these issues are spread across various articles, I think there are deeper issues here than just Umno spreading racial and religious discord. I think that Umno is the main purveyor or racial and religious disharmony but I do think that what the opposition keeps running into a deep-rooted cultural and historical issues from within Pakatan that they have not dealt with hence are not able to come up with a convincing strategy to win over the majority Malay demographic.7) Finally, the native voters of Sabah and Sarawak. I would not put much faith in them. They really do have problems that most peninsular Malaysians have no idea of.
column33: {Zalman A} Datuk,What of Jauary deadline to get PAS on board?If I were MO1, I would be supremely confident of another 5 years in power. Or more."PAS has challenged Amanah to take them head on if the splinter party harbours dreams of replacing the Islamist party in its constituencies.Selangor PAS commissioner Iskandar Abdul Samad said in a statement today that Amanah must not ask other parties to take on PAS in its constituencies in the coming general election (GE14).Prior to this, Selangor Amanah said it would contest the 20 state assembly and seven parliamentary seats in Selangor that PAS contested in previously.However, last month Federal Territory Amanah chairman Dr Mohd Hatta Ramli said Amanah would take on PAS in all seats the latter contested in.Iskandar said PAS did not have a problem if Amanah wanted to contest in seats that PAS had won or contested in as it was a democracy, but said the party should take on PAS head on if it aimed to replace it.He added PAS was ready to face a new political landscape and venture into new territories if an electoral pact to ensure straight fights between the opposition and Barisan Nasional could not be reached.“If there is an agreement for a straight fight, PAS will respect that, if there is to be a free for all, then we are ready.”
column34: {Aku}  Kadiag, salaam.Dua tiga hari ni heboh sikit pasai Mat Tehag usui pekara 1MDB dok belanja orang2 pi ke tanah suci. Teruih terang aku nak bagitau  aku tak la sokong dia sangat dan besa dizaman dolu2 betengkag dgn dia bawah satu pokok moktan pada satu maghrib... aku lebih kamcheng dgn almarhum abang dia. Yg aku nak bagitau aku setuju jugak apa yg Mat Tehag kata ni pasai kedudukkan 1MDB ramai orang pon dah tau banyak begelumang dgn riba' secara terang2 dan dok kelepiag duit Malaya....ribu2 juta.Rosulullah S.A.W. sangat tegaih melarang perkara2 subahah, satu2nya melalui satu hadith yg femes yg bemaksud:" halal sudah jelas dan yang haram juga sudah jelas. Namun diantara keduanya ada perkara yang syubhat (samar). Maka barangsiapa yang meninggalkan perkara yang samar karena khawatir mendapat dosa, berarti dia telah meninggalkan perkara yang jelas keharamannya dan siapa yang banyak berdekatan dengan perkara samar maka dikhawatirkan dia akan jatuh pada perbuatan yang haram tersebut. Maksiat adalah larangan-larangan Allah. Maka siapa yang berada di dekat larangan Allah itu dikhawatirkan dia akan jatuh pada larangan tersebut".(Imam Bukhari).Pada aku la yg sangat jahe ni, dlm al Qur an pon ada bagitau, macam perangai iblis, tak mau masuk neraka sorang2 tapi nak bawak sekali member (anak cucu Adam) ramai2, seperti dlm suroh al-A'rof ayat 16 dan 17 yg maksud dia lebih korang :         “Iblis menjawab: ‘Karena Engkau telah menghukum saya tersesat, saya benar-benar akan menghalangi-halangi mereka dari jalan Engkau yang lurus, kemudian saya akan mendatangi mereka dari muka dan dari belakang mereka, dari kanan dan dari kiri mereka. Dan Engkau tidak akan mendapati kebanyakan mereka bersyukur (taat).’” (al-A’raaf: 16-17)(tafsir Ibnu Katsir dari alquranmulia.wordpress.com.Dan Allah saja maha tau.Aku

column38: {Zed-85} Sallam Dato’Kalau ikutkan pilihanraya lepas, kata depa “Rakyat didahulukan, pencapaian diutamakan”Sekarang ini nampaknya dalam sudut ekonomi, rakyat dalam kerugian. Saham Felda merudum, nilai matawang pun merudum, sekarang sudah cecah 1 dolar menjadi RM 4.50. Duit Singapore 1 dolar menjadi RM3 lebih. Saya tukar wang di Thailand, RM100 dapat 790 baht sahaja. Saya jumpa pelancong dari Malaysia banyak yang merungut duit Malaysia jatuh teruk.Saham ASB pun dapat 7.25% dengan bonus (0.5%).Saya beritahu pegawai bank , dalam sejarah Malaysia, ini tahun yang paling teruk. Pegawai bank bisikkan kepada saya, orang melayu kena sabar.  Katanya, mungkin Wahid Omar tidak berikan banyak mungkin kerana nanti yang melabor di Saham Wawasan, Saham Didik pun kena bagi banyak juga. Oleh itu memadai, dividen sedikit sahaja.Saya setuju sahaja dengan pegawai bank tapi dalam hati saya memang baik sifat sabar, tetapi ada perbezaan antara sifat sabar dan sifat bodoh. Orang melayu kita perlu bezakan yang mana satu sifat sabar dan yang mana satu sifat bodoh. Jangan dicamporkan.

column0: Penjualan Oleh KWSP Sumpahan Ke Atas FGV
column3: {Zalman A} KUALA LUMPUR (Dec 23): Datuk Seri Nazir Razak, chairman of CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and younger brother of Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak, today questioned Federal Land Development Authority's (Felda) acquisition of a 37% stake in Indonesia's PT Eagle High Plantations Tbk for US$505.4 million (RM2.26 billion).Nazir posted a black-and-white photograph on his Instagram this evening of his father — the late prime minister Tun Abdul Razak Hussein –  addressing a group of people, presumably early Felda settlers.The photograph was uploaded on Instagram together with the message: "Felda announced buying 37% of Eagle High for US$505m or 580 rupiah per share. Eagle High's average price in November was 212 rupiah per share, so a 173% premium for a non-control stake. I hope the board will fully justify the acquisition & valuation even though the deal is no longer made by listed FGV (Felda Global Ventures Bhd)."Garnering 173 “likes” at the time of writing, one of Nazir’s followers wrote, "Pity to the settlers. Felda no longer looking after the poor but only serve the elites."Datuk,We are going to see the complete breakdown of governance if MO1 is around for much longer.If you steal once, you will steal again.He is becoming reckless and shameless.I hear a mega-dose of dedak is being prepared by the gomen for the oghang Felda, so that they do not do anything rational next year, such as vote against the Bugis thief.We must learn as a nation that accepting short term rewards but prolonging corruption is not worth it.If the robber takes RM10,000 from your house and then places RM500 of it on your doorstep, there is no reason to be thankful.But that is how we think.That is why BR1M (Bribe Rakyat 1Mappadulung) still "works".

column8: {Aku} Kadiag, salaam.Aku tempek balik perenggan kedua terakiag coretan hang padaDECEMBER 24, 2016 bertajok:Penjualan Oleh KWSP Sumpahan Ke Atas FGV"Kesimpulannya, apa yang telah kita ketahui mengenai 1MDB dan FGV hanyalah sebahagian kecil sahaja daripada kemelut korporat yang sedang berlaku di negara kita akibat urus tadbir yang menyeleweng serta campur tangan songsang oleh pentadbiran ------" Aku setuju sangat apa yg hang 'coret' ni. Aku rasa memang la yg kita tau pasai selingkohan ni sangat sikit, munkin macam kata Mat Saleh, "tip of the iceberg " saja.Lepaih tu perenggan hang yg terakiag, aku tempek:"Hal ini menjadi semakin buruk akibat kelembapan ekonomi dunia dan domestik yang berpanjangan serta tidak adanya petunjuk positif daripada kerajaan mengenai bagaimana kemelut yang semakin meruncing itu ditangani."Aku nak tanya hang pasai "tidak ada petunjuk positif dari kerajaan..." pasai aku rasa soalan ni macam katun sikit. Petama, hang nulih apa yg kita tau memang sikit. Kalu depa nak bagi "petunjuk positif" depa kenalah dedah semoa selingkohan yg depa buat .. Dari mola sampai akiag. Yg sikit yg kita tau pon depa dok OSA dan dok buat macam2 punya auta, takkan yg lain depa nak dedah...?Nombog dua, aku rasa sekali pon depa nak hurai yg dok ada depan mata ni, nampak macam depa takkan upaya.... antara lain rahmat untok becakap benag pon munkin dah ditarek balik. Semoga Allah S.W.T. lindong kita dari jadi macam tu.Macam mana pon, terima kasih banyak Kadiag pasai coret hang kali ni tonjoikan satu lagi dalam siri  'kejengkelan" depa dlm merosakkan satu  tiang sosioekonomi malaya, yg baru belajag berangkak rangkak, ...buleh meleleh ayag mata....Allah saja yg balaih jasa baik hang.Maghap no.Aku

column10: {jumbeaux} Salam Datuk Entah apa dosa kita sampai Allah turunkan bala sebegini rupa. Kita di takdirkan mempunyai pemimpin-pemimpin Melayu yang tamak haloba. Ditutup hati-hati mereka dari hidayah Nya.Apa yang berlaku di dalam Felda, MARA dan institusi-institusi perbadanan yang lain membuktikan bahawa badan-badan ini sudah lari dari matlamat asal pembentukan mereka. Malah telah langsung tergelincir dari landasan sebenar.Sedang mereka bermegah dengan jual beli harta di luar negara; rakyat, terutamanya orang Melayu, kembali miskin, lemah tidak berdaya dan menjadi golongan peminta sedekah (dari BR1M). Anehnya, bila kita bersuara membantah tindak tanduk mereka, kita pula yang dituduh sebagai pengkhianat bangsa.Jalan penyelesaian nya mudah. Pemimpin-pemimpin ini dan pentadbir-pentadbir "nouveau riche" yang bergantung kepada mereka harus dijatuhkan segera. Saya percaya masih ada orang Melayu yang bertanggungjawab dan kasihkan bangsa, agama dan negara yang mampu memimpin dengan lebih baik dari golongan yang lupa diri ini.
column11: {A KADIR JASIN} 1. Pembahas Zalman A memetik berita 23 Desember yang antara lain berkata, Datuk Seri Nazir Razak, chairman of CIMB Group Holdings Bhd and younger brother of Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak, today questioned Federal Land Development Authority's (Felda) acquisition of a 37% stake in Indonesia's PT Eagle High Plantations Tbk for US$505.4 million (RM2.26 billion).    Nazir posted a black-and-white photograph on his Instagram this evening of his father — the late prime minister Tun Abdul Razak Hussein – addressing a group of people, presumably early Felda settlers.2. Saya setuju tapi tak mengluas mengenai pembelian Eagle High oleh Felda sebab saya sudah ulas banyak kali. Dalam tulisan 13 Jun, 2015, saya antara lain berkata:"10. Sudah menjadi pengetahuan umum di kalangan penggiat korporat dan pemerhati politik bahawa Sondakh sangat akrab dengan Perdana Menteri, Mohd Najib Abdul Razak, dan isterinya, Rosmah Mansor. Sejak 2010 Sondakh dikatakan menjadi "penasihat" Mohd Najib mengenai Indonesia.11. Keakraban ini dikatakan menjadi pemangkin kepada pelaburan mewah Sondakh dalam projek pembinaan hotel St Regis dan pusat konvensyen antarabangsa Langkawi. Sumber-sumber perbankan mendakwa Sondakh mendapat pembiayaan mudah daripada institusi kewangan milik kerajaan Malaysia."3. FGV dah teruk jadi tak dapat teruskan pembelian. Najib kerahkan guna Felda pula. Beli tetap beli kerana Najib terhutang budi kepada Sandokh. Orang yang tahu geopolitik Najib di Indonesia tahu apa yang Sandokh lakukan untuk Najib dalam skandal 1MDB.4. Pembeliaan ini membantu Sandokh dalam jangka waktu segera lebih daripada membawa kebaikan kepada peneroka Felda dan Malaysia.5. Mohon kepada Allah apabila kita mengubah pemerintahan negara secara sah melalui pilihan raya, semua jenayah ekonomi yang sedang berlaku sekarang akan disiasat dan yang bertanggungjawab akan diambil tindakan.InsyaAllah.

column14: {A KADIR JASIN} 1. Tuan Punahsihat, sembahyang hajat bagus. Yang tak bagus solah jahat. Saya tak berapa faham solat hajat perdana. Perdana kerana besar atau perdana kerana Perdana Menteri.Dan pasal apa hanya sampai PRU ke-14? Bukankah solat, tak kira jenis apa, adalah selagi ada hayat?2. Zaman saya kanak-kanak di kampung, kita kerap buat sembahyang hajat. Yang saya ingat sekali sembahyang hajat minta hujan. Kita buat atas padang ragut lepas Asar sebelum Maghrib disusuli kenduri pulut kunyit dan pulut minyak.3. Berkenaan lebai dan lebai musang, Allahyarham ayah saya masa hidupnya selalu kata, kalau percaya bulat-bulat kepada tok guru dan tok lebai, buah nangka pun kita sedekahkan.4. Ini cerita tok guru yang baru kahwin bini muda anak dara. Bini muda selalu dengar tok guru ajar anak muridnya kalau nak sedekah, sedekahlah harta yang kita paling sayang. Lagi sayang, lagi besar pahala. Itulah yang tok guru ulang. Sedekah harta yang paling kita sayangi. Isteri muda itu pun adalah hasil sedekah yang paling disayangi.5. Selain isteri muda, satu harta yang tok guru paling sayang ialah buah nangka sulungnya di belakang rumah. Satu hari dua, tiga kali dibeleknya.6. Satu petang tok guru terkejut besar hampir kena serangan jantung bila buah nangka sulung kesayangannya sudah tidak ada di pokok.7. Meluru dia balik bertanya isteri mudanya: "Adik, mana buah nangka abang?" dia tercungap bertanya.8. Dengan suara penuh gembira dan manja isteri muda menjawab: "Cik tau abang aji sayang buah nangka tu. Cik ikut la nasihat abang aji la. Cik sedekah kat orang susah yang mai minta sedekah tadi!"9. Tok guru dengan suara lantang campur berang berkata: "Laaaa.... awat buat macam tu. Yang abang aji kata sedekah benda kesayangan tu bukan kita. Itu untuk orang lain yang mai mengaji dengan abang aji!"10. Kesimpulannya bukan semua tok guru, tuan guru, tok haji dan tok lebai berjuang kerana Allah. Berjuang kerana nangka pun ramai juga.Wallahuaklam.

column20: {Naj} Kaunter FGV adalah salah satu kaunter yang saya kerap perhatikan; sebenarnya kaunter ini pernah jatuh lebih teruk sekitar Ogos 2015 (RM 1.26). Saya percaya penganalisis carta mungkin menjangkakan kenaikan bagi kaunter ini dalam jangkamasa panjang kerana nampak gaya macam ada dokongan (support), mungkin saya salah (kena perhatikan sekurang-kurangnya sehingga Feb/Mac 2017). FGV mensasarkan penanaman semula kelapa sawit sekitar 15kh setahun dan (sekiranya benar carta menaik) mungkin ini faktor jangka panjang yang mengadakan dokongan tersebut.Kaunter FGV mengalami kenaikan bermula sekitar pertengahan tahun ini (saya fikir) atas sebab pertukaran dari segi kepemimpinan (dan beberapa rombakan bagi menurunkan kos) dan beberapa perkembangan dalam dunia minyak sawit dan/atau gula (contohnya pembatalan cukai oleh negara Perancis). column28: {Zalman A} Anina Saadudin has been removed as head of Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia’s (PPBM) women’s wing, but questions remain whether she was sacked, with party officials saying she had never been appointed in the first place.The outspoken former Langkawi Umno member, however, insisted that she was sacked, a claim disputed by PPBM information chief Kamarudin Md Nor.Anina said she had spoken to party deputy president Mukhriz Mahathir and secretary-general Shahruddin Md Salleh, who confirmed the decision to remove her.“They said I wasn’t recommended by the presidential council to be appointed as Srikandi’s chief,” she said, referring to the wing’s name.Anina said she had taken an oath for the post on Nov 2, adding that this formally made her the Srikandi chief.When contacted, Kamarudin said Anina had never been appointed and that her oath-taking was a “technical error”.Datuk,The Opposition has enough dramas already.From now on, no infighting please.And time for joint policies  - beyond merely removing MO1.Does the PM need to be disclosed? Of course.And a shadow cabinet.Surely 4 (or 5?) parties can muster better people than Mat Maslan, Kok Pasir Salak and Datuk Seri I Mappadulung Daeng Mattimung Karaeng Sandrobone Sultan Abdul Jalil?What "quality" do these people have?

column31: {ismail muda} Datuk, saya lencong sikit kpd isu pembelian saham Rajawali oleh Felda yg hangat sehari dua ini. Sejak tahun 2009, pemilik Rajawali yg jugak rakan karib MOI, sudah merengek supaya felda beli tanah di Papua & Sulawesi. Ketika itu FGV belum listing & baru diujudkan dan dimiliki sepenuhnya oleh felda.Selepas dibuat due dig, harga yg ditawarkan terlalu mahal & cadangan pembelian dibatalkan. Beberapa tawaran dibuat selepas itu termasuk difahamkan kpd PNB, Sime Darby dll...jugak ditolak sebab mahal. Rajawali merengek lagi pada tahun lalu dgn FGV & ditolak setelah bantahan pemegang saham. Rupanya dalam senyap2, Felda berunding pulak dgn Rajawali utk mengambil aleh 37% saham dlm Eagle. Kali ini menerusi badan pelaburan felda iaitu Felda Invest Corp. Semua org tahu, Pengerusi FGV,  Pngerusi Felda, Pengerusi FIC, Pengerusi Felda Asset, Pngerusi segala Pengerusi dlm felda & FGV group adalah orang yg sama. Ternampak MOI lebih pentingkan kawan daripada menjaga kepentingan penroka & perniagaan yg pemegang sahamnya termasuk lah Tab Hj Kwap Kerajaan Phg Sabah dll. Kontrak Pengerusi felda tamat 31 Dis. Kabarnya banyak projek besar yg sedang berjalan. termasuk meruntuhkan bangunan2 Dewan Perdana, Heliconia, felda Dvilla, Wisma Felda, Anjung felda dll. Ada benda menarik dlm projek meruntuhkan bangunan ini & membina semula bangunan taraf pencakar langit. Oleh sbb itu apa cara sekalipun, Pengerusi skrg akan patuh pada arahan utk beli Eagle. Perniagaan FGv & kepentingan perniagaan FGV bukan tumpuan utama dlm kepala Pengrusi. Demikian juga MO1 yg menjaga felda, tugasnya menjaga penroka semakin terabai
column32: {Zalman A} KUALA LUMPUR, Dec 26 — PKR deputy president Datuk Seri Mohamed Azmin Ali has the potential to be prime minister if the Opposition bloc wins the next general elections, Datuk Khairuddin Abu Hassan said today.Khairuddin, one of the founding members of Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) but has since left the party, said Azmin has an excellent track record when it comes to managing Selangor as its mentri besar.“He has an excellent track record, so much so the Selangor state government has a RM4.1 billion surplus under his administration,” he said in a statement.“His image is very good among the grassroots and people accept his leadership,” he added.Putting “young and dynamic” candidates such as Azmin as its frontman would help ensure Pakatan Harapan wins in the next general elections, according to Khairuddin.At 52, Azmin is one of the younger Opposition leaders to have been touted as prime minister material compared to others, like PPBM president Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin, 69. Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim who has so far been maintained as the Opposition pact’s pick as PM-designate despite being incarcerated, is also 69.Khairuddin also urged PPBM, which he left after just two months of helping form the party, to be fair to all its members following the alleged removal of Anina Saadudin as the head of its women’s wing (Srikandi).The problem with Malay voters is that they are very easy to distract.Race, religion, a few fake scandals, some gossip.They are not good at focusing on real issues.Time is very short now.Yet, there is no sign of the Opposition putting up a united front.Once BN wins 2/3 majority in PRU14, and then gerrymanders the boundaries to their hearts' content, what then?The Bugis thief can rule for 23 years, no problem.

column37: {ismail muda} Datuk, saya amat mempercayai yg KWSP telah membuat penelitian & pemerhatian hal pengurusan FGV, seterusnya ambil keputusan menarik diri dari melabur dlm FGV.
